Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: OPClean
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. Clean, pleasant decor. Very friendly staff. Excellent breakfast buffet. Had lunch poolside one afternoon, pleasantly surprised with quality of food. Pool area nice with plenty of chairs. Shuttle to downtown area was ok, because of wait we opted to drive ourselves most of the time. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: krammerdog
Reviews.Content: helpful staff shuttle to duval street and sunset celebration - excellent - saved on parking headaches one more check off the bucket list

Reviews.Title: “The friendly Doubletree. Great stay. Clean comfortable room. Best customer service we have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: GumperOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this lovely resort for two days in March. The level of service was above and beyond what we expected. The staff has to be the most down to earth and friendly people we have ever encountered in a hotel. Every staff member we encountered, even ones in the hall busy with their daily routine, had something friendly to say or just ackowledged you with a hello. The facilites were well looked after. The rooms were clean and the bed very comfortable. Only minor complaint was the noise of A/C, but this was trival compared to the overall experience. Only other complaint was the cookies. They're too warm, too accessible and too many calories. Ah well, I guess that's why they have a great gym facility down the hall I suppose. Considering where the property is compared to downtown Key West, the free shuttle is a great bonus. We found the service on time and well run. One of the drivers even let us off at his favourite breakfast haunt one morning, Banana Cafe- great breakfast with a European flair. Plus driver offered tips about other places not to miss, it was like having our own private tour guide. This Doubltree will surely be our 'go to' hotel next time we stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Alice F
Reviews.Content: My husband sent myself and a childhood friend to Key West for a Mom's get away. We had such an AWESOME TIME. I would love to know EXACTLY the brand/model of their mattresses. Have never slept so well in my life. Also every morning we enjoyed THE BREAKFAST BUFFET and straight to the pool. WHAT an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: djfiowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the beginning of March, prime time season, and although the rates were fairly high, they were in line with what other places in Key West were charging at the same time. We made use of the shuttle and found the hotel in general to be a wonderful place to stay. We had a room overlooking the pool with a nice (small) balcony. The pool area was very nice. We had prime rib at the hotel one night, and it was delicious. Even as HH members we did not get a "free" breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was good, but was fairly pricey. Overall, we found the staff, both inside and outside, to be very friendly and accommodating, and we also found the room to be very nice. I would recommend it to people who prefer to be a little further from where the action is on Duval Street and who do not mind using the shuttle back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: djack7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week while enjoying Key West. Its location away from the center made it a perfect place to relax. We utilized bicycles to explore the island and the hotel shuttle for easy returns. We enjoyed our daily breakfast on the patio each morning. The hotel's wireless service was a significant problem. It was very ineffective. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: Jetscot
Reviews.Content: Our family love this small hotel in Key West. I can't comment on price as we have always used HH points. The hotel is a distance from town, but there is an hourly free shuttle that runs till 11.30pm. The hotel also has a free shuttle to and from the airport - about 5 minutes away. The food is very good and you can dine indoors or on the outdoor patio. There is a small outdoor bar, which serves the pool area. Very nice pool, with a gently sloping area at the back, which is great for children. There is a volleyball court on sand, but any time we have stayed, the kids have had more fun there. We have always had a room overlooking the pool, but the balcony is tiny. Very quiet at night which suits us! Hotel has a guest laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: moocow34
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel on a rewards stay after staying at the Travelodge for three nights (also on a rewards stay). The rooms are quite small, but clean. Not very many TV channels to choose from. Rooms have no view and no balcony. The staff was not very friendly, some of them were almost snobby. Not what I'm used to when staying at a Doubletree. The pool and bar area are very very nice. That was the best part of the stay. Overall though, I would rather stay at the Travelodge where you get a two bedroom suite for the same price as a plain old double at the Doubletree and you don't have to pay for parking at the Travelodge. It's a nice enough hotel, but just not that great of a value compared to some other places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: eskimoroll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We booked a queen and got an upgrade to a nicer room with a king size bed. the reception staff was very friendly and did not charge us for the parking. We were very happy with the breakfast and the pool area. We used the shuttle several times each day. Loved the cookies and the large fish tank in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics right, but missing a special touch”
Reviews.Author: ChristoNL
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Doubletree Grand Resort. Clean, spacious rooms (liked the 2-bedroom lock-off suite with living room/kitchen- would be great for couples or families traveling together!), and a great breakfast buffet with fresh belgian waffle bar (make them yourself!) - complimentary for HHonors members (together with free parking, free internet, daily newspaper and the cookie). Beautiful pool-side seating in good weather. Coffee/tea service in the rooms. Helpful, friendly staff (though housekeeping was in the habit of shouting at each other in the halls, which was unpleasant), and the shuttle downtown is awesome, stopping at each end of Duval Street and also honoring special requests. So all the basics of a great stay are there, but it was missing that extra something special that would launch it out of the Doubletree category and into the true Hilton experience. It's starting to feel a bit dated, and the rooms, while clean, are sparsely appointed. For the price we paid, I expected more - but it was probably because we were at the beginning of spring break. All in all, worth the trip, but if you're an experience traveler, you'll know what I mean when I say it's missing the "polish". And BTW, we experienced minimal issues with airport noise - only heard 2 when sitting at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Anne R
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this great hotel. Beautiful pool, clean comfortable rooms and very friendly, helpful staff. I think that above all the great staff really make this place special.The Breakfast Buffet every morning was wonderful, especially the croissants, just like in Paris! We also enjoyed the Lunch menu and Bar. The shuttle to down town was a great help, no need for a car, we could get to all the Restaurants, Bars and Shops. The pool area is very large and kept super clean by Oscar, while Mike makes sure that everyone has ice cold water. There are always lots and lots of clean, fresh pool towels. There is a nice shallow area for toddlers, and even two iguanas for excitement. We have stayed here before, and will definately stay here every time we are in Key West. We really enjoyed the warm cookies!There are just a few things that should be done to make this Hotel perfect; add another bus and have the shuttle go to downtown every half hour, take the fake eggs off the buffet and do real ones, make sure the bacon is always crispy. A great hotel and wonderful holiday

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalkerPaRanger
Reviews.Content: just stayed at Doubletree first week of march and had great time room was spotless ,breakfast buffet was huge with lots of options , poolbar makes great frozen drinks but could stay open a little later than 11. pool is great and pool attendents are right on the spot with drinks , shuttle every hour to Duval street is nice a taxi from downtown will cost you 20.00 with tip . Dont plan on checking in to early most guests stay late and might not get your room until 3 or so . dont woory just hang out at pool bar like we did . nice sights .

Reviews.Title: “double grand key resort”
Reviews.Author: johnM r
Reviews.Content: wonderful experience at Grand Key Resort hotel near airport in 2011. First time stay in key west for full week. Super nice hotel, good service and inviting. Food is excellent and we loved being close and yet a fair distance from centretown key west. Rented one of electric cars at hotel to drive down to key west about 20 minutes drive. kids loved experience. we recommend and hope to return to see a lot more. great area, relaxing atmosphere. weather was surprising to us for august period...thought it would have been unbearable..humidity was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical splendor”
Reviews.Author: vbm534
Reviews.Content: Pulled into the Double Tree in Key West and thought(after many visits in b & b's), another 'hotel'. Ah, but this one is a tropical paradise. Beautiful lobby introduces you to the tropical wonder that is Key West. The same lobby and pool area is transformed for breakfast when you get a great, hot, variety, to be enjoyed indoors in a spacious room or under the umbrella'd poolside tables. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Say hi to Bonnie if you can find her behind the work walls!! LOL The room was clean, modern, bright and tropically cheery. A very enjoyable stay! I definitely would recommend this place AND I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Room great,staff friendly,pool fabulous,food and drink good, Cookies the best,would absolutely stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine O
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and large, balcony overlooked the pool. nice pool side bar. great, great service. staff very attentive. pool beautiful, clean, relaxing. Mike the pool guy always helpful. fresh towels and ice water. massage by the pool available. drinks and food served at pool side. great fresh baked cookies free. Food good, overall great place to stay. Not very close to town but hotel provides free shuttle every hour all day and evening back and forth to town and beach. great stay!!!! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: molly062
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in early February, very nice resort, beautiful patio and pool area. Staff was so pleasant and accomodating. When the check-in clerk heard that we were in Key West for the first time since our honeymoon (30 years ago) she comped us breakfast. Room had a pretty Key West decor, lots of staff around to help and answer questions.While not near the hub of activity in Key West, taking the complimentary shuttle worked out great and was a great plus to this property. Shuttle stops at 3 points and picks up on scheduled times. Great service! We enjoyed walking along the bike/walking path along the water near the hotel in the AM to see the sunrise. The only thing guests need to be aware is that this is a pet friendly hotel. I am not a dog lover so this was a negative for me, however all pets seemed to be confined to certain areas of the hotel. I did not experience any problems at all (noise, smell,etc) due to this policy.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: subarubin
Reviews.Content: Just left Key West yesterday and the Doubletree went beyond our expectations. We were a 6 person group with my mother in a wheelchair. The rooms were great and we had access to the pool and bar from our rooms, so easy with the wheelchair. The shuttle drivers were super to my mom and had great suggestions for dinner. All of the staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful and they did. The property is beautiful but the people who work there is what makes it outstanding. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Conch Heaven”
Reviews.Author: JulieERR
Reviews.Content: A lovely relaxing resort. 4 miles from the crowds of downtown Key West. An hourly shuttle makes everything accessible. We only ate on premise once at the outside bar -- it was very good. The pool is nice, though they could use a few more chairs. Our room had no view - next time I'll make a specific request to overlook the pool instead of the parking lot. Housekeeping was the only thing that was a bit below par. Our coffee make never got cleaned; all they did was make the bed and leave a towel. Had to ask for a face cloth. The housekeepers were hanging around our end of the hall chatting; they actually told us "we get paid to stay here until 5" and it was only 3pm at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mjsail
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights--James at the front desk gave us a spectacular first floor room right off the pool and bar area. We were never bothered by noise. The room was perfect, comfortable and beautifully decorated. We enjoyed drinks at the outdoor bar and the music duo was a pleasant touch. The free hotel shuttle to downtown area was just what we needed to access all Key West has to offer. We did not want to negotiate parking areas and traffic downtown.The grounds are beautiful and well-kept. The staff was very friendly. Several hours after we left Key West, we realized we had left some favorite shirts in the room's closet. Lorraine at the front desk is sending them to us--what more could we ask??

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile!”
Reviews.Author: tazcat49
Reviews.Content: Absolutely agree with all the previous good comments! We had a delightful 4-night stay in our pool-view room with balcony. The first cup of morning coffee sitting on the balcony listening to the palm trees rustle in the breeze and the evening glass of wine in the same place...fabulous! The hourly shuttle into town and back keeping us out of the crazy traffic...great idea! Only one 'nit pick': The breakfast buffet (free to us Gold members) was good, but expected Hilton Garden Inn/Embassy Suites style chef-prepared fresh omlettes, etc., rather than steam tables at this higher end Hilton property. These items could be ordered off the menu, but for a price. Special mention for the terrific staff at the desk, the breakfast room, all through the hotel...these folks were doing a great job and really made us feel welcome! It was a splurge for us, but well worh it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with beautiful pool area!”
Reviews.Author: MzEv2011
Reviews.Content: At first we had some issues with our room only having one King bed instead of 2 double beds, and had to move a few times, but afterwards, the hotel was very nice and the pool area was beautiful with a tropical theme and a "one man band" who was very entertaining. Free shuttle was great as we were in town for a wedding that was not at the hotel. We had several families with us, some with children and the hotel was great for them as well.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Rosetta591
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this excellent property. All the staff are professional, very friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was meticulously clean. The food was excellent and the service was superb. We very much liked the location. There was always a shuttle to take us to down town Key West. We are recommending it to our family and friends and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Brian N
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property to relax and get away from the Duval St. hub-bub. Having everything you could want in south Florida, pool, restaurant, bar and beach access combined with transportation throughout Key West makes it very comfortable and easy living. It is large, however, so you have to be willing to be patient. The facilities are sometimes busy, (front desk, bar) so there might be a small wait. I had a small suite that had a nice balcony overlooking the pool area which provided a wonderful sitting area to relax and enjoy the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Vibrating rooms due to laundry machines can grow old.”
Reviews.Author: gzbyrne
Reviews.Content: I used points to get three nights at the doubletree in key west. Room shook whenever laundry machines were used. We had room 463 but dont know if it affected other rooms. We had to call the front desk each time it happened and they would turn the machines off. Asked manager (Kevin) to keep them off and he argued with me that calling down and waiting to have the machines turned off should be acceptable. No replenishment of soap/shampoo--guess that needs a separate call too. Shuttles only run once an hour and too far to walk to main drag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: mikels24
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. The food was excellent,the staff was great, the room was clean and very comfortable. The location was not great but the free shuttle made up for location. One of the shuttles we took was full and a hotel employee took those that wouldnt fit on the hotel van and they were there right behind us. We rented our scooter right on site and they delivered to us and we just turned our keys in right at the hotel. The pool bar was nice and stayed open late and had live entertainment one of the nights we were there. I dont write alot of reviews but this hotel and our experience deserved a minute of my time to share what a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around everything!”
Reviews.Author: Klove007
Reviews.Content: Loved this whole hotel experience staying at this Hilton resort, was staying free on points for 3 nights/4 days with two young children aged 4, 1 and my wife. Everyone throughout the whole hotel looked like they enjoyed their job and was always asking if we could do anything else to make us enjoy our stay even more. As a Hilton Diamond member we were upgraded to a junior suite on points, were given free breakfast buffet coupons for my wife and I + kids ate free at the resort. I was also surprised that they offered free parking to their Diamond guests which is a normal 10.00$/day charge. Shuttle services was great and we were away from the noise of Duval street, was perfect for our family outings.

Reviews.Title: “James 3”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: Front desk were very fast in checking us in gave out the best cookies anywhere, the room was very clean and the towels were great in the bathroom, the Breakfast Buffet was great and the food very good, Only thing wish the pool was non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: Josh_P271
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at Grand Key and can't wait to go back. The front desk staff and bellman were very friendly and the shuttle service is great and very convenient. Our main driver Joseph really made our stay great. He was very knowledgeable of the things to do and best places to go in the area.Thanks to the staff, we truly had a blast in key West and will definelty be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Barb K
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our sixth year of staying at the Grand Key and already look forward to our trip next year. We have found over the years not only a lovely place to stay (we like the Jr. Suites overlooking the pool) but have found the staff to be exceptional! It has become almost like returning to see old friends every year. The free shuttle service to Old Town runs on the hour basically eliminating the need for a car for us while in Key West. We like the food at Grand Key and find the breakfast buffet reasonable and good.All in all staying at the Grand Key is a wonderful part of our trips to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: DrFish71
Reviews.Content: I'm loyal to the Hilton brand so I'm typically staying at a Hampton Inn, Double Tree, Embassy Suites, Hilton, etc. Best description for this hotel is that it's getting a bit old and tired. Parking is pretty good here which is a plus in Key West. We were always able to find a spot easily and parking as FREE. Lobby is pretty clean and well lit. Pool/patio area looked pretty clean but I was working from 6am - 11PM each day so I never had time lounge around. Hallways were well lit and clean. Elevators were just OK. They were down for service a couple times during the stay. The hotel also had a power outrage while we were there. Power was out for around 10 minutes. Rooms were not well laid out and needed cleaning and an upgrade. Work space was very small. Wireless internet was very, very slow, making email difficult. Was difficult to see the TV from work station desk and their cable feed was poor. Many channels didn't come in very well making them unwatchable. Tub/shower was in bad shape. You can see where they tried to save $ and refinish/ fix it up but all that did was make the water pool ankle deep in the tub. Unlike most of the updated Hilton properties that offer outstanding beds, this properties mattresses were cheap and uncomfortable. Sleep was poor at best each night and I usually sleep like a baby when on the road. The one thing that kept me from giving this property a lower rating was the very good customer service and staff. The front desk staff was always pleasant as was the bellman and other employees we ran into in the halls. They get a gold star for this. While I try to remain loyal to the Hilton brand I think I'll have to find another hotel the next time I return to the region, that is until they drop some coin and upgrade the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Key Resort in early February and it couldn't have been better. Our room is spacious and clean with a balcony. The furnishings and carpeting were in great condition. The maid service is timely and clean the room well. As Hilton Diamond VIP's we were given vouchers for the Breakfast Buffet. The servers are attentive and make sure you get what you want or need. The food was very good and fresh. The pool area and pool bar are very nice, we didn't eat at the pool bar, but the food we saw served looked very good and in large portions, everyone seemed to enjoy it. The drinks were well mixed. Also they offer a shuttle to the downtown area all day until 11PM. We really enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, easy shuttle service to shopping-dining areas.”
Reviews.Author: Dwddwddwd
Reviews.Content: Nice facility, would have stayed longer, but was limited to 14 days.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond expected”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelers11
Reviews.Content: Shuttle is very convenient, nice pool, but outstanding feature is customer service. We lost a cell phone on an evening out and thought it could have been in the hotel or on the shuttle. Instead of just looking in the lost and found, the staff (Rhonda andRebecca) called the shuttle and had the driver search the van where they found the phone. They did this in the evening and the following morning, with a persistence that was beyond what we expected. Thank you for providing such excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Kenna G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but not a "resort" as called. Some staff are very rude and the hotel claims to be pet friendly but the experience said differently. There is very little place for a dog to go to the bathroom and they are not allowed in most areas of the hotel. As well as there is a rule that the dog cannot be left alone in the room, even if they are crated. Therefore my husband and I couldn't eat together or go to the pool or hot tub together at all. The only dog friendly aspect was that the dogs are allowed on the free shuttle into town. The breakfast buffet was pretty nice and included a variety of foods. Room was clean but balcony was parking lot view and the resort is not near the water.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Superior at the Doubletree, Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Josie4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Double Tree in Key West. The hotel and its grounds were immaculate and well maintained. We called on arrival for a pick up at the airport - the van was already parked outside when we exited the airport. We received a friendly greeting at the hotel by both the porter and the front desk attendant. Although we were early for check-in, we were allowed to check in immediately. We had a nice room overlooking the pool, with a small balcony, fridge, and a coffee maker. We were also given the DoubleTrees signature cookies --- YUM! The shuttle is convenient and efficient. We used the shuttle to go downtown and also to Smather's Beach, which is also walkable (1.5 miles from the hotel). The pool is pristine and surrounded by palm trees. There are a few cabanas in the pool area if you seek shade. From our pick up at the aiport until our drop off at the end of the trip, everyone was incredibly nice at the hotel! We only had one negative experience -- during one of the pickups, the van arrived at the second stop and was completely full. The driver insisted the van was made for four in a row. Impossible. So impossible that a girl in each row had to sit on a lap in order for us to fit -- and everyone in the van was average sized or smaller. Otherwise, a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: skip w
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. We stay at Doubletree's all the time. The front desk staff were wonderful and very helpful. Waitstaff for the restaurant were very nice also. They could use some work with there cleaning staff - none of the hotels seem to do a good job letting the cleaning staff know to be quiet and not scream down the hallways. We get this everywhere we go. cleaning staff seems to think their "work" place is like their home - not the customers "home" away from home. I have to tell you that if you travel all the time for business you will not find the rooms extraordinary here at the Doubletree - you will not be disappointed in the rooms but they are just rooms. Maybe the suites have something more to offer. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were clean. Overall very satisfied with the stay. We used our own car to drive around and we parked our own car. But I did see lots of people using their shuttle and the shuttle did seem to run right on schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: SoFloGal
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, and reasonably priced. We had a balcony room overlooking the pool. Personnel were all friendly. Warm chocolate cookies excellent. Ask for the ones with nuts if you like them better than plain! We used the shuttle back and forth one night (had a rental car) when the Christmas Parade was going on. The hotel added additional shuttles to handle the extra load. One of the drivers in the afternoon gave us a joke-laced, historical tour on the way back to the hotel. We wondered why we had paid for the Conch Train Tour! All in all a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: lmarren71
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West in Dec. of 2010 & stayed at the double tree. So many hotels closer to Duval were insanely expensive. I was hesitant to book at first since Duval is on the other side of the Island, but the shuttle service is what sold me on Double Tree. They hotel was nice & the pool was even nicer. The shuttle saved us a lot of money & it is a short 5 minute trip from the down town attractions. We would definitely stay here again. ONE small issue, I wish the shuttle ran past 11pm. Their last drop off/pick up was 11 so if you wanted to stay out at the bars later you had to get a cab. But we always hopped the 11pm shuttle then bought drinks for the room @ the convenience store next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brendan640
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been to Key West two years earlier on a vacation and were not impressed with the accommodations at another hotel (so much so we were not planning on going back). We decided to give Key West another chance and we were not disappointed. The hotel staff was very nice when we checked in. We needed a crib for our son, which they promptly brought to our room which was clean. There were some of the spacers that they put in to separate tiles on a floor visible in the mortar, however, it was level with floor and the room was otherwise very well kept. We also ordered room service on the first night (a hamburger and a chicken sandwich). We both thought the food was good and the price was inline with what you would pay at a chiliâ€™s ($10-$12 per sandwich). We did have a breakfast one of the days we stayed which was on the pricer side for a buffet ($25-$30 for two). The hotel was nice and quiet (even on New Years Eve!). The shuttle service was great. I thought the pictures on the website did a great job in showing how the hotel looks. The pool area was well kept and we spent some great time there. I really liked the location of the hotel, away from Duvall St. Itâ€™s a 10-15 minute ride to the downtown area and when you had enough of the downtown noise you can go back to your quiet hotel. The hotel is also closer to the east side of the Key which seems to be much last traveled and has some great and less traveled beaches. I would say this may not be the place to stay if you want to come right out of a bar on Duvall St and go to your hotel, but I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again for the quiet area, great amenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service makes up for location”
Reviews.Author: drivera733
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay if you don't want to spend all of your money on a hotel room in the heart of town. Shuttle operates often and until 11:20 pm which was perfect for us. We did not have a balcony room but still had a nice view of their landscapes. The front desk personnel were extremely friendly and helpful, since this was our first time in Key West. Beautiful pool with fully equipped outdoor bar. We had breakfast in the hotel on our last day there which was good! Must sees in Key West... Lloyds Bike Tour, and Blue Heaven Restaurant - delicious breakfast in a lush setting among chickens and cats who seem to cohabitate very well together!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Key West area1”
Reviews.Author: kdbooklady22
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a week ago - everything was wonderful! Check-in with Grand Rapids woman was handled perfectly; shuttle guy/breakfast guy fun/informative! I was there with two other women on a business/KW Literary Seminar meeting; first visit to this hotel and was pleasantly surprised/live in the Lower Keys from late October to mid-May then head "up north" to my seasonal business - Will mention this place to neighbors (in both places) and friends, too - Again - great stay/breakfast was also a treat/setting/quiet/walk to ocean also a plus! Kathleen D

Reviews.Title: “What a breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in November 2011 and found it lovely. Great rooms, nice pool area and restaurant. The service was a little "tired" at the service- and check in desk - but the man at the entrance stair was really nice! The downside can be the location, a bit away from the harbour but this was taken care of in a good way thaks to the suttle bus - even if it was really crowded at the last ride back in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay from the minute we were picked up.”
Reviews.Author: captainnole
Reviews.Content: First off, it may seem minor, but the cookies are a very nice touch. The shuttle service from the airport to the hotel was efficient and friendly, as was the shuttle to and from Mallory square. The front desk check in was superb. Our room was very roomy, and clean. Our only complaint is that the bed should probably be changed. We both had a minor back aches after we woke up, but nothing too terrible. A minor tip for those who use the shuttle from Mallory square back to hotel late at night, is to make sure you get on before they run out of room! The hotel had two shuttles but ran out of room and left a few people behind to wait for the next run. Glad we weren't one of them. Kudos to the entire staff for making our stay a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: pickle-princess
Reviews.Content: Everything was just as listed on the website. The shuttle was a definite plus, as we didn't need to drive, drops you off at Duval Street and picks you back up. Runs like clockwork every hour. Very satisified with the entire stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Drarig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree last weekend, which was busy because of the Ragnar Florida Keys relay race. Despite the hustle and bustle created at the hotel by the event, the staff diligently handled my check-in and was professional throughout my stay. The location is on the quiet end of Key West but you do not need to use a car to go around as the Doubletree provides a shuttle service, which runs at the hour, to and from Duval street - very convenient as this will save your the hassle of finding a parking spot. We used the shuttle all weekend and it always showed on time, although it may get crowded at times - the hotel may provide a second shuttle during the exceptionally busiest moments. I also appreciated the proximity to the ocean and enjoyed a morning stroll along the boardwalk at sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bullwolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree over christmas.Thought the staff and location were good.Had a problem with the safe,maintenance guy fixed it within an a hour from speaking to the front desk.Breakfast was very good,but they need to control the people walking around picking at the food and walking off.The one issue I had was the number of people wandering around corridors and other areas of the hotel with dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Service all over the map and site showing a bit of wear and tear, but still a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Perpetual-Motion1
Reviews.Content: The service from the front desk was excellent when we checked in. The woman serving us was filled with information, and gave us some great advice on what to see for the New Year's Eve celebration in Key West. The shuttle service into town is excellent and leaves the hotel promptly on time (although extra servic on the busier New Year's Eve would have been great as we had to battle for the shuttle, and then ended up having to wait an hour for the next scheduled service). We were given an option of two rooms: one on the top floor overlooking the pool and one on the third floor which overlooked the parking area. We chose the pool, and although the hotel has live music that plays all day, the ambience was nice, and the rooms relatively quiet when the sliding door is closed. The food in the restaurant is quite good, and not too pricey given that there is limited choice around the area. There is poolside food and drink service, and while we were by no means looking to get drunk, the drinks were very light on alcohol (our kids had the virgin versions of some of our drinks, and there wasn't much taste difference), so a bit pricey for what you get. The hotel does offer poolside massage services, but we did not partake in any. The hotel is beginning to feel a bit dated, and there was mould in the bathroom (which always amazes me given it is a relatively simple thing to control with bleach). The hotel provides you with a door-hanger card on which you can select a time from early morning to mid afternoon to have your room serviced. However, as we find this a bit of a security risk (not the best idea to hang a sign on your door saying you are not in the room at a specific time), we just advised the housekeeper on our floor that we were leaving and she could clean the room. She told us that she had to clean the rooms of those who were checking out first (so not sure why we were given the option on the card of having our rooms cleaned in the early hours), and that it would be later. However, the room was never serviced. When we returned to the room later in the evening, we called the front desk to advise them and see if we could get a few fresh towels and some shampoo. They didn't seem too concerned that the room had not been serviced, which was disappointing. Also, we had to ask for extra shampoo a couple of times, as there was 4 of us in the room, but only one shampoo left. When we did, they would hand out the shampoo one at a time like it was gold. However, they are very generous with the famous Doubletree chocolate chip cookies, providing those in ample supply whenever you ask!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: BornToRoam77
Reviews.Content: Fantastic DoubleTree Hilton property on the quiet side of Key West, Fl. Stayed over Christmas weekend 2011. Used Hilton points for the stay, but rooms were reasonably priced even for a busy weekend. Stayed in a standard King Room with balcony on the top floor, with a nice view of the water over the rooftops. While this hotel is not on the beach, it was less than 7 - 10 min drive from several good beaches in Key West. Being in a residential / condo neighborhood, it was quiter / less busy than most neighborhoods in Key West. The hotel does an excellent job of providing a shuttle every hour to three stops within Key West - including Duval Street / Sunset point. We used the shuttle for all of our transportation within Key West - very convenient as we didn't have to deal with the hassle of parking (which can be hard to find and expensive!!). The drivers were all very friendly, and the shuttle ran by and large on time, even in the evenings. Service was exceptional at the hotel. The front desk was very responsive and helpful and the breakfast staff were also very good. Special thanks to Angel at the front desk - we arrived a little earlier than normal check-in hours and room wasn't ready, but Angel gave us directions to a good place for a decent lunch near Duval St., stored our luggage and got us on the first shuttle to downtown so that we could start our vacation immediately! He was very polite and even waived the parking charge ($10 per day) for the inconvenience. Poolside service was also excellent - live music, a server regularly stopping by for food and beverage orders and well maintained locker rooms - towels regularly replenished. Breakfast service was good, though the selection was average. The room was standard - bed, flat screen HDTV and a pull-out couch, shower pressure was slightly low, but it may have been because we were on the top floor. The only problem we faced was with a wireless internet service, which was weak at the best of times. Overall an excellent stay - best feature being the hourly downtown shuttle, and worst being the weak internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Hilton stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: larissagreen1
Reviews.Content: From the point of check-in, every single employee I ran into was very pleasant, spoke to us, and offered to help. Nice pool, plenty of lounge chairs. On-site washer and dryer. Yummy warm chocolate chips cookies at the front desk. Nice, clean rooms. We had a fairly large balcony overlooking the pool. Convenient shuttle takes you back and forth into downtown. Hotel is close to a great walking area along the water. Great exercise room (free weights and equipment). Ordered wings for room service one night...quick and delicious! Big continental breakfast. Poolside bar. I'd definitely stay here again. Exceeded my expectations, customer service that should be a standard for ALL Hilton Hotels. Great job! Not a negative comment but more of a suggestion...our king-size bed kinda slept like a taco - sagging in the middle so some of their beds may need replaced but everything else was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: benicksamluke
Reviews.Content: great trip. VERY responsive staff. Super clean room. Great location. What else can be said. If you come to the Keys, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: PinkLadyDi56
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. The service was excellent in every way. I will be going back for sure. The complimentary shuttle was great...dropping off at 2 different locations and picking up all hours of the day. It was so convenient to be dropped off and not have to worry about parking. The concierge services were great as well. Pool area was beautiful with live music. Close to the beaches...within walking distance if you are a walker. Breakfast buffet - excellent. Customer service.....excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. A bit off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: SteveDELIWEAR
Reviews.Content: Resort hotel 4 miles or so from the heart of the action in Key West. Very nice room. So so buffet for breakfast but good service from waitstaff. Check in line somewhat long and slow. Free hourly shuttle into Key West proper.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the area, free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: mhclauren
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay here for New Year's Eve and it was great! The hotel is off the beaten path, which was great for us given the crowds in town for the holiday. They have a very nice breakfast buffet, a free shuttle that makes two stops hourly downtown and hourly at the beach, and a large pool area with live music. It's not exactly a "resort" (the grounds are fairly small, as is the pool itself), but it suited our needs perfectly. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property outside of town”
Reviews.Author: C0mp0ster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for two nights. The room was nice with most everything I needed except bottled water. There is a small convenience store on the edge of the hotel property where you can buy beverages and snacks. There is also a nice bar by the pool where cocktails can be enjoyed. There is a shuttle that runs on hourly schedules to take you downtown. When I was there, they were operating two shuttles spaced about 15 minutes apart. I would advise on using the shuttle unless you are up for a good walk. I gave the walk a shot. It took me about an hour to get to the beach and 2.5 hours to get to the middle of Duval Street. You could probably make the walk a little faster, but I took my time and enjoyed the sites along the way. I was able to grab the shuttle to head back. Make sure you are on time for the shuttle, because they do not stop for long. The outdoor pool seemed very nice. I only lounged by it for a few minutes, though, as my work schedule did not permit more time. They have both wireless and hardwired connections available at no charge. Both connections were equally slow. Don't plan on using the internet extensively while at this hotel, go enjoy the beautiful weather instead.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip to Key West...”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: good hotel. visually outstanding, good amenities. room was clean, but not overly spacious. staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was a bit crowded, but food was hot, and staff kept the trays full of food. lots of kids on property, so you do have that to deal with, but no different than most family oriented hotels. Pool clean with enough towels. shuttle service was disappointing. we took it to town, no problems. but on the way back, shuttle was delayed from picking us at rendevous point for over 30 minutes. It was well after 900pm at night and my kids were tired from waiting for the shuttle, so we ended up taking a taxi. i complained to the front desk on my return, and they were overly gracious. they apologized for the delay in shuttle(due to high volume) and gave me free breakfast tickets for the family. The right thing to do since we spent our own money on the taxi ride home from the shuttle fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Garry42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 9 days in Key West and would definately recommend this hotel. Rooms are a bit small, but we really only used the room to sleep anyway. Service was excellent, although housekeeping needed to be reminded to restock the proper number of towels in the room each day. (Not a big deal, but just seemed a bit strange that it wasn't always done). Location is on the east side of Key West, away from the shopping and nightlife areas. The complimentary shuttle bus is terrific and would accomodate most people's needs. It leaves the Hotel every hour and returns you back at your leisure (up to 11:00PM apparently). We rented a car to see the rest of the Keys, but only used the shuttle service when we were going out to dinner or shopping. (Driving in Old Key West is a bit of an experience with the narrow streets and people walking everywhere) Value for the money was excellent and the hotel is well cared for and very clean. Would definately stay there again and would definately recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, eh restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Marishka_D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in mid-December 2011, we did not rent a car. The room was good, balcony facing the pool was a plus, small fridge & coffeemaker, but slow internet. Pool is nice, staff was very friendly & helpful. Location isn't bad since they have a shuttle running once an hour (website says every half hour, not true while we were there) but that makes meals a problem since there isn't anything else around and the restaurant is not good. We tried the fish once (greasy), the breakfast buffet once (edible but way overpriced for what you get), There is a convenience store around the corner so we bought milk & cereal which took care of breakfast, and then we went into town for touristy stuff and meals. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: iyerhari
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and engaging. The hotel shuttle is very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “experience - negative”
Reviews.Author: PB4646
Reviews.Content: Negative experience with the reception staff!Horrible communication during some requests and during following complains.Rooms - Connection doors - really bad experience for somebody who is alone in one room and wants to rest or sleep! Rooms are not isolated from each other properly. Noisy enviroment anyway! Breakfast very poor and the only positive thing at the end was the warm swimmingpool with excellent staff taking care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Uncontrolled Teenagers Wreaking Havoc - staff couldn't care less!!”
Reviews.Author: ngoodreau
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here previously and enjoyed it but this time the kids were allowed to run up and down the halls screaming at all hours of the night. We are not some old fuddy-duddies but sometime after midnight (after our second call to the front desk) they were literally yelling at the top of their lungs (multiple) in the halls. Seriously? The front desk seemed unconcerned. I'll send an email to Hilton corporate about this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to enjoy Key West”
Reviews.Author: kentdan1
Reviews.Content: For the price you cannot beat this resort. Near the airport yet you can get to Duval Street via the hourly free shuttle. Pick up and return at 20 minutes after the hour. NO DRIVING. Jose is the best driver/guide ever. Place is clean and all staff are friendly. The pool area is sunny all day and Mike makes sure everyone is taken care of around the pool deck. Live music Friday, Sat and Sunday and breakfast is included on some reservations. We have been there four times and prefer it to staying in the middle of all the bustle because it so easy to get back and forth. Debbie will make sure you find the tours, restaurants and cruises to suit your desires. It has a nice gym and a wonderful outside bar. The bar food delivered right to your chaise lounge chair is typical of most places but it is really good. Go in mid december when to temp is in the high 70s and get on a cruise boat for the lighted Christmas Parade. It is a blast. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: disapointed32655
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff very welcoming and a beautiful hotel . From the minute you arrive you are treated wonderful. We had just missed the shuttle so they called another one for us. The room is clean and the bed was very comfortable. We really did not want to leave. I would stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Grand Key Resort By Hilton is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: darity D
Reviews.Content: What a Great Hotel. Awesome Pool Complex with Cabonas. Hot Chocolate Chip Cookies available each night at front desk. Shuttle Service Every Hour to Beach and Key West 8am - 11pm. Large Suites with Soft Large Thick Plush Bath Towels, Plush Pillows and Bedspreads. Super Clean and Modern. Courteous and Service Oriented Staff. Awesome Concierge. Best Hotel in the Keys at a very good price. Pool Side Bar Staff is Wonderful. Fitness Room is well Equiped Buffet Breakfast is Very Good and well worth the price of $13.95. Business Center with many computers with Internet, Printing and Fax. Highly Recommend. Will be coming back here again year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but some hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: LovetheAndes
Reviews.Content: The room rate was reasonable for Key West and the service was excellent. But the restaurant is insanely overpriced and having to pay for parking seems unfair. Wireless internet service very unreliable. My daughter loved the giant fish tank and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay if you want to be away from it all.”
Reviews.Author: Joann614
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty from the minute we arrived. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. You need to take the shuttle into town, but, it is always prompt. The drivers are great and will give you lots of guidance on what to see and how to get there. Don't forget to stop by the front desk each night for your fresh, hot cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, relaxing, comfortable hotel in Key West...enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: New_friends_GR
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I spent three nights in Key West in late November-early December 2011 and had the chance to stay at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. It's part of the Hilton family, so we had some Hilton Honors Rewards points to redeem. Overall, we really liked this hotel. The check-in process was a bit slow because there were others in front of us, but the woman who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. (We appreciated the fresh cookies and water that's a trademark of Doubletree hotels.) We loved the aquarium in the lobby. Our room on the 4th floor had a balcony and overlooked the pool area. The room was very, very nice... a bit smaller than we were expecting, but it was still quite lovely. It was clean and comfortable. With our rewards points, we were able to take advantage of the buffet breakfast without having to pay extra. (Otherwise, the buffet is $12 per person.) The buffet has a lot of food, and it's easy to overeat... hash browns, sausage, eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, Belgian waffles, French toast, cereal, and on and on and on. You can be very gluttonous, and I was!!! The servers who help you at the restaurant are generally very attentive and helpful. One thing that is really nice about this Doubletree is the concierge service that's provided. We were able to use their assistance a few times and very much appreciated it. We were given suggestions for good restaurants, and the woman made a reservation for us for a snorkeling trip. The pool area is very nice, but we unfortunately didn't have a whole of time to use it. This time of year it gets dark early and it was a little on the chilly side, so all we really did was use the hot tub, although my significant did have the courage to jump into the chilly pool at 8:00 at night. There's an outdoor bar area that's open until 11 p.m., and we enjoyed having adult beverages in the hot tub. Loved it. Another bonus for this hotel is that, even though it is on the opposite side of the island as all the downtown Key West attractions, there is a free shuttle service that runs every hour to and from downtown. We took advantage of this both full days we were in Key West. Very convenient, and at the end of the night, we loved being dropped off at the front door of the hotel. The only downside we encountered was the sleep quality of the room. We had trouble sleeping but really couldn't figure out why. The bed was very nice, but maybe it had something to do with the air conditioning that kept turning on and off and on and off throughout the night. For some reason I couldn't get into a comfortable position so that it wasn't blowing directly on my face (which I don't like). All in all, we highly recommend the Doubletree Grand Key. It's very nice, but you won't find very cheap hotels on the island. It was a decent value for what we paid... relatively speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Grand Key West was a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: visor10
Reviews.Content: We Went to Key West in October and stayed at this resort. The resort was away from Duval Street (close to the airport) but had a free shuttle everyday. Every hour on the hour. The pool was beautiful and the grounds clean. The bar at the pool made awesome drinks. Rooms were typical hotel rooms. Clean! The staff couldn't have been friendlier. They gave us a free buffet breakfast everyday which was great. We went fishing and brought our catch back to the hotel and they cooked it up for us for a small fee. We had a feast! It was also good not being to close to town because when you were back at your hotel you could relax. The cost of this hotel compared to the others was a great deal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I plan to go back to Key West and plan to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: michelle f
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip staying at the doubletree. It was great, room's were nice, pool and bar was a plus. Worth the money. Beach close by and enjoyed my morning walks to see the sunrise. we like some adventure so we drove to town ourselves a few times and took the shuttle. It was great to have that choice. family came down staying at another place which was a dive. They were very impressed when they saw where we were syaying. planning on returning again. Thanks for the great time doubletree!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brucester12
Reviews.Content: After spending a week on our cruise we decided to travel down to Key West for the weekend. The hotel is lovely, rooms were adequate. Lovely pool area and bar. The hotel is at the other end of key west and you either need to drive into the centre or take the free shuttle that the hotel offers. We took the shuttle all weekend and would not recommend taking your car as there are very few places to park. We booked early through hilton website for special price. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Feel like your in South Florida”
Reviews.Author: PeterV54301
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Grand Key Resort is located a few miles from downtown and duval street. It is in a quieter part of the Island, which can be a blessing and a challenge. To the resorts credit, they do offer free shuttles to the main points of town and hotel return hourly... Trust me, you want to use this service if for no other reason parking in KeyWest can be a challenge. The hotel itself is a bit older. When we visited, the front water fountain was not working and the age is noticable in the lobby and in the guest room immenities. However, once you walk out the back lobby doors towards the pool, you won't care. The pool area is very nice and large enough for a goodsize crowd. The palm trees around it and the lights make it the tropical paradise you came for. They even offer table massage poolside, a seriously nice treat. Grab a beverage from the outside bar, pick your lounge chair and relax.. you deserve it. The rooms offer good coffee and a smaller refrigerator. While the bathrooms could use an update, the sleeping area was very comfortable and very "KeyWest looking". We had a connecting room and the people next door were very loud and the children screamers, not the hotels fault, but annoying still the same. The restuarant tries to be very high end and from a service aspect, they do a nice job. The food is a little better then ok, but really.. there are to many great places in town to stay at the hotel for dinner (I was on business and didn't have time to go were I like). I will say that the breakfast buffet was very good and well worth the $13 per person +. It allows us to hang around the pool in the morning. Huge Plus. While this isn't the best hotel in KeyWest, it is well worth the money and the staff really does a great job. Beyond just the cookies! Also to note, there is a small deli / store just behind the property if you need a bottle of wine, beers or snacks for your room.

Reviews.Title: “An out of town gem”
Reviews.Author: MarkBStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Ok so the one downside is that it is 2 miles out of town but the free shuttle bus means that is no problem at all and you are getting the hotel for about half the price or less of similar standa in the centre. Large rooms with seating area and small balcony made this a great spot for our 4 day stay. The room was reasonably clean and well serviced every day. Hotel had a nice pool area and bar staff were great. We had breakfast once which was ok and dinner twice which was actually rather good and would certainly recommend compared to many of the other Key West restaurants which are ver priced and food is average. Ask for a room to suit you - we had one at the side which was quiet and suited us. Shuttle buses are hourly and were very convenient. You can drive in but parking can be difficult where you want to be ( so you end up walking anyway). The only thing I didn't like we're the small pillows.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Tob_farmer_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a couple of nights at Key West Double Tree. Wonderful hotel, loved the location, restauant was great..and could've want for any other accommations. Although, we were not given the room promised to us when we made the reservation. Booked the rm a couple of months in advance and even call to comfirmed...rm with pool view. Nope...we got a parking lot view. The breakfast package was a good choice....always good w/ good service. Really liked staying the the area away from the old west Key..kinda gives one break from it all. Transportation was great and as always cookies were yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tshididan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Key West and found the Doubletree Grand Key Resort to be wonderful place to stay with two toddlers. The convenient location, excellent breakfast buffet and fabulous pool were all big pluses for us. The kids thoroughly enjoyed the zero-edge pool and we spent one entire day there just having a great time. The concierge offered very good restaurant recommendations and handed out plenty of beach toys for the kids to borrow during our stay. While located a short distance from the activity on Duvall St, this suited us fine. We could easily go in and out of the tourist area while having great access to the best places frequented by locals. We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from the action but still great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaisyBlue77
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, didn't like that it was far away from the action of Duval street but paid significantly cheaper than other chain hotels close to action, luckily there was a shuttle that ran once per hour wish at peak hours the shuttle ran twice an hour but... Rooms were clean and well decorated had lovely view of pool though bar was below room which had a few people laughing late at night but didn't interfere with our sleep. Pool was fantastic and clean. Hotel service was impressive. Warm cookies at checking nice bonus. In room fridge was handy, parking was $10 per night which kinda made me mad as driving is not an option.

Reviews.Title: “Typical resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelGirl09
Reviews.Content: Decent resort in Key West, but a shuttle drive away from the main strip. It's a typical DoubleTree experience but frustrating experience with their WiFi, that didn't work in my room. Breakfast was good but to access the main area of Key West, you'll need to either drive or take their shuttle. The last shuttle picks guests up from Key West at 11:25PM, which is very early and there aren't many taxis in the city. Good places for families but next time, I'll stay closer to the main part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkhurt
Reviews.Content: Not close enough to anything worth wile. I came wanting to walk to my fun, instead i have to drive or catch a shuttle. No microwave makes bringing food back a no go. The rooms could be a bit bigger too. I stayed in a jacksonville suite with 3 sinks and a bar with microwave and fridge, this doesnt come close to what it should be.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: A very nice hot breakfast buffet. Excellent room. Terrific staff. Shuttle service. Great dinner in the restaurant. Beautiful pool and tiki bar. I had no negative experiences with this stay. Thanks for a great stay Doubeltree!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: nirvanaqween
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. The room was super clean and comfortable. Check in/out staff was very nice. We did have one problem, which was the mini fridge. They take all of the knobs so you cannot adjust the temperature which we needed for personal reasons. It took a few calls to get someone down there who told us they had no knob and could not fix it. We ended up just going to walgreens to buy a tool kit and made the adjustment. Other than that, we had an amazing stay. It is far enough away from Duval but very close to the beach. There is a free shuttle bus to take you where you need to go that runs frequently. We will defiantly make this our new "go-to" hotel for future trips down south! They give you cookies when you check in too!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Placed”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie46
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel to be in a good location, away from the noise and bustle of town centre, yet easy to get there via the free shuttle. This was my second visit, stayed 2nd through 6th October. Their were 6 of us in our party, 16yrs to 65yrs We had booked a 1 king bed 2 room suite and a 2 Queen bed standard room (this was upgraded to a 1 King junior suite free off charge next to our suite). The check in was easy and pleasant. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfy with good facilities. The staff were pleasant, efficient and courteous. I like this hotel as it is ideally situated and has everything I want at a price I can afford.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel for Fantasy Fest.”
Reviews.Author: jakeandbella
Reviews.Content: The Hotels is quite a way out of the centre of Key West, which if you have a car is good as you can park it at the hotel and leave it. The hotel has a shuttle bus that runs into town on a regular basis, but if you are a night person, then you will have to take a taxi back as it does not run really late. For nearly $400 I would have expected free parking ($10/day). But I guess it is just one of those things. May use the hotel again next year, but would look for a more cost effective option if possible.

Reviews.Title: “The very best Double Tree has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: destinationdiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 20-25, 2011. I have to say that this is the very best Double Tree property that I have stayed at. The staff was outstanding. If you need info on Key West and where to eat check with Jose and David. Not only are they knowledgeable but such incredibly nice men who really take pride in the job they are doing. The front desk staff was always helpful and hospitable. The breakfast in the dining room was a welcome change from the normal hotel â€œincludedâ€� breakfast. The room and bathroom was clean and bright, making this a memorable stay. Since July I have stayed at 2 other Double Trees and I have to say that they do not come close to the hospitality extended to us in Key West. This property should be cloned!

Reviews.Title: “Special Trip Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Nancy250
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Double Tree Resort Oct. 17th - 19th and we really had a great time. Our room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We had a super fast check-in with no problems and hot coookies to boot. The food was good and everyone was very nice. The bathroom was very clean and had everything you would need, plenty of towels, soap, etc. After a trip to Ft. Jefferson in the Dry Tortugas, it sure was nice to get back to our room. We would difinitely stay there again. The only complaint I have is the internet was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: NFlaTrip
Reviews.Content: My group of 18 were getting together in Key West just to enjoy each others company, explore Key West again --this is my favorite destination in Florida__ and work on my tan. A week before my arrival, I called the group sales office for an upgrade that they had previously offered, and they said "let me look into it and I'll call you back". Sure enough, upon checkin, they had upgraded my room to a 2-room suite. Another reason we selected the Doubletree is their free shuttle service that runs from 8am to 11pm, all over the island. This saved our group gas, parking, and taxi fees. We had booked a sunset cruise for Saturday night, and the concierge arranged for a separate shuttle exclusively for our group. Can.t thank them enough for going that one extra step. The resort has a nice pool area, and pool bar with friendly bartenders and a tv for the guys to keep up with their teams scores. Great property, great staff, clean rooms, comfy beds as all Doubletrrees have, and very reasonable rates. Thanks again, Doubletree, we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice week”
Reviews.Author: delaidatti
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time! This hotel offers a shuttle around Key West. You can get a stop in many locations. Hotel was clean and the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Tootie18
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the DoubleTree and all I can say was it was okay. I guess I expected a little bit more from a Hilton as far as the upkeep of the rooms. Ours was a bit dirty and just looked very worn. There were a lot of marks on the wall and the bathroom was not very clean. I feel as a hotel that housekeeping should let you know about these rooms so you can at least keep them up. A little paint will go along way. The bathroom wall had something on it, rusty medal or something but it was not an appeasing sight and the doors and light switches had dirty fingerprints on them. On our first day housekeeping didn't even come until 3:00 and then we were walking in and she said she would just wait until tomorrow. I told her it was fine, we would wait, however everyday it was a wait. I had seen a few reviews with pictures that did actually show the room true to form with the paint scuffs and dirty marks and that is exactly what it looked like. The shuttle service was great and the drivers very nice. The bell staff, front desk and pool service was great! I guess for Key West I would recommend it, but compared with some other Hilton/DoubleTree resorts it had a long way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Special birthday trip Oct 13-16, 2011”
Reviews.Author: edkelley
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to Key West for her birthday. Stayed at the Doubletree Resort. Excellent resort. The staff was very very friendly and professional. I want to give a special thanks to Nancy, who worked the front desk. She made our stay very enjoyable and helped us find some very nice resturants. Eddie, who was our van driver a couple of times, pointed us in the right direction a couple of times and to Phillip, who took us to the ship and stayed with us until we found out if it was going to sail or not due to some very bad weather. The entire staff was great and made you feel at home, but those three in particular were very nice. The breakfest buffet was excellent. The hotel does provide shuttle service to downtown Key West and Duval Street from 8am to 11pm, which was a real plus since parking was very difficult to find and expensive.. The pool was excellent and hotel rooms very nice and inviting. We had a poolside view which was excellent, Will definitely stay there again. Ed and Janet

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Liles
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip I took with my wife, 3 year old son and my mother. (3 adults 1 child). We stayed April 29th and 30th checking out on May 1st. Pictures provided. Pros: Easy and friendly check-in. (They give you fresh chocolate cookies on arrival!!) Gigantic beautiful fish tank in Lobby. Restaurant had very comfortable outdoor seating on patio. Very nice staff. Our room was a suite and it was very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast buffet and it was very good. Cons: Not really sure about this, we had a great time start to finish. Conclusion: My wife and I live in Miami, so we feel as if Key West is in our back yard. We have been several times. Our intentions were to see more of the city, but because the Doubletree was so nice, we ended up staying at the hotel most of the trip. The pool is super nice; it has a gradual slope in the shallow end which was great for my 3 year old son. The pool side service was fine and as a bonus, we had good weather. No complaints. Absolutely would I stay again. We booked the room through Priceline, but I canâ€™t recall how much I paid. I know it was a good deal though. I would very much recommend this place. We had originally only booked 1 night, but found the place so nice, we stayed the extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1BigCoach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our 14th anniversary in early October 2011. I will start with the ONLY negative about this hotel. They appear to be very strict about their 3pm check in time. The airline we arrived in Key West on only has 1 flight a day, and it arrives at noon. We called the hotel, got a very quick van ride to the hotel, but was met with a somewhat rude and distant front desk clerk who told us the check in time was 3pm and we would have to wait till then. She then turned her back on us and didn't offer any suggestions or ideas. Well, the pool area is beautiful and comfortable. We found someplace to change into our swimsuits and hung out at the pool area till check in. There is plenty of sunny areas, shady areas, and the pool bar is very convenient. I believe the bartender was "Billy the Greek" and he was one of the most helpful employees we encountered at the hotel. He gave us good service on our lunch and drink orders, and was full of ideas of places to visit and dine while in Key West. Our only regret of our trip was being so busy we didn't spend enough time at the pool. The rooms are adequate but very clean. Most of the pictures you will find online make the rooms appear larger than what you will actually fine. There were 2 of us so we had plenty of room, but I would think a room with 4 adults would be very crowded. The van service downtown works well. It was always punctual and is convenient. The only recommendation I have here is regarding the last van of the day. The last van leaves "downtown" at 11pm. There will be a huge crowd waiting, and the van will be standing room only for the last trip back to the hotel. Be prepared to fight your way onto the 10 and 11pm van as people are pushy and rude. It doesn't matter if you have been waiting 30 minutes for those vans, because once it arrives, it is a "free-for-all" getting on the van. In NO way is this the hotels fault or responsibility, but more indicative of today's society. The food at the restaurant is excellent and on par with prices of other Key West restaurants. Plus, can you ever go wrong with a warm chocolate chip cookie for dessert? The front desk attendants are very generous with the cookies too! Overall, this is a good hotel by Key West standards. It is nice to not have to worry about a rental car and parking issues. It is definitely someplace we will consider/stay on our next visit to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and property”
Reviews.Author: JamesDianaRandy
Reviews.Content: Key West is paradise and this hotel added to a memorable trip. Service was outstanding throughout our entire stay, with incredibly friendly and knowledgeable staff. Facilities were clean and well maintained. Our room was a good size and nicely updated with an island feel to it. Breakfast included with our deal offered a huge selection of hot and cold dishes that we ate in the comfortable dining room (far better than the standard donut and coffee cont bkfst). Free cookies and ice-cold citrus water (lemon, lime, and orange) in the large impressive lobby were nice touches. It is not walking distance to downtown, but the complimentary bus that takes you there is a short trip and is available on a regular schedule throughout the day and evening. It fills up quickly at times, so best to get in line at least 20 mins early. The bus is better because parking spaces downtown cost money and are hard to find. Traffic even during slow times can be congested and stressful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: michael a
Reviews.Content: Nice place, bellman and tram drivers very friendly and know all the good places. Rhonda at front desk was great! Having free transport in and out of town was sooooooo helpful and saved alot of money.Rooms are clean and housekeeping friendly. Pool area very nice. We had the breakfast plan and that was our only complaint, the food was never served hot on any of our three mornings there, buffets should be 140 or above, someone needs a bio-therm.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two one-night stays at the Doubletree. We were in town four nights for Poker Run weekend and I was able to use free nights for the Hyatt Resort Friday and Saturday, so I bookmarked it with two nights at the Doubletree. First off from the front desk to the shuttle the staff was as friendly as I ever encountered, I felt very at home there. It has a really nice pool, larger and nicer than the Hyatt's. The hotel itself however is somewhat dated, although it does have an old Florida feel to it. The rooms were nice but nothing spectacular, our last night we were upgraded to a junior sweet which did have a nice extra-large balcony overlooking the pool. The shuttle service was quick and on time when we used it - last pickup on Duval was at 11:20 PM. One night the driver gave us a great tour of Key West and told jokes during the ride. Still there is nothing better than being able to walk back to your hotel in the afternoon for a dip in the pool or a shower and walk back out to Duval. Breakfast was included for me as a HHonors Gold member - the buffet wasn't bad. Considering Key West prices $12.95 is a fair price. Our room had not been cleaned when we went to check in at 3:00PM Sunday as a large number of people had checked out. We were comped for drinks at the pool bar while we waited and given access to a changing room so we could hang out at the pool. For the price it wasn't bad - I would give it 3 1/2 stars if that was an option.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? The friendly staff? the luxurious pool? the beautiful room? Only bad stuff is the expensive and poor breakfast but overall this was a wonderful stay that warmths my heart thinking about it. Will,,, no - HAVE TO stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: PebblesKildare
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four in June. The location is perfect! The hotel is really lovely, the pool was just a perfect size with a lovely pool attendant "Mike" with Cabanas and it's very clean. The pool bar was also great and pool side menu from the bar served tasty dishes. The rooms were fine too. The fact that this hotel is on the outskirts of Key West appealed to us because you can leave the hussle and bussle behind and come back to a wonderful peaceful hotel. The hotel provides a free (but it's nice to tip) shuttle bus in and out to Duval St etc., which is perfect and very prompt (on the hour). We hope to return to the keys some day and would love to stay in the Grand Key Resort again :)

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice Overall”
Reviews.Author: stevefpa
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree by Hilton Grand Key Resort is located near the Key West Airport and Smathers Beach on Key West. We liked the fact that it was somewhat off the beaten path of Duvall Street and Mallory Square. There are numerous shuttles available that provide transportation throughout the island's attractions, so a car rental is not really necessary. We opted for a car rental at the airport and enjoyed the freedom of cruising the island at our own pace. The hotel is very well kept and is attractive inside and out. There is a restaurant on the property, which was pretty good, but we preferred the plentiful culinary options that Key West has to offer. The room we chose had a blacony overlooking the swimming pool, which was really nice. The pool is excellent, with its natural slope into the water. It was really relaxing to just sit in the shallow slope and chill. Thye hotels near the harbor tend to be much busier and noisier, if that's what you want, but we liked having the option of the best of both worlds approach. The Tiki bar is great and the hotel staff is about the best I've seen. I highly recommend this hotel highly and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lynnandkev2
Reviews.Content: Pool and hot tub were awesome,the pool view room was great,clean and comfortable,the breakfast buffet was out of this world and it was nice to either eat in or on the patio. The free shuttle to and from town was a bonus, and it was nice to relax at the tiki bar after a long day in town.
