The restaurant staff were great,they always managed to find us the last pot of coffee to take up to our room at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Lucy's review”
Reviews.Author: Lucy G
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel: The Staff is excellent! Angel at the front deck is FANTISTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time !!”
Reviews.Author: Muz-Killie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and found everything from check in to my exit as first class. Reception was great and effortless on my part with my room being ready slightly earlier than the check in time after driving down from Miami. Main features for me was the pool area and the shuttle bus which travels into town. Pool was clean, spacious and well kept with an excellent shallow walk in area for the young kids. Shuttle bus ran all day (free) and was a great service as there isn't much around the hotel. Never stayed for breakfast and walked (10 minutes) to a nearby waffle house where the breakfast was good value. Key West is an amazing place and well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, enjoyable pool, nice and quiet"”
Reviews.Author: perezlago
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotels have become in my book, equivalent to elegance and good service. Beginning with the warm cookie at checkin and the updated rooms, they can't go wrong. This hotel also provided plenty of shampoos, creams, coffee, etc., I also appreciate getting the room a little early since were tired from driving.

Reviews.Title: “I would absolutely stay here again....nicest place & people in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jennifer b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing sort of wonderful. They are completely and totally accomodating. They are extremly helpful and have respected people that have special needs and thus went far and beyond what a hotel could do. The front desk help was amazing, particularly Joseph and Angel. The hotel was amazingly clean, offers crabtree and evelyn samples, and gives out chocolate chip cookies. Finally, this resort has a great restuarant and is great for kids. I look forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GurleyGirlTraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff here is excellent. I was on a short vacation to Key West and used Hilton points. The room was clean, the food was very good, but the service was wonderful. The pool area is great with a lovely hut tub. The shuttle to and from Key West was helpful. I plan to stay here frequently.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Doubletree Grand in Key West”
Reviews.Author: iamjustvisiting
Reviews.Content: Living in the south, we have the opportunity to visit The Keys often. We always stay at the Doubletree because it is the most reasonably priced big chain hotel in Key West. We use to stay near Mallory Square but the hotels near Duval were very $$$$. The Double Tree offers a shuttle to Duval Street that runs at regular intervals for free. Parking is limited in Key West and comes with a price tag, the free shuttle can't be beat. The Doubletree offers free chocolate chip cookies at check in (yum) and is a beautiful hotel. The only thing you need to remember is that you are on the quite side of the island. We always rent mopeds to scoot our way around town leaving our car in the hotel parking lot. Nice hotel at an affordable price, it's our pick!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Marie N
Reviews.Content: The service at Doubletree was good. Couldn't really ask for anything else there. The room was nice and the bed was so comfy. The only thing was that the water stopped running for a while, but that didn't hamper anything. I really enjoyed the pool and the restaurant's breakfast buffet, where you get to make your own waffles. The hotel itself isn't far away from downtown or other places to visit and since we had a car it was no problem. They also have a shuttle running to the beaches, so that should be handy for any one without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget-conscious travelers”
Reviews.Author: Bsoler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. You get a really comfortable room (although rather small) for a great price. The hotel's facilities could use an update but nonetheless very clean. The pool isn't very big and you can expect it to get crowded on the weekends. The warm cookies at check-in were a plus. Keep in mind, this hotel is located on US 1 and a bit far from all of Key West's main attractions. They have a shuttle that runs every hour until 11 p.m. to three different parts of Key West, including a beach. This hotel isn't for the person who likes to crawl back to their room after a wild night on Duval Street. If you don't mind the distance between the resort and the tourist areas, it's definitely a great value for the budget conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: HRR111043
Reviews.Content: We stay often in Key West , but Doubletree Grand Key Resort is the best, the food is great , rooms perfect, service perfect , shuttle downtown and beach great, We goes next trip again to the Doubletree Grand Key resort

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hymeragal
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Key West for a family vacation. Our two rooms were ready when we arrived (prior to check in time, I might add). We gobbled our GREAT cookies on our way to our rooms. The rooms are decorated with a beach/Key West theme. They were bright and cheery. The rooms smelled clean. There was a comfy chair in the corner with a light, great for kicking back to read a book. The internet was free but there is a parking fee. It is a "dog friendly" hotel and we saw one or two in the lobby. There was live entertainment outside in the pool/bar area. Although the pool was pretty busy, there were plenty of deck chairs available. There was an ample supply of pool towels. We found the beds to be extremely comfortable (too much so, didn't want to leave them). One of the biggest pluses for this property is the free shuttle service to everything Key West. We happily used it several times and found it to be totally reliable. After searching the island for a good place to eat breakfast, because of the crowds wherever we went, we gave up and went back to the hotel. We knew they had a restaurant with a breakfast buffet. We weren't excited to be forced to eat hotel food, but it was really very good. There was fresh fruit (the good kind) and a selection of hot and cold foods. Much to our surprise, everything was quite tasty. The price was less than we would have spent had we been able to find availability at on of the KW "local's" spots. We found our breakfast to be a happy accident! The hotel has an absolutely beautiful fish tank in the lobby. Our grandchildren loved it. Parking in the hotel lot seemed very safe, but sometimes it was hard to find a spot. We accidentally chose "Lobster Fest" weekend for our trip, so everyplace we went was crowded! All in all, we found the hotel to be comfortable, clean, convient and safe. The only complaint that I can think of would be the slowness of the elevator. Other than that, we had absolutely no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, YUMMY cookies, free shuttles around KW”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderer561
Reviews.Content: Please read and rate my write up as useful if you found it to be so... I travel with children, so I look for hotels where my kids are going to be comfortable and have a good time when we are not exploring our vacation destination. I was right on the money with this booking! From the start, it is an attractive resort with a dolphin statue/foundtain out front. in the front lobby is a floor to ceiling column-shaped fish tank with beautiful reef fish. We spent a good amount of time looking at the fish. We are not a family that needs to stay in the "downtown" area (the party district) because we do travel with kids and neither my husband nor myself consume alcohol. So for people who want to STAY in the center of the party, this location may not be for you, HOWEVER, they do offer free shuttle bus services back and forth to different locations on the island. We found the free shuttle service to be very helpful as often it was difficult for us to find parking. Occasionally we did take our own car during our 4- day stay, but, always ended up walking, walking, walking, walking in the heat when we did. Upon check in, the kids (to our surprise) were each given a back pack with some activity books, crayons, etc. It was a nice surprise. Also, the famous Double Tree chocolate chip cookies! Mmmm! And whether we are supposed to or not, each day we went back to the front desk for more! We only dined in the hotel restaurant once and although it was good, found it a little overpriced. We tend to like to eat out and about, places in the "downtown" district for the scenery and atmosphere, anyway. Our room, I must say, was AMAZING. Due to a booking error, we ended up with a Jr Suite and management let us keep it at no extra cost. REALLY great room for families! The main bedroom has two VERY comfortable Doubletree beds with a TV< plenty of room for our items, etc. Nice room. Adjpoining was another room (with a separate balcony) that had a dining room table and chairs, another TV, a sofa bed, cabinets, a stereo with mutliple disk CD changer, cabinets, kitchenette... It was AWESOME, like our own little apartment. Everyone had plenty of room, the decor was nice, and we were extremely comfortable there! The kids had plenty of room to run around and I highly recommend the Jr Suite. The pool area was also very nice, clean, cabanas, well kept. Large pool, also a hot tub. Sometimes my kids just like to hang out at our hotel, and so we definitely look for a nice place to spend that time and we certainly had that here at the Doubletree. There are places closer to "downtown" with no pools, tiny rooms, even places that don't allow kids. And I was glad we stayed away from the hustle and bustle because there tends to be a lot of drinking in Key West -- lots of bars, and my kids are too young and uncomfortable to be around all of that. So it was nice to have a great room to come back to at night to relax and enjoy some family time, away from the crazy. The manager was very nice, the rooms are all indoors - no outside access, which I like, and I highly recommend this property. It is also a Hilton property, so if you are a Hilton Honors member you will gain points staying at a Doubletree. Please let me know if this was helpful by clicking below. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need an ocean view room, this is the place to go”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the east side of the key about 1 mile from the airport. It's inside some residential complex with other vacation rentals. If you are not driving, there is a free shuttle service running on the hour several times a day to the downtown of Key West. The service is great, so is the breakfast. The hotel has complimentary airport shuttle, but our flight was early in the morning and the driver didn't come. The front desk staff even offered us free taxi ride to the airport. Compared with other chain hotels on the island, this Doubletree has the lowest price (due to its location). So if you don't care about the ocean view from your room, because you've enjoyed the ocean a lot during the day, this is a good option to fit your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: DrCrazyA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend stayed here for 2 nights as part of our vacation in the Florida Keys. I am a Hilton Diamond member and used points to book our stay in a standard room. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite and given 2 tasty chocolate chip cookies. Our suite was huge, impeccably clean and equipped with a full kitchen. The beds and linens were very comfortable, we had no issues w noise from other rooms. Toiletries are by Neutrogena, We had rented a car but took advantage of the hotels' shuttle service to Duval Street to avoid parking issues. The breakfast spread is large and features delicious typical American cuisine. We spent more time in our room than we usually do on vacation because it was so nice at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Trip”
Reviews.Author: Missionlady03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a short trip to Key West in January of this year. We hoped to escape some cold weather. It was warmer than our home state but still not as warm as I expected. That really didn't matter because we had a great trip. The Doubletree Resort was very nice and very accomodating. They gave out absolutely delicious, warm, chocolate chip cookies at check in and actually anytime you wanted to come to the desk and ask for them. The staff at the desk were always super nice. We flew into Key West and didn't rent a car. We took the hotel shuttle down to the main part of Key West and spent the entire day walking the city. The Butterfly Conservatory is worth every cent you pay to see it. It was wonderful, so many different colors and types of Butterflies lighting on you and flying around. We enjoyed our tour of Hemingways house and the six toed cats, the Little Whitehouse tour was also interesting. This is a very easy city to see on foot. I recommend this even for a quick trip. We only stayed two nights but the Doubletree was a great home base for everything we wanted to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Not for your wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: johanjon
Reviews.Content: Doubletreee Grand Key Resort is an average hotel rather used as a conference center than the stay for your wedding anniversary or honeymoon. The hotel is not located about 4 miles from central Key West. There is no beach around the hotel. A free shuttle service every hour to Key West serves various locations. Will get busy at peak hour. Free parking on the hotel property. Use the free shuttle if possible, parking in Key West can be hard. Beds were good but rooms did not offer anything spectacular. The hygien products made available was fresh. The breakfast was very poor and would not suit Europeans. Swimming pool was tiny and crowded. Prefer to take the car to Fort Zachary Taylor Historic State Park were the beach was good and fantastic snorkeling facilities was offered. Housekeeping kept on bugging us knocking the door. + Free parking + Shuttle service + Good beds - Poor breakfast - Swimming pool - House keeping Did not try the internet connection. Only staying at Doubletree Grand Key Resort to a discounted rate make it worth the money. I'd probably try a different hotel when returning to Key West. NOTE TO DISABLED GUESTS: Doubletree Grand Key Resort is wheelchair accessable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in lovely town!”
Reviews.Author: Ben_C007
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop on a 2 week Florida fly drive holiday. We stayed for 2 nights and were very impressed - definitely the nicest hotel of the 2 week stay! Staff were great - cookies were awesome! Bus into town was great fun and it was really funny to see Americans getting a bit drunk and rowdy on their 'Spring break'! Key West seems to be America's party town - more so than Vegas! There was a really good atmosphere and we would recommend the sunset party boat to anyone. $50 for food, drink (although I did get asked for id at 32 years of age! ;) and disco with the amazing sunset as a backdrop! The hotel pool was really nice too. We ate in the restaurant one night and had spicy shrimp wraps which were tasty. Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charmless but OK for one night or two”
Reviews.Author: carnetdaventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our kids on July 23. We were lucky to find this family room in Key West as according to expedia it was the only one left. We paid full price. The hotel warned us it was a smoking room. Too bad for us. It smell bad but we were warned. Here is the review: 1. location is far from the action. You definitely need a car or use the not so convenient bus service. 2. The rooms are decent. Reasonably clean but zero personality. Chain feeling. Good beds. The day we arrived they had forgotten to change the sheets. it was fixed quickly. 3. Staff is nice, helpful and efficient. 4. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: NC_ManofLetters
Reviews.Content: From attentive service at the pool--asking my wife often "would you like more ice?" as one example as she read a book in one of the cabanas by the pool--to the well-kept grounds, comfortable Plantation-style rooms and a quiet location away from the goings-on and nightime revelry on Duval Street, the Doubletree was a welcome surprise and good overall value on a recent business trip. Key West hotel prices and lodging aren't cheap and seem inflated but I would definitely recommend the resort and return. Once work was done and I returned to the property, my wife and I rode the complimentary shuttle to and from the Front Street area in the late evenings and enjoyed several excellent meals, including at the Conch Republic Seafood Company and the Commodore Waterfront Restaurant but also stayed 'home' some and enjoyed some good meals as well at the Doubletree. Parking isn't easy to find in the Duval/Front (happening) area of Key West which makes the shuttle even better and/or renting a scooter a good idea. One evening, we also took the family-oriented glass bottom boat (Fury water adventures) to the reef on a sunset trip--highly recommended. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and attentive and there's a great concierge who can arrange anything you'd care to do. As noted, I was on business so didn't have the time but noticed that many folks were at her desk arranging snorkeling, bike or scooter rentals, wind surfing, fishing, golf at the Rees Jones-designed Key West Golf Club and the like. The golf course looked great and I heard good things about it from golfers although, alas, being a business trip, it was something again I didn't get to experience on this visit. As for the location, the hotel is near the airport but we didn't hear the planes much so that was a non-issue. Wifi is available throughout the property and wired connections also are available in the rooms, which have safes and small refrigerators. There's a little convenience-style mart right next to the property where you can buy milk and other food items for the frig. While Key West is known for a lot of things--including all the cozy-looking Key West style houses, key lime pie, Ernest Hemingway, shops, interesting little nooks and crannies, fauna and its lifestyles/carefree spirits/"Conchs" (as locals call themselves)--it's definitely not known for its beaches. There are some: to go, hang a right out of the resort and drive past the airport (they will be on your left, with what looked to be a good array of vendors, kayaks and other rentals), but they had a lot of seaweed and aren't those wide expenses of sand you'd see in, say, Destin, Fla., or even Myrtle Beach, S.C. So it's not a place you go to if you want to go to the beach--more a place to fish, snorkel one of the world's largest reefs, enjoy a good meal and just chill. For banking, Wells Fargo is a great choice since it has two ATMs on Duval Street near Front Street and a branch in Key West, too. Like the song says, "It 's five o'clock somewhere" and Key West is a nice place to be. You certainly can't beat the sunsets. The Doubletree definitely makes a perfectly Grand Key West home base. Hang out at the pool and scarf a cabana in the morning while the active set is doing their thing or, rent a scooter or bike or hop a fishing charter and explore and join 'em. Just make sure you're amply funded! Bottomline: The Doubletree is not the Ritz or Four Seasons or perhaps not as ta-ta as the Marriott or as convenient as other options if you are going there for one big party. BUT it's nice enough, comfortable and a good value and the folks there seem to enjoy working there and serving others--even if they are rude German tourists with poor manners (great American patience, team!). The only negative experience during the stay was a slight issue with the Wifi one night but that was up by the time I woke up with a nice voicemail on the phone confirming the resolution of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Time...Great Helpful Staff...”
Reviews.Author: DivaCee
Reviews.Content: My hubby and i just returned from our 1st trip to Key West!!! We had a great time!!! The DoubleTree was a great place tp stay!! We checked in we were given the wrong room...so when i went downstairs they apologized and gave us free lunch for the inconvienience!! Very thoughtful...a plus for hubby who was hungry after the drive in. Anyway the room was nice...loved the fact it had a mini fridge...the "balcony" was SMALL but we got over it. Loved the fact the resort had laundry facility...we had clean clothes going home :-) One thing i can say is that the staff was great...Front desk, Resteraunt staff. The Concierge staff and Van Shuttle Drivers were Great!!! Hubby and would definitely be BACK!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....but far from the action...”
Reviews.Author: jdhawk
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. We were spending three nights, didn't want to spend a bundle, and didn't want to get stuck in a hole. We picked the Doubletree because was reasonably priced and we knew it would have nice rooms. The hotel was great in that regard - it was reasonably priced and had nice rooms. Our only complaint is its location (which they can't do anything about). It is on the far end of the island, away from Duval Street, the restaraunts, beaches, etc. Unless you are ready for an hour walk, be patient and plan ahead when using the free shuttle. Next time I'm in Key West, I'd spend some extra time to find a small B&B or hotel that is close to everything. The beaches in Key West are not the best, but make sure to visit the one next to the military base. FYI, there is a $5 park entrance fee. Make sure to catch the sunsets, walk around, socialize, and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: jjmom2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two boys age 4 & 7 stayed here july 20-25 and had a great time. Our room and the hotel was very clean, everyone was very courtesous. The tiki bar outside was great with great bartenders Bill & Fred!! The pool was very friendly atmosphere with all ages. Our stay in key west was good. The breakfast buffet has everything you can think of! The Concierge ladies was awesome on helping us choose fun activities for our little boys to enjoy. If we shall return, we will stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikapp8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July and got an an upgrade for being a Diamond member. Our room had an extra large balcony overlooking the swimming pool which was very nice. The hotel as a friendly staff and free shuttle to Duvall Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but alot”
Reviews.Author: Kate_sod
Reviews.Content: Location is okay , away from downtown however they have alot of things to offer. 24 hour gym , complementary cookie, tea and coffee maker in the room, and a nice pool. Really enjoyed the place and people .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sneeuwwitjeroos18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 days. Nice hotel. Room had a very good vieuw over de pool area (we had the room with the biggest balcony exact in the middle and rocking chairs because we were with six). Room is good but nothing fancy. Is clean. Why a 4 instead of a five for cleanless? Some areas need more attention but overall defenitely clean so nothing major. Great pool area! Busses from hotel to Duvalstreet arranged by hotel and free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Cheap and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: wishiwashome
Reviews.Content: Doubletree at Key West was a great pick! It is close to the center of the town and some of the rooms have a great ocean view. They have a great sights seeing tour and the bus driver was a hoot! He showed us all the historical places and was very entertaining. The food and service were good too. But if you're in Key West, you're not going to spend money or time eating at a hotel. However, the breakfast buffet was good. Every night we'd cool off by the pool- very relaxing! If you're looking for cheap, comfortable, clean and convenienet- DOUBLETREE is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Nemuca6880
Reviews.Content: I decided on this hotel due to its price and my membership with Hilton Honors. I stay at Hilton properties frequently and this one was nice. The staff was accommodating and helpful. The room was really nice- no complaints there at all. We never made it to the pool or the restaurant, we spent our days downtown. There is a shuttle that runs every hour to downtown, which I did not figure was a big deal when I booked the place. It did become a bit inconvenient once there though. We realized we always JUST missed the shuttle and ended up waiting another whole hour to either go downtown or get back to the hotel. We did not want to wait one night after we spent the day out in the sun snorkeling and hired a cab to take us back. It was a $17.15 cab ride without a tip from the 600 block of Duval Street. If you have young kids and you plan on doing a lot downtown, I would maybe stay closer. The shuttles were often full with some people left waiting another one. If there were people waiting, they would immediately bring another one and not make you wait another hour which was wonderful, but lap sitting in a small van filled with 16 (or more) people is not that much fun. We did not have our young children on this trip with us, but having strollers and bags to bring with you might be a bit much. Other than the shuttle issues, it was a nice hotel for an excellent price!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this one!”
Reviews.Author: travelmommy028
Reviews.Content: Our two favorite waterfront resorts were already booked , so I reserved this one based on TA. I am so glad we did! We booked a junior suite which came with a fridge and microwave. The balcony in this room is huge ! Request the top floor! The airport is close but not a problem at all because planes are so small . The staff is very friendly and addressed us by name every evening as we left. The hotel is clean as well as the grounds. The pool is beautiful, and we had no problem with the service at the pool bar, the drinks kept flowing! I would easily compare this hotel to the $400 a night resorts we usually stay at in KW.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Service, Incredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: shoppingmommy23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Key West. Everything from the check-in to the check-out was perfect, we do not have any complaints what-so-ever. If you need it, they will get it for you. Rooms were clean and spacious, food was great, drinks were great. We will definitely be visiting there again!

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: traveler225515
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to the Doubletree Grand Key Resort year after year and have never been disappointed. The rooms are spacious and bright with tropical colors, and all have ceiling fans. The outdoor deck and pool area are beautiful, and there's a great tiki bar overlooking everything. Very nice breakfast buffet offered in the morning (plus indoor or outdoor dining),and the all of the appetizers and lunch-type foods we have tried over the years have been really, really good. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle that runs hourly to and from Old Town Key West from 8:00am to 11:00pm - a priceless amenity! (They also have a complimentary shuttle to/from the airport.) In our experience, everyone who works at this hotel is friendly and courteous, and if you do happen to find anything wrong with your room, they see to it quickly. The Doubletree Grand Key is the 2nd largest hotel on the island, and while it is certainly not inexpensive in terms of rates, there are many other hotels that are much more expensive. In our opinion, the Doubletree Grand Key is easily the best place to stay in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “I liked staying at the Grand Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: christianfromorlando
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort in Key West the last week of June 2011, and enjoyed it. The hotel was nice, the room was nice and my family had no problems. The staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful. They offer an hourly shuttle service to the Old Town, which is very convenient in a city where free parking is almost impossible to find. I liked the pool and the hot tub. The room price was fair by Key West standards (I think it was $181 a night with our AAA discount). The only thing I didn't like was having to pay to park at the hotel, but that may be normal at hotels in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “This is our 2nd stay using Hilton points. Great service as usual”
Reviews.Author: labrador11
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough nice things about this property. Service was outstanding, everyone we met from the doormen, bartenders, bus drivers and front desk all professional and nice. Room was clean and comfortable. Only area that could be improved would be to service the shuttle bus. The AC barely worked and shocks seemed to be worn out. The shuttles were much busier that what I remember from my last stay in June a few years ago. Really no room to complain since the transportation was free and parking was free. I have stayed at Casa Marina where you are paying for parking and resort fee. The cost really adds up, ouch! Highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: huntken
Reviews.Content: I took my family to stay for four nights in June of 2011. We were extremely dissappointd. The employees were rude from the point of check-in at the front desk to the pool waitresses and staff. The elevator broke and we had to walk up steps to our room. This was not easy wiith two children and baggage. We looked out our window to see another wall two feet from ours. It was obvious that they had recently tried to touch up paint, because our room was painted two differen colors of yellow. My son accidentally left an electronic device in the room. I called the same day to check on it and there was noone that they could connect me with to discuss it. I called the next day and, again, they couldn't connect me with anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: footballofficial59
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find anyhting bad about this hotel. Staff was exceptional, shuttles were great, and pool area was very nice. Room was pretty nice. The only issue I have is the internet service was not good in the rooms and we were on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Key West for the Family”
Reviews.Author: AtlOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for the entire family!! You cannot beat the Super Friendly Staff at this hotel which is huge departure from most places in Key West we've stayed. Great pool area with plenty of shade for those hot summer afternoons. The staff are more than willing to setup you up with everything from para-sailing, jet skis and fishing. The best part it's only a short bus ride to Duval and all the fun downtown. Plus, you don't have to listen to the roosters at 5am after too much fun downtown. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: writergirlHouston
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night here after being in a B&B and were very pleased! (We needed to leave really early the next day.) Ronda let us check in early and also waived the parking fee. The staff was extremely friendly and the room was clean, comfy and quiet. Fabulous pool. The free shuttle was nice but can get crowded -- plan ahead because you might get stuck waiting awhile for a backup!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: rbeecher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay. The room was very clean. The staff were very friendly, and helpful. The waitress at the pool (Jalena) was very efficient, and friendly. The shuttle service got crowed at times. Sometimes we had to wait for a second van. It would also be nice if the drivers were a little more friendly, and talkative. Although we did have one driver( Michael) who was like a tour guide enroute town. He was excellent. All in all we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SailingTime
Reviews.Content: Quiet, nice pool and rooms. Shuttle to town as it's not within walking distance. If you don't need to be in town this is a great place to stay. We were surprised that this Hilton has a very good reasonably priced restaurant and you can eat inside or outside Friendly staff and cookies when you check in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michiael
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice all the way around except: Bar service at the pool (slow)and service at dinner needs some help. Other than that great stay. Conceirge is very good on helping. Good buffet breakfast. Recommend renting a scooter to see the island.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on Key West”
Reviews.Author: Solo_Zug
Reviews.Content: Nice resort, huge rooms, big pool! One of our group is sitting in a wheelchair. Everything was ok for him. Good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Bummer!”
Reviews.Author: trans4med
Reviews.Content: We book 3 nights at Double Tree Resort Keywest through Priceline. When we checked in, after reserving a King non smoking room, we were put in a King Handicap room. Now not only was that depressing, but it was also dirty (it had stains on the walls, some of which looked like blood). When we contacted the desk and ask to be moved, we were told they were full and all they could do was move us to a double twin the next day. Not exactly what you are looking for when you are celebrating your anniversery. But, we moved. It was at least clean. They also never checked back or offered to do anything more. The only good service was the bellman that moved us, and the server at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, adequate”
Reviews.Author: ilovereb
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for business travelers or those with children. It's a typical large chain resort type hotel. It is quite far from all of the key west sites. They do have a convenient shuttle, but then your day is revolving around the shuttle schedule. We found the people to be friendly, and there is only one restuarant in the hotel and none in the surrounding areas, so for lunch it was a long wait. FREE internet and a nice gym/pool were perks. Overall, I would stay here again for business or with children but otherwise I would stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - RECOMMENDED TO SEVERAL FRIENDS”
Reviews.Author: TrowMag
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three time, the last being Oct 10. I've always found the staff to be extremely welcoming, helpful and friendly. The shuttle bus service is convenient, although sometimes overcrowded. The staff at the front desk will help arrange trips (ie water skiing) around the island and arrange transportation there and back if necessary. The Breakfast Buffet has a very good selection and you can eat as much as you like. The hot cookies from the front desk are lovely and, like another reviewer says, if you ask for more you can normally get them. The beds and pillows are REALLY COMFORTABLE - the room is well appointed with Fridge, Coffee/Tea, large towels, TV, etc. The Hotel Manager is a great guy if you get to meet him - when you meet him you can see why his staff enjoy working there. I've always managed to get a good price when I go - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: tmh0022
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Upgraded our room for free when it wasn't ready at 3pm. Pool was nice with a bar right there. The drinks could use some more alcohol, but that's probably my only complaint! If you are going for nightlife you might want to stay closer to Duvall street, but for daytime shopping the shuttle worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price with excellent service, nice pool/bar”
Reviews.Author: MacieFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for our anniversary weekend. We were looking for a place w/ a nice pool that was reasonably priced and we got our money's worth! We made reservations last minute and ended up having to book a queen room instead of a king. I made a note on our reservation that we were going to be celebrating our anniversary and would like a king if available. When we arrived, the person at the front desk saw my note and went above and beyond to accomodate us. We were upgraded to a king junior suite (no additional cost) and given free parking ($10/per night). The employee was so sweet and genuinely wanted us to have a nice weekend. She truly knows the meaning of "customer service" which is rare to find these days. This was the theme of the weekend at this hotel...the room was very nice and also very clean, room service came after we left and were done by the time we returned and never bothered us, the pool was great as was the service at the pool bar. The pool is a good size and it didn't feel crowded. On Thursday and Friday, the pool had a cabana boy who was very attentive, friendly and supplied us w/ ice cold water all day long. There was even food service at the pool and if we didn't want to leave our cabana, we didn't have to. (The lunch we had from the hotel restaurant was fantastic) Speaking of the cabana, it was free and we were able to use it as long as we wanted. I highly suggest using one of the cabana's if available as it provided a nice break from the hot sun. There was a live steel drum player at the pool which added a nice touch. All of the staff at the hotel were friendly and attentive. We've stayed many places in Key West and this is one that we will definitely go back to. I would recommend it for all ages and for people with kids. The only drawback is that it's a 10-15 minute drive from Duval but the free hotel shuttle was easy to use and very convenient. Needless to say, we were very happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah196812
Reviews.Content: + Friendly staff, nice pool, bar had excellent food. Free parking. Quiet hotel. Excellent breakfast. - Room was small, smelled of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax and staff are trained to make you feel special”
Reviews.Author: jacksonjenny55
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive how close to the airport the hotel was. Mainly it was small aeroplanes giving hardly any cause for concern. The staff are all very welcoming, the bedrooms were very clean, modern and well furnished. Fantastic buffet breakfast. The location seems a long way from Key West old town but a free regular bus service from their front door was splendid as it seemed difficult to park in old town anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Don Ridley is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: saintpaulrocks
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th year returning to the Doubletree all because of the manager Don. He always helps us and makes each stay special. The staff is awesome and will help you with anything. If you ever stay here make sure you ask for Don. The shuttle service is great, but the staff makes your stay special. We have already booked for 2012!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Highest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Dushechka_1
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. The front desk was absolutely superb (thanks, Nancy). The rooms are clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. Housekeeping was wonderful, quick and efficient. Great breakfast buffet and the management thought of a nice "courtesy" counter with coffee in the morning and fruit flavored iced water during the day. Not to mention their famous warm cookies. The hotel location leaves a lot to be desired but their great shuttle service more than makes up for it. The drivers are very friendly, know the area and are always on time. Also, the Double Tree guests get free chairs on the beach, which is very nice. The pool area is kept very clean and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. You feel like you're somewhere on a tropical island and not in the middle of a commercial zone. Great landscaping. You can't go wrong with this hotel. One "Con": the internet connection was either non-existent or painfully slow. FOREIGN TOURISTS! If you're reading this, please do your research on the country you visit prior to your trip. Tipping is NOT merely a suggestion, it's considered rude not to. $1 per person per shuttle trip and don't forget to tip the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Samicide
Reviews.Content: We spent half of our week vacation at this Hotel and the other half in Miami Beach. Our stay in Key West was relaxing, lazy and fun. We started the trip flying into Miami and making the beautiful drive down US 1. Once arriving at the hotel there was a short wait to check-in. The hotel is on the outskirts of Key West. Nancy was very helpful at check in explaining the shuttle service and stops as well as the pool, bar, restaurant, FREE wifi, etc. She also answered our questions about Duvall street and the tourist stuff as this was our first visit to Key West. We had a king room with a small balcony that was sufficient. We started our days drinking coffee on the balcony. There was not much of a view- it faced the parking lot and adjacent properties but it had good sun in the morning. The room itself was very small but we spent little time in it other than sleeping. The bed was very comfortable and I had no complaints. There is a small parking fee of $10.75 per day. I think its rather cheap and well worth the price as you can leave your car at the hotel and use their free shuttle service to the action in Key West. The shuttle went to Smathers Beach and two stops in Key West: one near sloppy joes and on the other end of Duvall near the Southernmost point. It runs on the hour until 11pm. If you stay out later like we did, expect the taxi fare to be about $20 with tip and most taxis in Key West dont take cards so have cash on you. I think this shuttle service is the biggest plus for this hotel even if you have to take a cab home, it saves you half the cab fare for a round trip. We also spent a lot of time in the Pool area. Its a nice size pool with a waterfall and lots of lounge chairs and free cabanas if you get there early enough. Due to the proximity of the airport you get a plane buzzing the hotel every once in awhile but I am an aviation geek and enjoyed watching them. We got a tip from a guy in the elevator about the Key West lemonades served by the bartender at the pool bar. We tried one and were hooked, they were refreshing, tasty and strong! We enjoyed quite a few of these during our stay. Prices were reasonable and didn't automatically include service charges or anything. This is the place to stay in Key West. Even though its far away from Town, everything is accessible with their shuttle and if youre in KW to party like we were, you dont have to worry about driving! Great hotel, great pool, friendly staff. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch All Around!!! Don't believe the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were recently married on Sandspur Beach on Big Pine Key. We, along with several friends and family members, stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. Our wedding and honeymoon was an eleven day event. Here are the pros and cons from our stay at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. Pros: 1.) Check in was fast and efficient. 2.) We were upgraded at no extra charge to a large and spacious suite. 3.) The pool was crystal clear and very relaxing. 4.) Rooms were spotless every day after the housekeepers finished them. 5.) Mike, the pool man, was probably the most accommodating person I have ever met. My wife and I became good friends with him. 6.) The front desk staff was amazing throughout our entire stay. 7.) Breakfast was always in full stock and the waiters and waitresses were very efficient. 8.) The free cookies were yummy! 9.) The rooms were quiet and peaceful. 10.) Did I mention the free cookies...YUM! 11.) Shuttle service, although we did not use often, was very nice. 12.) We had lunch several times on the patio. The Cuban Mix and the Spicy Shrimp and Red Pepper Wrap were awesome. 13.) Jelena, the poolside waitress was great. 14.) Our stay was perfect. Cons: NONE

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: Jennymc67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during my daughters Spring vacation. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, we were taken care of by the Staff at the Doubletree. I don't usually take the time to right a review, but since my family enjoyed the hotel i had to write. We definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. They did everything and more to make our stay perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Hammerhead40
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, best hotel experience I have had. They are truly people that like what they do and love the place they live. They all know the island and share the hidden jewels with guests to make it even more memorable. We were there for our wedding and had several family members also stay so we were able to see several views. We honestly didn't see a bad from any of the rooms that we were in...the pool, the ocean, the sunset, whats not to like. you will have to try really hard not to have a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MMGT
Reviews.Content: This is an attractive, well maintained property. The shuttle to Old Town is reliable and the drivers friendly and polite. Standing room only on the bus? No problem, they roll out another! When informed at check in that our room would not be ready until 4:30pm (check in is 3pm) we were immediately upgraded and given complimentary parking and breakfast. This was done before I could even say that we could wait for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: honora44
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and close proximity to the public beach. The pool is decent and the service was overall good / average. It is not close to Duval street, so you have to take the shuttle which runs every hour. A taxi fare cost around $20, so its not expensive but can add up if you like to party late night. As a diamond member, I received free breakfast however, the price can get expesive for non-status folks.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return Again!”
Reviews.Author: bouhunter
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Grand Key 8-9 years in a row, great place. Just returned from another nice stay. Clean attractive rooms, good food, nice pool, great employees at the front desk and in the restaurants and bars. The bellmen and shuttle drivers are great too. I'm amused by some of the previous complaints. What is a "bathroom paper towel"? I think they meant that when the restaurant uses paper napkins they use the same type as are provided in the rooms. So what?!?!?? And the one about trying to check in early: ALL hotels list check in time as 3-4:00 PM. Sometimes I show up early at a hotel and hope they have a room, but if there isn't one available I certainly don't get upset since I knew there might not be anything until later. And I certainly don't expect "consideration" due to this. I hope if Hilton management reads these comments they take into account that some guests can't be pleased and look at the big picture overall.

Reviews.Title: “A good mid range hotel at a reasonable price for the area”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what star rating this hotel has and they are not always a good indication of what you will get anyway. I would consider this a mid range hotel and as such it is very good. We found the rooms clean and well cared for, maids did a good job and the bed was comfortable. We were pleased to be able to get a two bedded room for our teenagers as not a lot of hotels seemed to offer them. Water in the rooms may be a mark of a higher range hotel but considering the climate it would be very welcome. One or two areas beginning to show small signs of needing refurbishing. We had Junior suites which are well equipped with seating area, balcony, fridge, safe, TV We did not eat any evening or daytime meals but breakfasted every day and found the breakfast buffet food plentiful though service a little haphazard. Hot food was included and there were many options. The pool area was busy but not overcrowded and we were able to find loungers and shade at odd times of the day with no problem. More shade would be good, perhaps some umbrellas. All seemed clean and there is poolside service from the bar. Check in was very smooth and the reception staff extremely friendly and helpful. A small problem with the bathroom was immediately dealt with. The shuttle is a useful service but does get crowded and the availability of a second bus seemed a bit hit and miss. We used it when going into town in the morning to meet boats but took taxis in the evening (about $20). The hotel is about 10 - 15 minutes from the main town area. Amber, the massage therapist is highly recommended by my daughter This hotel was exactly what we needed for a short break and very reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Service”
Reviews.Author: schwagic
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and most of the U.S. Without question, the staff at the Doubletree Grand Resort in Key West, Florida stands head and shoulders above the rest. It was my first time to this destination and the immediate accessibility, courteousness and downright hospitality of the staff was shockingly amazing. Who ever is running this place needs a raise. If you expect sterling service, stay here-period.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - beautiful facility - kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Gator91
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Key West airport; not close to the downtown bars and Sunset celebration, but they have a hotel shuttle that takes guests to Mallory Square and another drop off every hour on the hour. Beats trying to find parking. The cost of parking in the Mallory Square area is expensive in the hotel garages. Hilton Honor members get free parking at the hotel as well as free buffet breakfast every morning. We had free Wi-Fi in the room. Room was very nice with fridge and small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay great staff”
Reviews.Author: Hoosiergirl51
Reviews.Content: We had a very relaxing stay at the resort the staff was very friendly would diffently stay here again love the cookies too !

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: jessjenkayben
Reviews.Content: I just came back last week from staying here, and had the most AMAZING time! Every single person that worked there, that I came in contact with, was so friendly, helpful, and personable! Anything we needed, they helped us with immediately! Not to mention, anytime you even walked by the counter, they offered you many hot chocolate chip cookies! :-) I wanted to sign up for a massage, and wasn't comfortable with a man doing it, so I told them. They didn't have a woman working that day, but they said that they would take care of it for me, and ended up finding a woman to come in just for me! The food was amazing also! It was wonderful to be sitting by the pool and have a friendly woman asking if you wanted anything, and be able to order it, and have it brought right to you. They had nice "tropical" like live music playing by the pool, which made it so relaxing! Everything in the rooms were very clean, and the beds were comfortable! Nice big flat screen tv too! I seriously have nothing bad to say...the staff was WONDERFUL, the free shuttle service was great, pool/hot tub was clean and perfect temperature, overall, I had a perfect 4 night stay there! I would LOVE to go back again someday!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Eriknleah25
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit Key West often, and everytime we go we stay at the double tree. We love going there. The staff is always friendly and professional. We love going in the pool and having a few drinks and enjoying the stay. I always recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thank You Double Tree keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton product”
Reviews.Author: julesnync
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1:45pm, understood we were early, staff was not friendly nor accommodating what so ever. Gave cell number to call when room was ready, went to eat no one ever called. Went back to desk, another unfriendly clerk said room was almost ready so she continued check in, gave cookies but no gift bag with water, was also rude. Went to get bags from bellman, he told us we had to come in to get them or it would take forever to find. Was not given any kind consideration for waiting two hours for a room. Room was not worth price, pool area was dirty and crowded with others sharing pool area from neighboring hotels. Pool was not big enough for that many people. Very dissapointed, no enjoyment, so checked out early and drove to Miami to try and enjoy some of our vacation, which we did greatly. Never go back again would not recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: springbanktraveller
Reviews.Content: It was a long drive from Port Lauderdale where we had previously experienced a Double Tree Inn and were expecting much the same. We were welcomed with warm cookies (trademark welcome) but the front desk personnel was not exactly forthcoming on what was available. We had booked a king sized bed with balcony, apparently by the time we checked in no king sized beds were available. We did get a balcony room overlooking the pool but you could only just fit two chairs on the balcony. The rooms are like any other average hotel. The pool was nice and the spa treatments were nearby by the pool. Pool towels were available. A drawback is the continual noise from the nearby commercial airport and the noise from the fighter jets from the Key West Naval Base every morning and late afternoon. The poolside restaurant was pleasant, the service slow and the meals although good, were enormous, enough to feed 3-4 people, such wastage means less profit for any hotel. Room service was fast, the food far too much so we kept some for our breakfast. The buffet breakfast full or continental was satisfactory, again service was slow, The concierge was helpful but the desk was not always open. A complimentary trolley was available at 20 mins past the hour every hour in the evening to take guests to the main town centre which takes 20-30 minutes but only 10 mins by car. complimentary rolley service also goes to the local beach. Metered parking is available at the beach areas, in the town parking is at a premium. Most other hotels are located away from the airport, across the road from the beaches or in the town centre which is very interesting to visit and you can see everything in a half day, tours are available but your own driving tour is just as good. Parking is $10.00+ tax/night on their own property.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: kawidd
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 3:25pm and our room was not ready. Request to store bags were met with someone so inept that I ended up taking the bags from him fearing that leaving them may mean never seeing them again. I haul them back to the car myself. When the room was finally ready, it was a bit of a confusion as to who had my key. Overall, the staff was poorly trained and a proper service attitude is still not well understood there. Doubletree varies in quality widely. Hilton needs to address that. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Prices are high as they are in Key West. This location is about as far from the downtown area as one can get and still be in Key West. There is a shuttle that many at the hotel used but we did. We were giving a couple for two free drinnks for our difficulties at check in. But that still isn't addressing the issue, poorly trained staff and less than ideal customer service. The poor area is only so so with practically no service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seh1985
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Grand Resort in KW from March 10-12 and absolutely loved it!! The staff was great, the room was clean with comfortable beds and the overall appearance of the hotel was very nice. The restaurant inside of the hotel served good food but the service lacked. The staff were slow and the hostess was not very pleasant. We also reserved a couples massage which was done poolside in a cabana. Joy and Amber were great and I recommend them! The only downside was that it was an 8-10 minute drive from Duval street but they have a shuttle which comes every hour on the hour to bring hotel guests to/from Duval Street. Overall, we will be returning to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...but for the waiting”
Reviews.Author: kjcd34
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a very pretty hotel, all pale yellows and blues, a nice aquarium, and a lovely pool area. Our room was very nice. The Neutrogena SPF 45 facial moisturizer came in handy. All of the staff members were very nice. I've read some not great reviews about the restaurant...but really, dinner there was good, especially the grilled mahi mahi. I didn't like the conch chowder, but I am an East Coast chowder girl. The fresh fruit was good, and the waitstaff was friendly. Breakfast was just ok....go to Blue Heaven instead. The elevator was SUPER SLOW. I would have taken the stairs, but the stairs next to the elevator didn't go up. And the hotel is far from town, so the hotel provides a shuttle. That is nice, but the shuttle does not exactly stick to a schedule, and I spent a lot of time standing around waiting. It's better in the evening, since taxis arrive at the hotel regularly. I can't imagine renting a car in Key West, as there is nowhere to park. Though I really liked the hotel, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: DDSUN
Reviews.Content: It took us 4 trips to Key West to finally find the perfect place to stay but we found it at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort during our visit Feb 25 to March 1 2011. So many places just check you in and then forget about you, not so here where the term Resort has been well earned. Joseph at the front desk checked us in smoothly, Billy at the pool bar diligently kept us happy and Mike at the pool was very attentive to all. The shuttle drivers were always friendly and very accommodating. Upon our shuttle return the shuttle the front door was always opened for us and accompanied by a warm greeting. No effort was spared to make us feel welcome and provide a conducive environment for relaxation â€“ exactly what we came to Key West for. The grounds are very well maintained, the pool and outside dining area in particular. The pool was warm and the Hot Tub was indeed hot. Our room (242) had a great view overlooking the pool area and it was quiet, we never heard any noise from other rooms and this place was booked full on our weekend. I have never written a Hotel review before but I felt compelled to write this one because it was our best Hotel experience ever. Thank you very much Doubletree Grand Key Resort and we cannot wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: anmbroden
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort and LOVED IT. The pool area is perfect for enjoying a great day in the sun and cooling off in the water. The hotel was completely booked for the weekend and didn't feel crowded at all! The pool man walked around and refilled our water glasses all day, he even recommended a few places to see in Key West! The bar staff was great to do anything they could to help us enjoy our day! The location was perfect for our group. It is NOT walking distance to Duval Street but the easy shuttle service and great taxi services made the location great!! All of the staff was very friendly and willing to help in any situation, we rented mopeds and they did everything they could to help and make our rental easier. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Far from town but shuttle makes it doable”
Reviews.Author: KEDBoston
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 5 days here the last full week of February 2011. Our room was a decent size, the beds comfortable and we didn't hear much noise at all from other guests even though the place was sold out. (We had room 302) They need more than one elevator - it can take quite a while - and housekeeping was very lackluster about scrubbing the tub and replacing things such as coffee packets, sugar, glasses, etc. The pool area was lovely and the morning buffet breakfast is very good and a very fair price (about $9). There is an hourly shuttle to town which you need to go to dinner. You can bike in the daytime but need to rent bikes through the concierge. Taxis are very expensive - at least $15 for a 4 mile max ride so the shuttle schedule is critical! The lunch restaurant is only so so and the bar was closed the one night I went out to it at 10! There is a small but adequate workout room. One advantage to being out of town is not seeing massive crowds of obese people from the cruise ships that dock daily - it's depressing enough seeing them throng the streets downtown - good to have an escape!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: luv2flyNy
Reviews.Content: Service and accommodations were wonderful. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Shuttle bus to the shopping areas and beaches available. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TBEAR10
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. It is by the aiport so it is not that close to the Duval Street activities. But they had a complimentary shuttle that came every hour (like clock work) to take you to various spots in Key West. Staff was great and hotel was very accommodating. Also, had a complimentary shuttle that takes you to the airport whenever you needed it. Would definitely go back to this hotel the next time we stay in KW.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel~~very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: pattycake5353
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We wish we could have stayed longer. The room was lovely with a balcony overlooking the pool. The breakfast buffet was delicious with very good service for coffee and juice. It was a quick 10 minute ride to the hot spots in town. Forgot my camera battery in the room when we left. When I discovered this, I called the hotel and they immediately retrieved it and had it waiting at the front desk just minutes after I called. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but need a better restaurant manager”
Reviews.Author: SunsetMotelPA
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, the grounds and lobby but since the Hotel is not on the beaten track with very little dining out there, the restaurant needs an overhaul. Good food but not enough healthy choices, terrible service, especially the hostesses. Never felt welcome and slow wait staff and kitchen. We ate there twice and not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but a bit far from the action of Key west”
Reviews.Author: Phykos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night in December with my parents, brother and two nieces (age 5 & 6). The girls really enjoyed the pool although it was a bit chilly for the rest of us. The landscaping and presentation of this hotel is really quite nice and the customer service, particulary Karen, Director of Sales, was amazing. She truly knows what customer service is all about. We were disappointed to not get the connecting rooms we requested and there was a sewer smell on our floor but that quickly disappated. Our rooms looked out over the pool area and I particularly enjoyed the patio area with a rocking adirondack. Great to sit at in the morning with the free paper. We ate breakfast downstairs at it was okay. I'm not sure of the cost as it was comped for us but it was difficult to track down a waitress to get coffee and juice refills. I wouldn't say it was anything special but it was convenient and the girls loved the strawberries. Really poor cereal selection however. We utilized the free shuttle to get into Key West, which saved us the cost of parking or the hassle of finding a spot. The shuttle was nice and clean although a bit packed on the return. A nice property but I wouldn't say it was so great that I would return to it rather than finding another property. Especially considering the very minimal amount of time we spent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was incredibile!”
Reviews.Author: first-family-vaca
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our preschool age child...everyone was not only kind and inviting to us, but to him as well. Having sandbox toys at our convience, the zero entry pool, and the incredibile poolside massage truly made our family vacation. The Chef, Shane maybe, you will want to take him home with you! We caught a pile of fish on a private charter, recommended by the resort (great time), took it back to the hotel and he gladly prepared it for us two different meals, SIX different ways! WOW!!! The resort was having a very large convention during our stay and we never felt pushed aside, very accomadating. The only downfall was that we wanted a king room and received two queens. I don't know if that lays with the travel agent or the hotel, but we didn't speak up about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: crazycatlady28
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night in this hotel on our tour of Florida, and I wish we could have stayed longer. It is located nearby the beach and a short drive from the party area of Key West. If you want a nice quiet place to stay, I recommend this hotel. My only problem was that we flew in late and had meetings right away. By the time we were free, it was 10:00PM. The restaurant was closed, no bartender was to be found to order bar food, and no one answered the room service phone. Luckily I had a granola bar from my flight, so that was my supper. The beds were very comfortable, but although it is a very nicely-done hotel, the hotel rooms were nothing out of the ordinary. I was surprised when I turned on the TV at 10PM to see a naked woman on the screen. Good thing we didn't have kids with us! The staff was very good during the day. There was always someone there to open the front door, and we got a free ride down to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Resort away from the hubub”
Reviews.Author: flyguybob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here for a vacation last month. The hotel is absolutely fantastic. We got upgraded to a pool view and ended up looking smack dab into the top of a palm. This was great because it provided some privacy and shade for my wife and I to sit out on the deck and chat. We were not happy that they started blocking off parking spots in the front of the hotel. There was no rhyme or reason to this and we were quite disappointed by this. I wasn't too long of a walk but the fact that they did this was uncool. For that reason I am dinging them on Service. we did get comped the $10 parking fee so there isn't much complaint there but it was still inconvenient. Breakfast was delicious and the breakfast staff were great. The bartender at night (Kevin?) was great and very friendly. Though the hotel is a few minutes drive from the strip we were able to commute quickly and parking was reasonable near Duval. We were also near a few great places to eat that were off the beaten path. Hurricane Hole was one of those and I will review it later. The hotel was quiet and we got a good amount of rest and recharging though there was a LOT to do in KEYW!

Reviews.Title: “needs updated but clean and great cookies, shuttle buses, coffee and water in lobby were nice touch.”
Reviews.Author: BSTS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for pleasure. The hotel was very clean but they do need to update the place. It's close to the airport but a little ways from the downtown action but they had a great free shuttle service which always ran on time and all day. My husband is a diamond member so we had free breakfast which was good, most of the wait staff was good. The front lobby people where helpful except I tried to get them to make the exercise room cooler 3 days in a row and no one seemed to be able to fix it or care much I finally gave up and went outside along the ocean walkway to run.The food for lunch and dinner was good but over priced. they had fresh cookies when ever you wanted them and coffee in the mornings set up and Lemon, orange and lime water set up during the day. Nice touch.Lots of conventions going on while we where there and most were well behaved the medical college group could get loud but most of the time it was fine. Only saw 2 dogs but one ate outside in the breakfast area in the owners arms at the table. They do have guest laundry services but the dryers are not hot enough to dry anything, I gave up after 40 minutes while trying to dry 4 items. The pool was very nice always with lots of clean towels and clean restrooms outside. Overall a nice stay. I did have one issue with an employee that an apology would have taken care of the situation but I never received one. But most everyone else was nice.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: popotisurf
Reviews.Content: nice rate for nice rooms, they are clean, comfortable and big, besides you can find a refrigirator and a coffee pot, on the second floor there is a self laundry, the location of the hotel is not that far by car, you take three minutes to reach downtown.The only thing inside the hotel is that you don't have much choice for the restaurant, you need to go outside, anyway for breakfast it's great, perfect for families. another detail there is only one elevatore for the whole building

Reviews.Title: “Sister's trip”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen8882
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay in Key West - far enough from the craziness of downtown but with great walking locations near by. Also the shuttle service is very good. We had a nice room - balconey was a little small and view was of a palm tree instead of the pool. Staff were all very help. Massage was the only thing we didn't enjoy at the hotel. We will be staying there again next year. The Fort Jefferson Trip, Pub Crawl and Butterfly Conservatory were all great trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay but the name is very misleading... it is neither "grand" or a "resort"”
Reviews.Author: Anastacia99
Reviews.Content: PRICE We stayed here on Dec 29th and 30th. The rates were very high for these two nights - $339 the first night and $399 the next night. I saw that the rates dropped to $189 after new years. This is the price that this "hotel" should be. We stayed on Hilton Honors points - 80,000 for two nights. A great use of the points during high season price time. As a Diamond member we received comp'd breakfast each morning and free parking. Also internet was free for us. A nice perk for loyal customers of Hilton in their top tier. Even though this is Key West which is known for it's expensive accommodations, there is no way that this place is worth anywhere near what they were asking, yet it was a full house - fully booked. Wouldn't spend a penny over $200 for this place. HOTEL The rooms were what you'd expect in a Hilton Family hotel. Clean, decent size, in working order, very comfy bed, but nothing special and no wow factor at all. Nautical color theme - white, blue, yellow. It was decent and had no complaints but a bit dated. The pool is quite small and only a max of 4 feet deep. Plenty of lounge chairs and other chairs. The pool is definitely not heated. It felt like it was about 70-72 F. Too cold if it's not a hot day. It was only about 72 F outside the day we were there. Air conditioning in the room was great. Great shower. Fridge in the room but no microwave. Our room had only a "juliet" balcony facing the pool so you could open a patio door but not go outside. The common areas including the lobby, restaurant, pool bar and pool are average. Nothing fancy. Nothing bad. FOOD The hot breakfast on day one was exceptional. As I mentioned the $12.95 each breakfast was free for us, including made to order omellettes if you are a diamond member. There was so much choice and everything was so good. We said that it was the second best hotel breakfast we had ever had. Interestingly enough though, the second day was so different. The "fresh squeezed" OJ from the day before seemed to be replaced by what seemed like Tang. The scrambled eggs were inedible and the sausage and bacon weren't good at all where the previous day they had been excellent. The service on the second day was terrible too. Funny how one day can make such a huge differance. The restaurant itself is not open in the afternoon but you can order food from it out at the pool bar. We had chicken fingers and fries and a pita wrap with fries and both were excellent. Drinks were reasonably priced for what we had. 2 for 1 MGD for about $3.95 I think. One note, dogs were allowed outside in the outdoor breakfast area. This seems non hygenic to me. They were just small lap dogs but still.... dogs should not be in restaurants either inside or out. SHUTTLE We had great luck with the shuttle. We went to Duval street and back twice with the shuttle with hardly any wait. Did not use a taxi at all and saved money. They say it only goes once an hour but we were picked up twice downtown about 40 minutes early. This could vert depending on demand. SERVICE Everyone we encountered with the exception of day 2 at breakfast was awesome. Check in was great. Front desk always great. Doormen. Billy the Greek at the bar. We did have to call for housekeeping at 4pm even though we had no sign on the door and had been out of the room all day. LOCATION Very quiet away from the hustle and bustle. ONLY downside is having to count on shuttles or taxis to take you back and forth to where everything is on Key West. We had ZERO problem with shuttles though. In closing I would recommend this hotel for a visit to key west but in no way expect any thing that resembles a "resort" like you would find in Mexico or the Caribbean... not even the very small ones. This is a hotel and it is a bit better than average. It is in no way Grand. Go with the right expectations and for a decent price and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, will recommend to my friends”
Reviews.Author: FLgirl34638
Reviews.Content: After our disgusting Art Deco Miami experience our DoubleTree room impressed us so much. It was pretty spacious, very clean, cozy, beds were comfortable, service was great as in most HIlton hotels. The only problem we had was slow wireless connection. The cable which we got at reception increased the speed. We also didn't know that they had microwave ovens which will be brought to the room by request. Could really save some money preparing and warming food with that. The restaurant at Doubletree surprised us with great $12 per person buffet breakfast, while dinner prices and food were not the best. We recommend going to Rusty Anchor restaurant to get descent lunch or dinner experience.

Reviews.Title: “Back again. Still awesome, but showing the need for a refresh.”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here in December 2010, to be in Key West for New Years 2011. We did the same thing two years ago, had a great time at this Doubletree, and decided to do it again. Everything was pretty much as I remember it. The hotel is on the quiet side of the island but there is a VERY timely, well-run, and well-designed shuttle service to take you to both the beach and both ends of Duvall Street, where all of the action is. The staff, especially those running the shuttle service and the valet/bell services, is top-notch and is as good as, if not better than, any other staff at any other hotel I've ever stayed in. They are excellent and go above and beyond to help everyone at the hotel. The hotel also has little things that help to make it very nice, like showing movies twice per day with fresh-popped popcorn and other little niceties like that. The hotel is starting to show its age. The rooms are not quite as nice as we remembered them being (we got a 2nd floor room, next to the elevator, with a horrible view, despite being Hilton Diamond Elite members, so maybe we just got unlucky with the room assignment this time around), some of the common areas need some basic maintenance, the nice gift and convenience shop they used to have in the lobby is now closed and a few other little things like that. This is nothing that a good refurb effort couldn't fix in a hurry, but it is a little unpleasant to see a hotel that we both love this much show these traits. The room was somewhat loud at night, both with sounds from the hallway and the quite loud A/C unit kicking on and off. So...the Doubletree is still awesome and we will absolutely be back. The hotel is showing its age, but the excellent service provided by the staff makes up for this. If the hotel can get a decent refurb effort underway to fix these minor things before they become more serious, that would be wonderful. We love this hotel...please keep it up, Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, needs some special attention in several areas.”
Reviews.Author: ddavep
Reviews.Content: For the price ,the facilities were in need of those little" attention to details" issues. The tub in the room had a bonded liner that was coming up, the tub had scratches from plumbing work and did not drain well. Their internet services were so slow everyone who tried to use it were very frustrated, especially when trying to get airline tickets. Pool area was nice, with a steel pan musician playing each afternoon. Staff was helpful, especially the concierge. Dogs and smoking are allowed at this hotel, so be prepared to see guest with dogs around the hotel, including sitting it guest seats. They have a shuttle around the island which is extremely useful.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HabLeaf
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, roomy and clean, with the usual large Doubletree room and the warm cookies on arrival. Arrived, unknowingly, during Fantasy Fest, of which I had never heard. This is an exhibitionist's event at Halloween each year, so best to avoid this time to avoid seeing acres of fat and wrinkles, with cellulite and elderly drooping boobs on display from the weirdest bunch of eejits from all over America. I've acres of fat myself, but at least I cover myself up. But back to the hotel. A really comfortable stay and good service. The only downside is the location, which is quite a way from downtown, but the free shuttle is excellent, and runs every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service made up for mediocre rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: meggie272
