Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the Doubletree is a beautiful hotel with smiling, friendly staff. The staff were so helpful and sweet the entire time we were here - they made the trip. The location was not ideal for those wanting to explore the city - but the hotel does an incredible job with their shuttle service that arrives on the hour, every hour. They were very timely and we had no trouble getting where we needed to go. They make two stops - first right near Duval Street (about a 15 minute ride) - where all the action is, and then at the beach (five minutes) . They were always on time to pick up from those locations too. Last shuttle leaves at 11:20 from Duval, but we partied later than that a few times and the taxi ride was still dirt cheap. Again, the drivers and guys at the front door were so sweet and worked with us. We were with a big group for a wedding that weekend and they held the bus for us on several occasions. The rooms were pretty nice, the bed was comfy, the rooms were spacious and there was lots of counter space. One bad thing was that the bathtub/shower in our room was peeling and rusty. Not a big deal, just not something I'd expect at a hotel like this. It makes me wonder how "clean" the rooms actually are. Key West is not a place you go to hang out in your room, and overall it was a nice, safe place to come home to every night. The pool was great! Zero gravity that was great for kids, because it eases into the water very subtly. We don't have kids yet, but our group did and the kids seemed to love it! The food was decent, nothing to write home about. There is no where to eat in walking distance, so if you're too lazy to ride into town, it was an easy, casual meal or buffet. And, again, the dining service was great. Another plus is that there is a convenience store right next to the hotel - we needed to use it several times for various products, water & beer runs. If you're looking for a quiet, relaxing place to stay and just need to go into the Key West action once a day, then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: catlady25
Reviews.Content: A friend and I, both senior widows, stayed at the Doubletree for 4 nights while in Key West, and were very happy with it. They welcome you with a warm chocolate chip cookie, which is to die for. Our room had a small balcony, overlooking the pool and patio, which was great for people watching as we enjoyed our happy hour. While the prices are not low budget, they are not bad considering nothing much is "cheap" in Key West. There is an excellent restaurant, a poolside bar, and good music going most of the time. The room itself was great, service was excellent, and you can get to either end of town (Duval Street) using their free shuttle service. We never touched our own car the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: mickyfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night @ Doubletree Grand Key Resort as a surprise birthday present for my husband's 40th. I had done research on Key West and the hotels available to stay in and kept coming back to choosing the Doubletree. I'm so glad I went w/ my gut decision to stay here. Our trip from Ft Lauderdale to the Keys was one I'd like to forget since my in laws car broke down in a not so great section of Miami. We quickly had it towed back to their home and hopped into a rental. The drive to Key West is beautiful. We were greeted w/ smiles and immaculately manicured grounds @ the Doubletree. Orianna is an angel!! She realized our trip was special for my husbands bday as well as the nightmare from the car breaking down and offered to upgrade our king room to a king suite! The room was huge & beautiful. 2 balconies overlooking the pool, jacuzzi tub, granite countertops, king size bed, 2 pull out couches and club chair/ottoman. 2 mini refrig, 1 micro, tons of cabinet space (no plates, utensils, etc though). Table w/ 4 chairs, 2 desks, 2 tv's. The bed is so comfortable and the hotel is very quiet. The breakfast buffet is amazing, which we had included in our hotel package. The free shuttle service was perfect. It leaves the hotel every hour, on the hour, and drops off @ mallory square/duval st area as well as the southernmost point area. They run exactly on time, which is nice. The lobby area is gorgeous, huge salt water aquarium, water center w/ fresh orange, lemon or lime in each water container. Free wi-fi in each room & around the property. The pool was great, zero depth entry, plenty of chairs and one small hot tub that we didn't use (80 degrees & sunny out =) We received (from Orianna) 2 comp drinks @ their pool bar - great drinks!) We were even able to check out late (2pm) and leave our car parked @ doubletree while we headed into town to shop (used the shuttle service too). We will definately return to Key West and stay @ the Doubletree. Thanks so much, again, Orianna! You are a model for customer service and a great representation of Doubletree! Wish we had more time in the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby13
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Key West and found the Doubletree Grand the best place to stay. Even though it was not right on the "strip" it was nice that it was a quiet hotel and with the shuttle service we did not miss anything going on in town. Also since the island is so small we rented bikes for a day and found we could get to everywhere we wanted to go without the shuttle. The concierge and staff were great. They arranged everything we wanted to do and offered wonderful suggestions. The bikes were brought right to the hotel, if there was someplace that you wanted to go that was not on the shuttle route just ask they had no problem getting us there. The cookies were a nice treat every night also. The pool area was divine with the different decks. As far as we are concerned this is where we will stay when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: alltrvlallthetime
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff went out of their way to accomadate. The only exception to this was the female hostest at breakfast, who was always over excited and super stressed out. If you are looking for a base of operations to do things in and around key west, this is a great place. There is no view of the water (mostly just a parking lot on all sides of the hotel), but the closest they have is on the fourth floor on the front side of the hotel. The hotel needs a little upgrading in the rooms, but it is okay for the money you pay. The price for a drink is good, but food is overpriced (I cannot believe I am saying to go to Duval Street for a decently priced meal). The only two truely dissapointing things about my stay here were the couples massage (overpriced and weak...it did nothing for me, but my wife loved it) and the fact that they endorse Sunset Water Sports (see my review on these guys...run the other way).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A_W_LL
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night, unfortunately they were booked :*.Stuff was very nice but it was never explained to me that the hotel charges additional $36 fee just in case something was to be damaged, I found out after I checked my bank statement ! So I'm still waiting for that money to be deposited back .. Pool was just amazing, free shuttle to the beach, city love it !!! Rooms small but cozy !!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob4u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many other places in Key West. Even though we have stayed at 4 star properties we would definately stay at the Double Tree again. It has a nice relaxing vibe. Mike at the pool was excellent!!!! He made our stay. Front desk workers were so so. Some nice some not so nice. They need to work on consistancy there. Found a coupon on line for free breakfast for 2 and they would not accept even though the coupon did not have any restrictions. Not a big deal we went to Winn Dixie and bought fruit and yogurt for breakfast. The room had a mini fridge which was nice. Rooms were comfortable could probably use a refresh but they were comfortable and clean and cozy. Pool area is nice and relaxing with a hot hot tub. Shuttle service was great to have as parking is very hard to do in town (and costly, not to mention we always saw cars with parking tickets). The last shuttle was at 11:20pm since it was Fantesy Fest it would be nice if they ran a little later. They also will shuttle you to the beach where you can use beach chairs for free from the Double Tree. You get them at the same stand where they are renting chairs and umbrellas for $10 each so that is a very nice service. Once again we have stayed at many other hotels in Key West with higher price tags and ratings but this place just has a great relaxing vibe going for it and we would pick it again even over the 4 start Marriott Beach. Friendly staff, clean , comfortable rooms and just plain relaxing. Good job Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: HGreene
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Doubletree Grand Key Resort for your next vacation in Key West. We stayed for 4 days and the service is absolutely the best. You are welcomed with warm Doubletree cookies (which are by far the best cookies ever) and the check in process is easy and simple. The concierge is happy to offer up wonderful tips for things to do, places to see, and local restaurants and watering holes. I was with my boyfriend and my parents. My dad and boyfriend went deep sea fishing and caught a ton of mahi mahi and yellow tail. They brought it back to the hotel and they cooked us a fabulous meal for dinner as well as lunch the following day. They were very accommodating and were first rate at their customer service. The pool bartenders were always extremely pleasant and talkative. The breakfast buffet in the mornings was top notch with numerous options and wonderful taste. I was very sad to leave, but when I make Key West my vacation spot again in the near future, Doubletree will be 1st on my list for hotel accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: BobNJ
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Nice lobby with a not too expensive restaurant. The pool and bar area are nice. Seemed to be a nice blend of families and young people going to Duval Street for the nightlife. They run a free shuttle to Duval but the last one back is about midnight. After that it is a $20 cab ride. Free parking as well. What I really liked is that it is away from the madness of Duval but close enough to go when you want. Lots of planes overhead but Key West is not big so I would assume that is everywhere. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Would definitely book again if I go back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location of the Doubletree and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: JandK-travelDuo
Reviews.Content: If you do want a nice, clean, quiet place to stay, and don't mind being outside of the town, near the entrance to Key West, then we suggest the Doubletree. Use the every-hour van shuttle to and from town, the 2 dropoff / pickup spots are centrally located, but do require you to walk a couple blocks to Duval. Would be great if they added more stops. If you don't want to walk much you could rent bikes, hail a pedi-cab or a taxi-cab. The Doubletree is located near the airport, also nearby is the Marriot, also offering shuttle service, which is a must since they are on the opposite end of the action of Duval. Parking is limited downtown, so go early if you are driving. We enjoyed a nice room, although small, everything very clean, and enjoyed the swimming pool with bar service closeby. There was a musician on Friday afternoon at the pool creating a soothing backdrop. Could see / hear some planes take off, but not disturbing. Family friendly. We would definely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no frills but nothing lacking”
Reviews.Author: pkk29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to take a mini-vacation to the keys without spending a lot of money. We stayed at this hotel using our Hilton points. It was nothing luxurious but met all our needs. The staff was helpful. The shuttles to the beach and inside the main Key West area were reliable and helped save on cost. It was a bit hard to time it right because the shuttles run once an hour, but it was not too troublesome. Sometimes, the shuttles are early, so make sure to get there at least 5 to 10 minutes before their stated arrival times. They will not wait too long.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Resort makes you want to return”
Reviews.Author: reron22
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Resort was everything we expected and more! This was our first trip to Key West so we did a lot of research on the internet. Being a Hilton Honors member made the choice even easier. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the pool. You need to make that request when booking. It is well worth the few extra bucks. After a busy day and evening hitting all the hot spots in Key West it was wonderful to sit on the balcony, listen the Jimmy Buffet music piped in at the pool area and have your beverage of choice. That really makes me want to return. Also the good care you get from the staff is hard to beat....again makes you want to return. This resort is very laid back....you don't feel you have to dress to impress if you take your meals there. The Hotel is a bit from all the bars and clubs, but the hotel offers a free shuttle that runs every 30 mins into town. It runs into the wee hours of the night for the serious party people. The shuttle ride in itself is a party! The drivers are entertainers and tour guides and everyone is in a party mood. I never thought the shuttle ride would be so much fun.The resort is not one of those super upscale places that can sometimes be a bit stuffy. Very nice but not elegant. The staff is great. We left some inexpensive jewelry at the hotel and made a phone call on our way home, and within days it was all returned. That says something about the staff. If at all possible we will return...get the balcony rooms. Check out their web site for all other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are what put the Grand in the resort name!”
Reviews.Author: NHGrammyG
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days first week of Oct. 2010 ... From the front desk staff to the bell person, the staff is great... friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the pool, resturaunt and our balcony with the rocking chair, table and lounge chair. The hotel is off the beaten path, but runs a shuttle down town on a regular schedule...the rooms and beds are comfy and meals are good. We rented a car for the drive from Ft Lauderdale, so took it to Ft. Zachary for snorkeling ... great place to snorkel and if you don't have a car, rent a bike it is not far! We have our own snorkel gear, but you can rent it at the park if you need to... lots of pretty tropical fish swimming out among the rocks... we went two days out of four... use lots of sunscreen. Also, visit Truman's little White House, do Lloyds Tropical Bicycle Ride and one of the ghost walking tours!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: meme2four
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were lucky enough to stay in the Doubletree Grand Key Resort for one night in August. We sure wish we could have spent a week (or more) there as we were treated like royalty and the entire place was beautiful, luxurious, clean and welcoming. Every single staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful, making us feel like old friends who had returned when, in fact, we had never even been to Key West before.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend them ...I had a great time !!!”
Reviews.Author: my3demonz
Reviews.Content: I would like for everyone to know just how over the top our service was at this Resort. Great customer service...thank you Angel Always willing to make our stay more enjoyable Great food I felt as if we were long time friends Shuttle service was great...thank you Richard for putting up with the 4 of us I think it was Jose that gave us a great tour on the suttle I can't tell you in words how much FUN and RELAXATION we had Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for less price than most in Keys”
Reviews.Author: ensc23
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. Staff was very friendly, and we received emails prior to our trip offering to help with activity and spa reservations. There were many little things that made you feel welcome at this hotel. It wasn't as expensive as many of the hotels on the island and there was a shuttle to Duval Street, I wished it would have run later at night. My only complaint is that they charged for parking and we weren't told about it, and didn't catch until our bill arrived, but we had the charges removed. Overall, great stay and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Their policy on hurricane related cancellations is strict and anti-customer!”
Reviews.Author: Nirol_Semaj
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at Doubletree this week but unfortunately due to the impending hurricane watch for our area decided to cancel our plans. The airline is encouraging people to do rebook at this time so we did. Then proceeded to call Doubletree, expecting the same courtesy, however they will not allow us to rebook our trip, even though the hurricane is on the same path that we would use to fly to Miami. Doubletree states that hurricane is a valid reason for rebooking, however, due to the fact that our flight hasn't been cancelled yet, they will not refund our money, even though the airline is allowing people the option of cancelling voluntarily without penalty. We have to eat the WHOLE cost of the prepaid trip. We even offerred to pay the change penalty AND the cost to upgrade our reservation to a regular, non-pre-paid so that we could rebook and they said no, due to the fact that we are supposed to arrive within 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: KarenSMichigan
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely. The balcony overlooked the back parking lot.... nice and quiet.... just how we like it. Bed was comfortable. We decided last minute to stay an extra day in order to spend more time with our daughter and they were able to accomodate us. We had the breakfast buffet a couple times and it was good. The location was perfect for us as our daughter's apartment was next door and we prefer to staying on the quieter end of the island ..... away from Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessicavcortes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove to Key West from the Tampa area for a 3 day romantic getaway for my 28th birthday. I had no idea where to stay so of course I read several reviews on various hotels and bed & breakfasts before choosing the Doubletree. To be honest, we wanted something nice but not super expensive and close to everything but not right on Duval. When I saw that the Doubletree offered free shuttle service, that was one of the main deciding factors for me. Not to mention the pictures of the awesome pool with cabanas too. Everything about this hotel was great....we actually arrived around 12:30pm and was able to check into our room early. We got a balcony room that overlooked the amazing pool and of course the chocolate chip cookie was to die for LOL. The shuttle service runs every hour on the hour and is definitely a $$ saver. We purchased the hotel through Expedia and it included a buffet breakfast which was good, not great but good. The price of the food and drinks that we ordered by the pool were a little pricey, but that's to be expected at most hotels. Parking was free, which was a plus. The only negative, if you want to call it that, would be for the shuttle to run more often that once every hour. There were a couple of times where if we weren't our rude NY selves, we wouldn't have gotten on the shuttle the first time around :-) Overall, our experience at the Doubletree couldn't have been better and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Key West!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great cool, awesome pool, but...”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 8 days back in June and we loved it. The room was spectacular, the pool scene (we loved Mike) was beautiful, and the bus service to downtown Key West was very convenient. The "...but" in the title has to do with the fact that my fiance bought an engraved $5.00 seashell, for her niece, from a vendor downtown and the name had to be specially engraved and delivered to the hotel. When we checked out, the shell had not arrived yet, so the hotel offered to send the shell to us once it arrived at the hotel. Amazingly, we received the shell a few weeks later from the hotel with an almost $21.00 shipping charge on my fiance's credit card. Nothing like offering to send something to you, then charging an insane amount for shipping a $5.00 item. I have made 3 calls to the hotel manager, each time they were not available, and I still have received no call backs. I have a family member who is a general manager for a Hilton property and he says that this is not the way Hilton usually does business. and yes, Doubletree is a Hilton property. All-in-all, I cannot rate this hotel poorly, it was beautiful and out of the Duval hustle and bustle of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “starting to show some signs of wanting something better”
Reviews.Author: NjFuzzy
Reviews.Content: It was our second time there. The most memorable occasion was the headboard banging against the wall from the neighbors at night. At that point, I didn't feel like the room was all that clean, especially the comforters on the beds. We had a pool view ($20 extra per night). The smell of smoke coming up from the bar was not nice. Also, the music was pretty crappy style and loud until around 10 p.m. and yet no one was down there. So, we couldn't have the sliding glass door open to the wonderful key west breeze. Next, since it seems that some people are able to get breakfast included (it's too expensive if it isn't), we tried going to the deli behind the hotel. The guy was very grumpy. When asking for a breakfast sandwich, you only get what he has (and probably what he wants to give) despite a menu with all the various options. The shuttle bus seemed to be more crowded than the previous year. People actually sat near the steps or stood. They also eliminated one stop on the other end of Duval street -- so your forced to walk back to Conch Republic, which could be a 20 minute walk. They do a good job with keeping the shuttle running to town on time and try to accomodate everyone. We ended up having the Christmas brunch as everything in town seems closed up tight. I did ask for meat that was well done one time they took it back and finished cooking it, the other time they didn't offer it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO TO KEY WEST IN JULY!”
Reviews.Author: NAUTICL1
Reviews.Content: This is an OK Doubletree--not as nice as most that I have stayed at, but would stay here again. We chose this hotel because they had complimentary pick up from the airport & we didn't want to spend the extra $$ to rent a car. Plus parking at the hotels it cost an extra $10 to $15 per day and finding a park downtown is not an easy thing to do and will cost you $$. Once you are downtown, rent a bike or glorified golfcart! On the hour from 8am to 11pm this hotel offers shuttle service to 3 different stops in Key West, which was a PLUS! We walked everywhere once we were dropped off at the Conch Republic Seafood Restaurant. I don't advise going in JULY, I live in the south I am used to hot and humid conditions----HOWEVER, not used to Hotter than 4 Hells! Just Kidding! Just be sure to take a towel with you for wiping sweat!!

Reviews.Title: “Sounds more 'Grand' than it is.”
Reviews.Author: CAROLE3
Reviews.Content: Gateway to hotel very impressive, as was reception. The room was lovely and spacious with a huge balcony with a table and four chairs. This overlooked the Tikki Bar immediatly beneath it and therefore we couldn't see the pool at all. Although located quite a way out from Key West there is a free shuttle bus which runs on the hour to and from Key West. This is very useful but we found that Key West was quite 'driveable' and so only used the shuttle bus once. We had room service at dinner time and the service and food was very good. Angel at reception was particularly helpful. Our second day was marred by a very noisy and boisterous marine re-union. This stopped us from using our balcony as the noise and language emanating from the gathering was awful. Themanagement made no effort to control the noise levels which started in the late morning and carried on until late in the evening. I have no problem with lads enjoying their recreation time - BUT - not at the expense of other guests. We complained to staff about the noise but nothing was done and when we checked out we were reluctantly given a small discount which amounted to the one night's lack of balcony use. a miserly $25. We were also surprised to find that when we returned to our room on the first day at 4.30pm, housekeeping had not been and we had to request service. We would have awarded this hotel 4 stars but the lack of service and attention to complaints reduced this to three stars.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: UPENN_CLASSof1999
Reviews.Content: Key West is such a fun place. We stayed at this Doubletree property cause of it's value and amenities. The cookies at check in are always a pleasure. Pool is maintained well and rooms have a unique decor that fits Key West. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: DrFran05
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at a number of hotels over the past 20 years and this is the first time that I can remember writing a customer appreciation letter. Your entire staff deserves a warm thanks because they embody the spirit of true team players and are individuals who values good customer service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: mariesgrdn
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traveled here for a girl's weekend away. The front desk could have used a little more warmth upon our arrival, we felt as though we were an inconvenience to the deskwoman as we checked in. The room we were given also needed additional housekeeping. We noticed trash still in wastebaskets, int he fridge, and under the bed, as well as mildew in the shower and a dirty fridge/kitchen area. When we called down, the night manager, Keith, was very helpful, taking pictures and addressing our concerns. We were relocated a few doors down and found the same mildew in the shower, but the room was in better condition. My mother is a Hilton diamond member, and we were getting an upgrade the following day, so we decided the room was acceptable for the evening. The following day, our brunch server, Ansanbek, made our morning! Even though it was a buffet breakfast, he went out of his way to get us everything we needed. He was courteous and polite, and always there when a plate needed to be removed or a glass refilled. We also received wonderful service from our bellman Fausto when we relocated to the upgraded room. He was patient as we finished packing and cheerfully loaded each piece of luggage with care. Our new room was fabulous! Very well cleaned and with a wonderful view of the pool. In all, a little hospitality goes a long way. Keith, Ansanbek, and Fausto turned some negative situations into wonderful ones.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: creekbrat
Reviews.Content: wow! the review b4 this says alot and so right. we live in nc and after a long drive to southern FL we took a rest from driving and went down to key west as a day &1/2 trip a couple days later. we figured we would check to see if we could at least get some info on the area, because after all it was only 1150am, and not all their guests from the night b4 had checked out. to our surprise, not only were they incredibly helpful on the area, but allowed us to go ahead and check in, not to mention we were handed wonderful warm cookies. the next day, we had a great breakfast(and service) and we had to check out, but our service did not end there. we were allowed to leave our vehicle in the parking lot, while we went down to take a snorkeling/dolphin activity, we were also still allowed to use their shuttle and to top it off when we came back from snorkeling to get our car, we were allowed to use their "changing"room which also had a shower and supplies in it.......that was WONDERFUL! it was great not to have to find somewhere fast food to eat dinner or to drive 4 hours in wet suits. the place was awesome......only thing that could possibly make it better is if our room had a view of the water, but who cares, all the rest way surpassed what i was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again without a doubt!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BillPortCarbonPa_
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated 20 yrs together at this hotel/resort and we couldn't have been any happier! First of all, the staff, from the shuttle drivers to the front desk manager to the caretaker out at the pool were 2nd to none. The breakfast served in the lobby/resturaunt area was fantastic, a little advice( when you book your trip ask for the bed and breakfast deal, we saved 90 bucks) great way to start your day!! Great drinks at the Gumbo Limbo Tiki bar, a little pricy but you are on vacation, what the hell!! Room was very clean and spacious, slept great . Shuttle service saved us about 250 to 300 in cab fare and was always on time, drivers were informative about best places to eat. Overall I would like to say that if your coming to Key West stay here,you'll enjoy you stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff resents the Gringos”
Reviews.Author: travelsmyth
Reviews.Content: It's June 2010 as I write this because I'm still pissed. Hand written letters to the G.M. and V.P. at corpoate must have been used foe other purposes. Ya know what? This won't do any good either. I can't believe I didn't just knock out a couple of shuttle drivers. Miguel,a shuttle driver from Cuba, was pontificating the evils of the Whites throughout the history of this country. The 1stThanksgiving celebration was a trap to lure the Indians into the fort to kill them? Then there was Jose. He just hates being inconvenienced and was rather rude about it. My wife kept me from going to jail.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: akuntrygirl
Reviews.Content: Below is a letter I wrote to the hotel's general manager: Dear Mr. Knowles: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort to attend a friend's wedding. Admittedly, I am a tough nut to crack because I began my professional career in hospitality, working in five-star properties. Consequently, my customer service standards are extremely high; however, I have to say that the hospitality and kindness displayed by your Guest Services Manager Kevin Hill deserves nothing less than the highest praise possible. During an impromptu bridal shower, our gathering became a little noisy. Mr. Hill very respectfully explained the situation to us and offered to move us to another location so that the celebration of the bride could continue without bothering other guests. Obviously, Mr. Hill could have approached the situation with a strong-arm but in his wisdom, kindness and patience he fostered a spirit of cooperation that produced a result conducive to all involved â€“ not an easy feat when dealing with dueling priorities. Again, I donâ€™t even feel that my words adequately express our gratitude. Mr. Hill is a warm, generous, kind, gracious and patient man. What special experiences we had thanks to Mr. Hillâ€™s hospitality. You can rest assured that I will spread the good news that customer service is indeed alive in Key West Florida - all you have to do is visit the Doubletree Grand Key West Resort! Kudos to the management team for setting the bar so high and empowering your team members to do whatever it takes to reach beyond the pinnacle! P.S. You have to try their Turkey Club! It has got to be the best sandwich I have ever had in my life. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience - The”
Reviews.Author: ushirl
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel on June 4th, 2010. The check-in process was normal and smooth. When I arrived into my room there was a maintenance person who was trying to fix the bathroom light. After 30 minutes of entering and leaving the room and leaving the room door wide open with us in the room, the man left the room and didnâ€™t even tell us he was leaving. In addition, the light did not work the entire time we were checked in since he removed the light (not referring to the light bulb). I am referring to the light fixture. After an hour of still trying to get myself settled into the room housekeeping was now trying to enter the room. After a 4 hour drive the last thing I wanted was people entering the room. In addition, I called the front desk to advise what was going on and they didnâ€™t even know that maintenance was in the room working on the light. Later in the day the front desk manager called my room to find out what was going on. He didnâ€™t believe that a maintenance person had done this. I explained to the manager if he called to find out what happened then I would tell him, but donâ€™t call me a liar on the information I am giving him. The following day I went to the front desk to obtain â€œfree continental breakfastâ€�. The front desk said there wasnâ€™t such a thing. There was only coffee. There was a full buffet breakfast that cost us usd28.00 for 2 people. They also told you about the charge after you sat down and had already picked up the breakfast. But the voucher is incorrect in stating there is a free continental breakfast. I must say that the hotel wasnâ€™t up to double tree standards. In fact I was extremely disappointed at the lack of interest in resolving problems. I was at the hotel because of a wedding. I am extremely upset at the entire experience and completely unsatisfied with my entire stay. The last and final problem was the ants that were in the room. I was beginng to believe that this was common in Key West Hotels until I visited other friends hotels which were impecable. This hotel is not beachfront. There is a big driveway and the beach maybe nearby but not beachfront as the hotel revirews say. Spend a little extra and stay at Casa Marina...

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation thanks to Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: uptownnyc
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays at a hotel and I do alot of traveling. I had taken my 80yr old parents on a vacation in the keys as a gift for their 48 anniversary. They were sooo pleased with the double tree resort that I picked. I didn't know quite what to expect but it was like a mini resort. I met quite a few people who had stayed at the hotel before. I never stayed before but the reviews on line were wonderful. Everything was done by your front desk staff to accommodate my mother who couldn't walk a lot due to some recent surgery. Angel from New York at the front desk was so kind to take good care of them to ensure they had a comfortable and great time. He gets my vote for employee of the month. I feel like double tree family now. I don't believe your staff could have been any more wonderful. I've already recommended this hotel to a few friends and family. Definitely would go back...Great Vacation thanks to Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/value”
Reviews.Author: sharron24
Reviews.Content: Great choice, especially for the money. Pool area is great, the hourly shuttles to the beach and Duval St are extemely convenient. Only suggestion would be to add one later shuttle from Duval, as the latest is 11:20, had to take a taxi one night as we stayed out later.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Not-So-Grand”
Reviews.Author: glenndora
Reviews.Content: Our family utilized this hotel for a three-night visit to Key West. We found the accomodations to be the usual Doubletree fare and satisfactory for a good place to sleep. It was, however, not what we expected front something billed as a "resort". The location was good for access to the airport but that is about all. It is far from the Key West sights and beaches but they do provide scheduled shuttle service. As Hilton diamond members, we were provided complimentary breakfast but considering the crowd a breakfast every morning, it looked like everyone at the hotel had a complimentary breakfast. The breakfast food and service was similar to one would find at a Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express. There were also large groups of young adults who seemed to be associated with the government crowding the breakfast and pool area throughout the day. For our last evening, we decided to move over to the Casa Marina Resort nearby which was fantastic!!! The move completely changed our attitude and overall experience in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: realtor99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Arrived early and was not able to check in until 2 PM, which was fine, just spent that time getting familiar with the island. We reserved a king suite, which was 2 rooms, living/kitchen area with tv and bedroom with tv. Balconey off of both rooms. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub as well as a separate shower. There were 2 refrigerators, a microwave and a coffeemaker. The beds were comfortable, there were plenty of pillows and towels and housekeeping kept the room immaculate. It always helps to tip housekeeping, it lets them know you appreciate what they are doing for you. Spent some time at the tiki bar, ate a couple of small meals there too. Food was good, as were the drinks. They did have music in the afternoons and early evening. They also have a restaurant. Evidentally they were at capacity, but it was still enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: edenpt
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were pleasantly greeted by all of the hotel staff on arrival. As requested we were given the top floor and away from the elevator. The room was very nice and clean with island style decor overlooking the spacious pool. Only wish was that TV would have been an LCD. For Key West we thought the hotel grounds were spacious and beautifully landscaped. The huge pool area with cabanas was a real plus and we found lunch and drinks by the pool to be excellent and reasonably priced for a hotel. Service by all attendants was outstanding and they came and removed all items almost as soon as we finished them. We loved the breakfast buffet (we normally do not care for buffets) but all items were freshly made and the waffles with fresh strawberrys were wonderful along with numerous other items. The free shuttle to points in Key West on the hour was a great convenience and one driver provided interesting details about the island. Parking and driving on the island are a real pain so we used this on every trip in. The hotel is quietly set away from tourist areas and we found this a real plus too. Beaches are very close to hotel and shuttle will drop you at Smathers where you are entitled to use free beach chairs when you show your room key. In fact, they will drop you pretty much any where you want but there are only 3 pick up points. Try a rumrunner at the beach bar... it is a great Key West drink!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with relaxing environment and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: artsygirl56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West for three days and stayed at the Doubletree. It was a great experience! Everything was clean, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast buffet was wonderful, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The pool area is very nice with a bar and live music in the evenings. There is also a complimentary shuttle to the downtown area, so we didn't have to drive anywhere our entire trip. Overall, I don't think you can go wrong with this hotel. Enjoy the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, affordable, lack of follow through w/ front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisakae
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try a new hotel this trip (we come to Key West every year) with a big sunny pool, and we also didn't want to break the bank (easy to do in KW). DB Grand Key was a very good choice. Bright sunny pool with live music, nice sized clean room, and delicious breakfast buffet and drinks. The ONLY cons I could find were the 3 times we interacted with the front desk on issues our messages never got followed through. I DID learn not to book a smoking room (husband is the smoker and I wanted him to at least be able to smoke on balcony) but room reeked of smoke. Blech. Tried to get the front desk to very politely swap rooms since we hadnt unloaded the car yet. Waited 20 minutes and never got a call back. Decided since it was MY fault I would suck it up and stay. We got to hotel early and asked if it was OK to lounge at pool while we waited for room since we got there 3 hrs ahead of check in, they told us they'd call out cell once it was ready. Never got the call, even after check-in time. And when we called down to get a taxi, they said they'd call, waited 20 minutes, and find out call was never made. LASTLY theres only one elevator per side fo hotel and you cannot use the stairs unless there is a fire. But other than those things nice place to stay. Cannot say I wouldnt return.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING/CLEAN/FRIENDLY/PET FRIENDLY/CLEAN/GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: 8surf
Reviews.Content: A VERY PLEASANT experience. Pet friendly, and EXTREMELY CLEAN. The staff was courteous, friendly, and helpful. The rooms were of more than adequate size and very clean. Breakfast was delicious, all you could eat, excellent food selection, and reasonably priced. The location of the Hotel is nicely placed to get you away from the hustle and noise of Duval street yet close enough to be there in minutes. The cleanest and nicest place I have stayed in a long time and yet allowed 2 toy poodles who are extremely pampered but none the less are pets. I have already recommened Double Tree Grand Key resort to several people. To Management and Staff- keep up the good work and THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Trainfan59
Reviews.Content: Double Tree Grand Key Resort location is perfect. You drive down Hwy 1 turn left and less than a mile you are at your resort. Free shuttle on the hour to Key West down town 2 stops. The Pool is outsanding!!! Mike "The Pool Guy" is very personable and enjoyable to talk to while your enjoy the hot tub or the pool. Asa the night clerk was kind and warm hearted. Gift shop has very nice clothes at reasonable pricing in case you forgot to pack a nice outfit to wear out at night. My Torres front desk cleck and every one at the front desk welcome me and made us feel "At Home". All the employees have a great attitude while doing their job from what i seen they all smiled and said hello when you walked down the hall or sitting in the lobby. I will return to this location next time I get to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in paradise with some breathing room”
Reviews.Author: Marylander44
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Key West: This resort is located very close to the Key West airport, with a free shuttle for airport runs. This shuttle also leaves the hotel on the hour for runs to the beach or downtown. The resortâ€™s primary outdoor feature is the pool, located in the back in the middle of the hotel, with rooms on the building that is shaped like a U around the pool. The pool was beautiful, with waterfalls, plenty of lounge chairs and tables, cabanas, and the opportunity to get a drink at the outside bar or a massage under a cabana. Standard rooms were a bit small, but we werenâ€™t in it very long! Housekeeping staff was very nice, and the staff everywhere made you feel welcome. Front desk was especially customer service oriented. The fitness room was larger than normal, with an array of cardio machines, as well as some weight equipment. Breakfast buffet was $12.95, with an array of meats, eggs, and fresh fruit. Parking was $10. This would be a great place for a long weekend getaway flying into EYW, with no car needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Resort for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: jmanini
Reviews.Content: We both enjoyed our stay at the Grand Key Resort. The staff were wonderful and always accomidating. I wish they played music at the tiki bar though. Most times basketball was on the flat screens. I did not go to Key west to watch basketball at the outside tiki bar. Also the live entertainment was there only on the weekends?? I though everyday was Saturday on vacation. Besides the music issues It was a great time. Alfonse was the entertainer during the weekends and he was certainly a great talent and we enjoyed getting to know him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: im12nv
Reviews.Content: Overall my wife and I had a great experience with this hotel. The staff is wonderful and will take care of all your needs. The room was average, like the majority of all hotels. (Beds, bathroom, TV, cable, etc.) The hotel lobby is well above average and has a wonderful round aquarium in the center. The pool was nice, not a large as it appears in all of the pictures, but nice. The hotel shuttle to downtown was unexpected plus, but does need to run until at least 2:25 AM. The hotel should also think about an additional shuttle during the busy season. The breakfast buffet was ok at best, food quality was not as good as expected after hearing people say they enjoyed it. The fruit was not ripe and most of the buffet was almost cold. (Not sure of the dinner, we choose to eat at local restaurants.) Like I said overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Property, Small Rooms, Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: Divehpu
Reviews.Content: This is a quality Hilton owned property with great service, a great pool, a good restaurant and bar, and only a fair location. Our room was small and without a balcony, but clean, nicely furnished and reasonably quiet. If I were to go back I would definitely get a room with a balcony. The biggest drawback for this hotel is that it is located in the northern part of the Key and all the action is downtown. On the upside the hotel offers free shuttle service to and from many downtown locations. The shuttle was mostly on time and the hotel always sent a second shuttle within 10-15 minutes if the first shuttle was full. Also, if you ask at the front desk and someone is available they will take you to other locations on the island. We requested and received rides to Charter Boat Row and the airport. Finally, if you fly in to KW you can call the hotel and they will pick you up at the airport, which will save you $20 for a five minute cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler103
Reviews.Content: Where the Doubletree Grand Key lacks in location, the staff more than makes up for with service. If you are choosing this hotel, be warned that it is kind of in the middle of nowhere...and taxis or scooters are going to be the way you'll want to go. But the service is above and beyond. If you are lucky enough to meet Angel at the front desk, you are in for quite a treat. He, along with the rest of his staff, make you feel like you're vacationing with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy, but Gets the Job Done”
Reviews.Author: Redbird_Craig
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is on the other side of where all the action is in Key West, but it's not a problem b/c there's a shuttle that comes around every hour or so. The guy who drives the daytime shuttle, John, is a good guy to ask about the history and stuff to see around the area. He also is very willing to drop you off anywhere you like, so he's the goods. The room itself is nothing fancy- just your basic hotel room with an average TV and a hard-to-regulate temperature control in the room. If you don't have a laptop, they've got Internet access but it's painfully slow. However, the pool is very nice, the rooms are clean, the shower is good, the bed comfortable, and the service exceptional. My wife liked the decor, but being a guy I only notice whether or not the TV works. :) All in all, a very nice hotel that we'd stay in again. You're not there to sit in a hotel room, you're there to experience Key West, and their service allows you to do that with ease and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Sister Trip 50th B-Day Party”
Reviews.Author: Mambi77
Reviews.Content: Me and my three sisters went to Key West for our oldest 50th birthday celebration and we stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key. It was great! The minute we checked in we were made to feel right at home and it did not stop until they put us on the plane to go home. Everything from the warm cookies at the desk to the shuttle drivers taking us out of the way so we did not have to walk far to our favorite eating joint made the trip amazing. We love the Doubletree Grand Key and tell everyone we know about it. The hotel was clean, well maintained and the employees were friendly and warm; you could not ask for a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely retreat”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for two nights. It is a beautiful hotel and has a wonderful pool area. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each day. We did not use the shuttle because it ran every hour and felt it would be more convenient to drive downtown. If you do drive downtown, bring plenty of quarters. One day we rented bikes and rode all over the island. It was a great way to see the island. We were able to have the bikes delivered to the hotel. The concierge was very helpful in arranging the delivery of the bikes.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mugsyb74
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were treated with respect and courtesy. The bellhops were great, check in was a breeze and staff smiled and said hello when they passed you in the hall. Complimentary shuttles take you into Key West - about 5 mins. The heated pool is excellent. It has a gentle sloping place for little ones in one area. There is a hot tub and bar, as well as poolside massage. The whole pool area is clean and well tended. The common areas are neat and clean. You can tell the staff takes pride in this hotel. Our room was clean and beach themed. I felt relaxed when I entered for the first time. We did not stay in a suite, but I appreciated the fridge. Room service was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree staff very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: wvcousin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree first of March with my parents (retired) and the Doubletree staff were very accomodating to our needs: My father got a stomach flu the night before we were to depart on the Key West Express, and it was not running due to weather that day. The concierge quickly got us a rental car so that we could return home to Ft. Myers as planned, without causing my father anymore delay. We also found the shuttle drivers to be great tour guides, and the service ran like clockwork on the hour into town. The rooms were clean and the staff left us extra coffee/towels, etc when asked. The host at the breakfast buffet always had a smile, and seemed to interact with all guests as if he knew them. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveller73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite for two nights in mid-Feb. It was our first visit to the Keys. The property is beautiful. Our youngest daughter who has Down Syndrome enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Our college-age daughter and her friend took advantage of the shuttle and found it very convenient. The only drawback (and that would only be dependent on what activities you were interested in) would be the location as it is as far from the action of Duval Street as you can get.; but given the size of Key West you are never far from anywhere. The weather prevented us from doing some of the things we planned on but that is beyond anyone's control.

Reviews.Title: “A resort with everything!”
Reviews.Author: limermaid
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything to make a stay in Key West a memorable one. The staff is genuinely helpful and welcoming. The breakfast buffet is a great way to start your day- you won't be hungry until dinnertime! The shuttle is super convenient- no driving and scouting for a parking spot. Drivers have interesting commentaries on the local history and will drop you where you want to go in Old Town.The beach is nearby with watersports. The rooms are cozy and charming-with a balcony to relax on. The pool area is tropical and a beautiful spot to sip a libation.There is even a little deli on the premises! We shall return!!

Reviews.Title: “no water”
Reviews.Author: laborrep
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine hotel. Beautifully appointed, clean, first rate staff, lovely pool, etc. We suggest you ask for a room with a balcony on the poolside of the facility. As much as we loved this place we will opt for a hotel on the water next time.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is so tropical and nice we loved the salt water fish tank in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Cigarracer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Key several times and have never been let down. The value of the rooms makes it uncomparable to the rest of Key West. The pool and pool bar make you feel like your on your own island. I suggest it to all interested partys that want a island experience at a great rate. Wells Family

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: alwong2000
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here twice in a two week span. The first visit was for a four day vacation weekend with a friend. Didn't get any upgrades with Hilton Diamond status since the hotel was sold out for Martin Luther King Jr. weekend. Had a good stay overall and my friend had a good time also. The hotel is just down the street from the airport, but on the other side of the landing strip, so airplane noise was never an issue. Plenty of parking since it helps to have a car in the Keys (unless you only stay in Key West). There is an hourly shuttle to ferry people to Duval St. and back to the hotel. As someone who used to live in the Keys, I would recommend this location over the more rowdy atmosphere closer to Duval St. You are on the quieter side of the island and right down the street from Smathers Beach. Very comfortable beds and the regular rooms are fairly spacious. All rooms include an empty minifridge (bring your own drinks and food). TV's are 27" tubes, so those could use updating. On my second visit two weeks later due to some family business, I was upgraded to a two queen suite. Good size sofa bed and big balcony overlooking the pool along with the amenities above. What made the second visit better was the great service I got, particularly from Kevin, the night manager. He was instrumental in helping me and my family get two different rooms upgraded after a misunderstanding after our first night. He also went out of his way in assisting us with computer needs since the business center was swamped one night. He just generally made us feel welcome during out entire 6 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: CoriMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms and pool area were very nice and well kept. It was quiet and relaxing. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The best part was the convience of the shuttle service they offer. We did not take a cab or rent a car for our entire stay. They were able accomodate all of our transportation request. The main shuttle makes a big loop around the island all day. You can jump on and off and get close to almost any place you would want to go. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Grand Key delivered on Promises and made me Look Good”
Reviews.Author: travelingangler88
Reviews.Content: I am a Marketing and PR professional with 15 years of travel experience. I recently chose the Doubletree Grand Key as headquarters for a very important Media Outing. Karen Thurman and her friendly staff delivered on all they promised to do, and saved me from any frustration or embarrassment in the face of my clients and media guests. From Karen to the shuttle van drivers -- the Doubletree Grand Key staff understands good, prompt, customer service, and they know how to catch fish too. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and very enjoyable experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pookie0003
Reviews.Content: We had my parent's 50th anniversay party at the hotel as well as stayed there as guests. The staff was very helpful in planning the party as well as constantly checking with us to make sure that every thing was going well. The room was comfortable and clean. The hotel treated the kids very well also. Great experience and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing, a resort that gets it. Clean, courteous, and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: tveliz1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were met by a bellstaff that was attentive to our needs. The front desk staff was made my family feel as if they were welcoming us into their home. Upon entering our room we found it to be clean and spacious, after fifteen years managing hotels I am sure to all of those inconspicuous spots. Our room had a quaint balcony overlooking the beautiful pool area, complete with jacuzzi and pool bar. We hosted my parents fiftieth wedding anniversary at the resort and the staff continued to exceed our expectations. The staff (Norma, Tyrone,?) were there to anticipate our every request, when dealing with guests of honor in their seventies that is no easy task. Our weekend was one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Horrible Buffet Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: ve3avw
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place if you don't eat at the hotel. I have never had a worst breakfast buffet in my life. Completely tasteless. Sure its only 13 bucks, but its not worth a dollar. In terms of the room, staff etc .. everything was nice. Beds are comfortable, the resort is relaxing!! Hard to rate since it's to bad that they don't get their act around and hire a competent chef.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place....will stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: mrmrsddas731
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place, on our recent trip to Key West and even though we didnâ€™t get to explore much of it due to bad weather, and short stay it looked to be a decent place. One of the important things to note would be the friendly staff, we were checked in promptly and given an free upgrade upon request. They even called us in the room to make sure it was to our liking and made a reservation for us at the local restaurant for dinner. As far as our room was concerned, it wasnâ€™t anything noteworthy. My husband wasnâ€™t a big fan of the dÃ©cor and the way that the bathroom looked, he thought it was a little motelish, but overall I was totally fine with it, as long as it was clean, and that it appeared to be. Overall, I would recommend this place for being budget friendly and nice stay at a decent price in an expensive town.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I will come back next year; friendly staff, clean rooms, nice pool, can't say enough good things.”
Reviews.Author: justquarterhorses
Reviews.Content: WE came to Key West for New Years and had the absolute best time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Eduardo, Billy, Bill, and Eddie were smiling and pleasant everyday. The food was excellent. The shuttle was on time. We couldn't have picked a better hotel/resort. We like that it is dog friendly. We'll definately be back next year. Thanks from Heidi in Alabama.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: bevshan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,friendly staff and well maintained.Good sized,clean rooms.Despite not being in the heart of town they do provide a free shuttle service (which turns into a mini historic tour thanks to the friendly and informative drivers).

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GT6
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one night in December while in Key West for business. I liked that you do not have to pay to park like a lot of hotels in the area. During check in, the front desk staff were very helpful and quite personable. The room was decorated like you would expect a hotel room to be decorated in Key West. It had a fun beach feel, while being tasteful at the same time. The breakfast buffet was very good with a good selection of items to choose from. I will stay here again the next time I am in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexMcDaniel
Reviews.Content: We have had the best service every time we stay at the resort

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location??”
Reviews.Author: wycanone
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great service, and was clean and comfortable...but.... We booked this room through Expedia, the Bed and Breakfast rate. When completing the reservation, they asked if we wanted to upgrade to a balcony room for $5 per night. I thought it would be nice. Well, when we get to the hotel, evidently, the upgrade bumped us off the breakfast deal (but didn't reduce the rate, qu'elle suprise) Okay, we could deal with it, but then, the revelation...we brought our two small dogs (well traveled, well behaved and quiet). Guess where our "deluxe balcony room" was situated!? First floor, overlooking the service entrance. So not only did we lose our breakfast coupons, but we were given probably the cruddiest room in the joint! Employees were coming and going all night, made the dogs restless, and disturbed our sleep. So let's rate this hotel "dog tolerant", not dog friendly. Does no good to complain to Expedia, they really don't care...so do yourself a favor, book the room direct, get the entire "deal" in writing, and join the Hiltons Honors (we are members, but didn't identify when booking with Expedia) Because when you get to the property and they try to treat you like a "dog" you can get much better resolution through a rewards program. Other than this issue, the room was clean and comfy, just in a noisy third class section of the hotel. Also, be aware of the $!0 per night parking charge that isn't mentioned until you check in!

Reviews.Title: “Close to ocean, cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: jb2186
Reviews.Content: Very nice layout, they were undergoing construction when I visited so the pools were closed (big bummer). They left the shallow end open but that was about it. Rooms were very easy on the eyes, nice sailing theme with good colors. Bathroom was big and elegant. Right across the street from the ocean, the beach was pretty ugly though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, wish it was closer to Duval!”
Reviews.Author: JamB57
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay the last week of October at the Doubletree in Key West. Our room was clean and comfortable with decent amenities inside the room. The shower had a horrible drain, but we forgot to tell the hotel staff and didn't complain about it... so hopefully housekeeping caught it. The pool was beautiful and I can't say enough how awesome the free shuttle to and from Duval were. I wish they had one that ran later than 11:20 at night, but it was still utilized and a great time saver. Tip those drivers well, they saved you quite a headache trying to find parking. Everything about this hotel was great, just wish that it was closer to Duval! We will consider staying here again the next time that we visit Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kscAnchorage
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because rooms in Key West are very expensive and I didn't mind staying out of the center of town. It is closer than I thought and the free shuttle was very inviting. We did, however, take our rental car into town and did not find any trouble parking. It was the shoulder season. The hotel was great. Our room was nice, not fantastic, nice. The pool/bar/hot tub area was very well-done. The pool was just resurfaced. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and it wasn't anything special but we did get to eat outside. The room was clean, bed was comfortable and bathroom large with a spa tub and shower. We had a junior suite with a large balcony which we used a lot. The hotel has a deal with a beach concession which supplies chairs free of charge. You could take your car to it or take the shuttle. It was nice but a little inconvenient. The hotel rates made up for it I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and roomy but a bit far from Old Town attractions”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoc
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Grand Key Resort in Key West recently on a quick trip to Key West. We arrived very late, checked in and went to sleep right away so we didn't get a chance to check out much about the hotel. When I booked the room the website said that the pool was closed for renovation during our stay but they had made arrangements at a neighboring resort for guests to use that pool. Because we arrived late and checked out the next morning this wasn't an issue for us. They do have a free shuttle service that runs throughout the day between the resort and a few other key spots in town. I heard however that the shuttles get jammed during busy times and long waits are typical. I can't comment on that from personal experience however but Key West is difficult at the best of times to navigate and traffic jams are constant in the Old Town area. The room was very attractive and beach cottage themed. We had mostly a parking lot view with some wetlands beyond but no ocean or beach view. The room was comfortable but the beds were not as plush as I would have expected from a Doubletree hotel. Overall it was a perfectly fine place and the rate was reasonable for a Saturday night in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: gareichow
Reviews.Content: We ventured down to Key West for a weekend get away and loved this hotel. We got a last minute deal for Labor Day weekend. Hotel is very nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. Loved the free shuttle to and from the hotel to downtown. The shuttle will also take you to a small beach where there is access to beach chairs and water sports. The shuttle drivers were full of information and recommendations. They will also make extra stops if you ask. Hotel is not near downtown, however, it was therefore very quiet, and made a great escape from the noise and activity of the downtown area. We had a king size balcony room. Balcony was very small, just a few feet deep, but had to chairs and was a great place to drink your morning coffee and watch the sun come up. We had a view of the parking lot, but could slightly see the water. The pool area and nice with the zero entry and hot tub. The cabanas are a nice touch and a great place to escape the sun and enjoy a little privacy. There is also a tiki bar near the pool deck that is a great place to grab a pre or post dinner drink. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning, but it was free for us due to our Hilton Honors level. Not sure if I would pay for the continental breakfast, but the buffet did look good. We are avid bikers and took our bikes. Easy access to the bike paths from the hotel and the city is great place to explore via pedal power. Very bicycle friendly. Hotel is also very close to the public Key West golf course which we enjoyed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice but the rooms needed a little updating and to be checked by maintenance; also the staff was friendly but did not follow up with work orders (My smoke detector was beeping all night although I advised the front desk of the problem after I checked in)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ravjas
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus around spring break time. We returned for a nice week of relaxation and fun this August 2009. It's on the complete other side of town from Duval St., but that still isn't that far away, considering the island is 2 miles across. The hotel is very nice. Our room was nice too. We totally missed the safe in the end table until the day we left. It was clean and comfy and decorated nicely. We had a balcony over looking the pool. From afar the pool looks great, but in it, you see it's still nice, but needs some refurbishing. We still enjoyed it and the waterfall and the resident iguana in the palm tree. The elevators are slow, so we used the steps a lot. There is a nice bar outside too. That shuttle bus is fantastic. My 9 y.o. daughter loved riding it. It's a short ride to the beach, Duval St. or the other end of Duval St. John the bus driver was like a tour guide too. Things to check out while there....Guy Harvey's restaurant on Green St., Blonde Giraffe Key Lime Pie (I think better than Kermits), Shrimp Shack, The Rusty Anchor (both have great seafood), the top of the hotel where Starbucks is on Duval. It's a little known treasure. You can go to the top (highest point in Key West) after 3pm and have a 350 degree view of the city. Nice pics to take too. The lighthouse and definitely Hemingway house are fun. The butterfly conservatory is nice and I even enjoyed Ripley's Believe it or not. We've had fun parasailing with FURY and Dolphin Watching and snorkeling with Sunset. There are so many other things to do, of course, so don't be shy about trying everything. The beach is pretty, but no waves and extremely rocky. If you are going there for the beach, Key West is not the place to go. All in all, I'd stay at the Double Tree again. Next time, I just hope they turn the outside bar radio down. It stayed on loud until 2am. Never heard planes overhead.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, avoid the restaurant and bear with the high price”
Reviews.Author: archtraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked during Lobsterfest which meant that the hotel was full. As a result of booking late and arriving late, we ended up with a room that had no balcony and a screened window, with the room located next to the laundry room and ice machine. First, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They will go out of their way to help you if they can. Secondly, the fitness room is well stocked and include free weights. The tv's on the machines are a bonus. Thirdly, the food is overpriced. The brunch was good but too expensive for what you received. We also reserved for the Lobsterfest brunch for $49. US. We arrived 25 minutes early and had to wait. Strangely enough, people without reservations who just showed up were ushered in immediately. The brunch here was also overpriced for the quality and selection was limited. Fourthly, the hotel is overpriced by all standards except Key West. You would think that prices would be more competitive with all of the available accommodations in Key West. Fifthly, the $10. US plus taxes for parking is a bit of an insult and should be part of the hotel's overhead built into the price. They also charge .50 for each local call.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: ABTaylor
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Doubletree and probably my last. I noticed there were many dogs on the property and was informed that as of May 2009. It was not fun to hear barking dogs during my stay. Next the property is very outdated. All Hilton Hotel Brands that I have stayed in the past had flat screen TVs. This one still has the same furniture, carpeting, drapes from six years back! Parking is tight especially if you return late at night. When replenishing the toiletries, our housekeeper Cajuste tossed them in the corner (did not stack them neatly), did not clean the soap dish, did not wipe the living table, or leave a clean liner for the ice bucket. The room did have a fridge which was nice and complimentary wifi. The lady at the front desk informed us that the hotel was required to replace the tvs to flat screen or they could no longer have the DoubleTree name!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there over and over - EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: conch76
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best experience I have had in any Hotel I have ever stayed at. There wasn't one bad thing I could say about the hotel. Everything from the service, room, staff and the cleanliness was unbelieveable. No matter what time of day it was, they were always busy keeping the hotel clean. The staff was always attentive and willing to help in every way. We thouroghly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DoobyScooby
Reviews.Content: We own a place down in Naples, FL and we decided that we would like to go to see the keys. The place we stayed in was wonderful and I'm sure that it was on of the reasons why everyone liked the trip. When we got to the hotel at about 4pm a man took our luggage away into the lobby. We followed him. The check in was pretty fast, so the comfortable seats available and the complimentary coffee and tea weren't even needed. We were all given fresh warm chocolate chip cookies, which I guess was their way of showing how much they care. We were led to our rooms by another man, he carried our bags. The room was wonderful, we got 2 queen size beds separated by a small table with a lamp. There was also a TV and some comfortable seats to sit in, and a desk which had a cable internet wire attached to it. The internet was high speed. When I searched for WiFi networks, I have found one. It wasn't real fast, but still usable. Our room also had a bathroom with a bathtub and shower, a minibar and a coffee brewer. After unpacking we went to refresh ourselves in the hotel pool. It was large and I could swim laps in it. It was also very clean. A bus takes you to the city (Key West) every half a hour. We went at about 18:30. Bus driver Joe talked about Key West on the way, which was certainly fun. We had dinner in the city and then took the shuttle back to the hotel at 23:00 (the last bus comes at 11PM, the first at 8AM) We went to bed and in the morning we went to get breakfast. We could choose between a Continental breakfast, Contemporary breakfast or Traditional breakfast. We had contemporary.Scrambled eggs, bacon, pre-made pastries.... the food wasn't really that special but it sure was good. After breakfast we went to pack up our thing and called someone to take our bags down. This time we had to wait for a few minutes until someone was available to check us out. I paid about 100 dollars for the night, which I would say is a reasonable price. I enjoyed my stay in the Double Tree Grand Key Resort very much,

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: bearfriend
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree in Key West far exceded our expectations. From the moment we arrived the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The room was great and spotlessly clean. The shuttlebus also proved to be useful.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: coolgirl12379
Reviews.Content: Spent July 4 weekend at this hotel and found the staff helpful and friendly. Loved the free shuttle to Old Town and the drivers, who were a wealth of information and shared interesting stories about the island. Concierge was also very informative. Great pool. Loved that massage in a private cabana by pool. Bartendar at Tiki Bar was very entertaining. Hotel was very clean. Guest room was nice. Bed was really comfortable. Breakfast buffet was fabulous.and a real convenience. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Sucks”
Reviews.Author: burbil
Reviews.Content: First sign that our stay may not be the best was at check-in. Process was fine, but when I asked, to confirm that we would have a shuttle available to get us to the Ft. Jefferson Ferry at 7:00am as I was promised, I was told "Uh, Maybe, That depends. You will have to check in the morning to see if there will be anyone here to take you." This is not what I was told by the hotel reservations agent. (I made the reservations directly with the hotel, not Hilton for this reason. To verify shuttle, and I did tell them I already had tickets purchased on line.) When I noticed the concierge (Debbie) at her desk, I asked her the same question. She checked her log of people going on the ferry, she asked my name and then said it wasn't on her list. I told her, as I had told the reservation clerk and the desk, that I had purchased the tickets a week before making my reservations at the hotel, and was told it would not be a problem. She said the hotel can only guarantee transport to the docks, leaving an hour earlier than normal, if the ferry tickets were purchased through the hotel. After chatting with her a bit she said she would try and have transport available, if the airport driver was there to take us. Not to worry as the ferry never leaves on time (8:00am) Spouse and I went out the dinner and while out near the docks I checked with the office of the ferry. They said they leave promptly at 8:00 or earlier if everyone is there. People not there at 7:45 may not have a place at all if they are booked up. Wife and I discussed this and decided not to take chances and drive in, park in the garage for $13.00 just to be sure. When we came downstairs the next morning at 7:00, there was one sleepy looking clerk on duty, no bellmen, no concierge, no one to talk to. We left at 7:10, parked, walked to the docks, checked in, boat left at 7:55. Room- this was the first rom I have ever paid more than $49 for, that did not have 2 night tables and lamps on both sides of the bed, which is nice if you both want to read. One has light and the other needs a booklight. Come on. I was told we had a balcony. Right. A balconey 18"deep which was used by former guests as a smoking lounge for their non smoking room. Butts were still there and probably will be there forever. Maid service stops at the curtains. No room for chairs (non available anyway), just a 12" round table. Found out that the reason our room wasn't big enough for 2 night tables was because of this miserable excuse for a balconey. The room next door with no balconey had 2 night tables ( I looked). The 18" outside wall indentation for the balconey negated that for us. Pool in the middle of summer was about 90 degrees. Refreshing when the air is 92 with 80% humidity. Shuttel drivers were nice and informative, bed was comfortable and air was good (but NOISY) except that it alternately froze you or your feet when on, or it was deafing with it's silence when off. Plus, as is becoming more common, the hotel charged $10.00/day for parking and added insult to injury by taxing the parking fee an additional 7.5%. I am going to start looking very hard at tese little extra charges. I can understand airlines charging for bags when they are competeing on fares, but parking costs hotels nothing. It is gravy and there is no excuse. Especially when you are already paying 250 per night to stay there as I did on Marco Island. Oh, Room Service, The room across from ours had room service our first night there. Tray was there when we left in the morning for our ferry trip and was still there when we got back that afternoon. Marco Island Hilton Resort where we stayed our first night was a delight. This place sucked.

Reviews.Title: “contentment”
Reviews.Author: yogirl
