Reviews.Content: I am here right now, I am loving it. My 5 year old loves the pool, this place is not crowded at all. The room service is great, the drinks are great the food was ummm good. The room service food is a little high priced, but if my hubby will let me, I will order it again. Very clean. Room size is average. Decor up to date and nice. Im not use to not having a beach I can just walk right out to, but Smathers Beach is a short drive, and from the looks of Key West not to many hotels have beach front.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: upnorth01Minnesota
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a nice break from the craziness of Duval Street. It is family orientated and we enjoyed our stay. If you rent a car, It is only a short 20 min drive to Duval and Southern Most Point, ; but the hotel offers a shuttle service a regular basis. The staff provided us with excellent customer service, I felt completely safe staying there with my daughter and the pool was awesome! If I were to travel to Key West - Doubletree is where I would stay. The room was comfortable, but we did not use room service. The restaurant provided a buffet breakfast and at a resonable price. Thanks again to the staff - you made our stay a wonderful experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “The shuttle is one of the best things here”
Reviews.Author: Betsy-Belle
Reviews.Content: We had no issues at all with this hotel. The rooms are what you would expect.... very comfy and super clean. The pool and hot tub were great. There's a nice workout room, It's really close to the airport, which means it's not really close to Old Town, but that is actually ok (here's were the title of this review comes in). The hotel runs shuttles to Old town every hour. They drop off at the Conch Republic Seafood Company and then drive down and make a second stop at the Butterfly Conservatory. This may not seem like a big plus, but parking in Old Town is a bit tricky and the shuttle makes it easy to go down there as many times as you want with the headache. They also makes stops at Smathers beach during the day. The staff was great and and really went out of their way to help us in anyway we needed. They made a special 7am shuttle run for us (as well as another couple) so we could get to the Yankee Freedom for our trip to Ft Jefferson. They also let us have a late check out and stored our bags the day we left since our flight wasn't until 5pm. We had a great time in Key West and I think that the Doubletree played a big part : )

Reviews.Title: “not special hotel, and eat up your time for bus to go to "keywest"”
Reviews.Author: Jen035
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why people gives this hotel 4 or 5. This hotel do not have even great pool. This hotel is OK hotel, but not so good one. It is "little better than motel" class. Restaurant is bad... Food is bad, service is bad, price is bad. I did not have this much bad restaurant experience in my life time. Location is bad.... You will feel like LOOSER waiting for bus all the time. Room is not special... Our room was ok (balcony), but our friends room was so small!!! Room is clean, so do motel 6, right?? "house keeking" people might do good job cleaning, but they act like they are the main people in the hotel. They are everywhere, they talking eachother all the time... You can not relax in the hotel. This can not happen in better hotels. Bus... Not only we look stupid waiting outside of bar of keywest, those bus takes LONGER WAY to hotel! For view? I don't think so. No beach... On site. And pool is not that good. It's your vacation. You want to go to Key west, right? I think people who can give 5 to this hotel usually go stay motels, not hotels. Go stay key west, not so so hotel in next town of no where. You can find better hotels. Save your time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, glitch in room service”
Reviews.Author: Signet01
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here and this is the definition of customer service. The only exception was the only time I ordered room service (breakfast), it was late from the prescheduled time, not what had been ordered, and not particularly tasty. Other than that, from the check in folk to the concierge to the cleaning to the shuttles which were always on time to the minute, it was a wonderful experience. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pault06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only but found it to be clean and friendly,it is close to the small airport but not to much noise from the planes .The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to go downtown which goes every hour and was good fun,the breakfast had a good choice and the room was clean with a nice bed overall nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton experience in 6 years. Misleading & Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: SWFLBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: This property was advertized to be pet-friendly. After several conversations with management before arrival with our dogs, the hotel staff was rude and unfriendly toward us from our initial check-in, especially the unprofessional manager, Kevin. We checked out after a day and a half when our stay was to last six days. The rooms have not been updated in years- small and dark. The location is horrible, no views anywere, and thier inconvenient downtown shuttle leaves only once an hour. If you want a relaxing, modern, Key West experience with nightlife, great food and beverages, then don't book your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: alegnita
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation using the number that appears on their official website, we were absolutely misled on the type of room we were booking, the representative assured us it was a suite with two full beds and a separate parlor room with a sofa sleeper. When we got there we found out that the room booked was not as promised, it was just two beds and a sofa in the same room. It was very disappointing but Kevin the guest service Manager did everything he possibly could to make our stay a lot more comfortable. We learned that the booking number is a private company in charge of booking for all the Hilton hotels, if you want to make sure that you are getting what they said you better check with the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: trixietg
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel with an attractive lobby and pool area. The lobby has an aquarium. Room decor was nice. We paid for a room with a full breakfast. There was some confusion about the breakfast. Somehow they have some people just having continental breakfast, and some having hot items as well, but everyone serves themselves, so I don't know how they keep it straight and it just puts the waitresses in a bad position to watch over all this I would think. Anyway, once it was clear which breakfast we were having, it was great. You can sit outside to eat. The shuttle leaves for Duval at the top of the hour. It is quite reliable and they seem to make every effort to have enough shuttles for the number of riders. Wish it would have been twice an hour. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room - but hotels are pricey”
Reviews.Author: Spunk99
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West for the first time. We chose Doubletree just for the price (189 $), mostly because all others were even more expensive. But we think we did OK. It was a lovely room, nice beds and 5 pillows. Pool-view. Watch out in the reception, one person is no Angel !! All other staff very friendly and helpful. Bus service downtown - perfect - very informative (run every hour from 8 AM to 11 PM)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - fun for kids”
Reviews.Author: Parkgirl3425
Reviews.Content: I really was so pleased with this hotel. The lobby was nice and clean and open with a large aquarium in the center. The pool area was large and there were lots of chairs and towels. The rooms were nice and clean and fresh. Good beds and pillows. I was most impressed though with the service! The best I've experienced at a hotel I think. I know that's a big claim.........I usually stay at the Hilton, but I thought the service at this particular hotel was better. From the pool attendant to room service, to front desk to the shuttle driver.......it was all good! The shuttle was amazing. The hotel is about a 10 or 15 minute drive to the heart of Duval st, but we never got in our car again after check in! We took the shuttle into town and caught it again to go home. I didn't mind being away from Duvall because the shuttle was so convenient and we could go "home' again where it was spacious and quiet. We had breakfast included and it was fantastic and ample. We had dinner there one night and it was expensive, but not a whole lot more than we would have spent downtown really. The kids loved the place! They are 5 and 7 and they loved the pool and the food. All good.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: biggs35
Reviews.Content: Lovely, Clean room, with nice big beds. Very nice pool area. Only thing to let the hotel down is the reception staff very rude. Would reccomend hotel to friends only if had different reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: FLfuninthesun
Reviews.Content: I booked the double tree and I was a little skeptical since it is on the other side of the island but I was very pleased. Plenty of parking, great pool, pleasant staff, clean rooms and very comfy beds! I have stayed in key west before at an ecomony private inns they had terrible lumpy old beds(we tried swithching rooms.) So i was very pleased at the peaceful rest. Also, The pool is one of the better ones on the island. the shuttle was extremely convenient and reliable and takes you into the action on duval. If you really want to hang out on duval 24/7 stay closer, but if u want a cool gettaway with pooltime, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: DaveJTexas
Reviews.Content: It you're looking for a quaint little place close to the action in Key West, keep looking. The Doubletree Key West is a nice "chain type" hotel out near the airport. It's a beautiful place, though, and they have a very reliable shuttle service that stops at two places downtown (basically both ends of Duval Street). They'll also drop you elsewhere along the way if you ask. A couple of the drivers were good about giving historical information along the way. We thought about renting a car for a couple of days while we were here, but there was no real benefit to that. We did end up renting bicycles and riding around one day. The island is tailor-made for that. It's not all that big, it's completely flat, and since there are bikes and scooters everywhere, you don't feel like a driver is going to run you over because they aren't paying attention. High points: Blond Giraffe key lime pie, and seeing the sunset from the observation deck of the Conch Hotel (actually, now the Westin) on Duval Street (across from Fast Buck Freddy's). The Doubletree's pool is very nice, and they had a Calypso-style musician in the afternoons that we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - despite the weather”
Reviews.Author: hijano1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel just before midnight after travelling approx 24hrs. Check in was fast and friendly and the cookies were warm (Yum!!) The room was comfortable, probably in need of a little freshening up. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had a great nights sleep every night of our stay. All of the staff were extremely friendly - most especially Hanna in the Restaurant and the young lady who looks after the pool guests during the day. We often took the hotel shuttle bus into old town and never had a problem as Hotel always had a back up bus right behind if there were too many people for the first bus. Special mention for John the driver who is a fountain of knowledge about Key West and also Jose full of info and a wry sense of humour. We had a problem with one of the tumble dryers during our stay - somebody had obviously tumbled something with ink in it and it stained some of our clothes. Front desk had this sorted within 5 minutes of notification and our clothes were sent out to a laundry and came back perfectly cleaned within 24hrs and free of charge. This level of service was apparent throughout our stay. There was some renovation work in progress during our stay but it did not affect our stay at all. Just one thing I would suggest during colder evenings perhaps the indoor bar could be opened instead of or as well as the tiki bar by the pool. Some evenings when we came back from old town it was too cold to sit outside and the indoor bar was only open at weekends. I appreciate that Hotel has a lot of corporate gatherings in this bar, but they could increase profits if they stayed open for guests as well. In fact bar staff would be the weakest link in the otherwise excellent service offered at this Hotel. All in all a great place to stay. Relaxing with great service.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: korn107
Reviews.Content: hotel is ok. nothing fancy. seems a bit pricy. i paid 239 per night plus all the taxes etc. but key west is expensive. I can say the staff is great. Joe the bus driver is very nice. hotel is on the other side of town so we took the hotel bus. It was packed most of the time but they got another bus going. if you enjoy duval st late at night. pick another hotel

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: steelerfan01Pa
Reviews.Content: had a great time, the staff was A+, friendly and helpful with anything we needed. breakfast buffet was good and had all the usual breakfast fare. but i did feel that it was a little over priced. they are doing some renovating but it in no way affected our trip. our room was clean and the bed was comfortable slept great every night. we would stay here again in a heartbeat, wouldn't even look for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting, Tired Property, Renovation Scheduled”
Reviews.Author: photoguy66degrees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this DoubleTree as I am Hilton Honors Diamond and based on their reviews with the Hilton website. The facility itself is tired and the rates are high. However, It is about to undergo renovation which should correct the physical issues of tired carpeting and appearance. The pluses outweight its aged issue. The pool area is well above average although we didn't venture out as there was an unusual cold wave that took the temps into the mid-40s! The property setting is superb! Walking trails along the water are within two blocks. Spectacular sunrise. The staff at Reception were wonderful with assistance with check-in, luggage and suggestions. Restaurant staff were excellent with service. Food was good. Their wine selection was excellent. We used their concierge service to get us some boxes to ship stuff home. Fast and they delivered them to the room! There was an unplanned power failure for an hour on our second day (which provided a good reason for some quality time while waiting for it to be restored). The location is above average and easy to find when driving into Key West (on Highway US1, of course). Driving around in Key West has its challenges because of its age and historic charm!

Reviews.Title: “Crowded Keys Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaParislover
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was beautiful and secluded. Room was above average. $15,00 Breakfast was a big disappointment, cold meats and old patries. Had a problem with the air-conditioner and the management policy of problem-solving with 45 minutes was never resolved, so we checked out after 2 1/2 hours. For $400. per night, they should have done better. Not up to the ususal DoubleTree Standard.

Reviews.Title: “Peacefull and Relaxing (Jim, Manchester, England)”
Reviews.Author: BUSTERSTAR
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 3 days after christmas and we had a wonderfull time.The Hotel staff cant help you enough and the accomadation is 1st class.The pool and jacuzzi were superb in which my kids would play in for hours. The breakfast is the only bad point (same menu everyday !).Would recommend this resort to anyone.Thanks for a great time Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was back in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel with an exceptional staff. From the desk managers, there are at least two that I met, to Billy at the pool bar who we got to know from our frequent visits, to Mike at the pool to Trevor at the front desk. We were at the Keys from 12/25/2008 - 1/1/2009 and the weather was perfect which made our vacation at the Doubletree extra nice. The only negative is the $10/day for parking. We had a car as we had flown into Miami, spent a few days there and drove to Key West. If there is a valet service, don't mind paying for that, but when I have to park and walk in just a lot, this is an annoyance. With that aside there is nothing that I can say about this Doubletree except marvelous, wonderful, and with an attentive staff. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time! First of all, this is a Doubletree and includes all you would expect from this line of hotels, including the fresh, hot, cookie when you check in. This hotel is located on the quiet side of Key West. This island, either the best or second-best known of the Florida Keys, depending on who you ask, has a quiet side (the east) and a loud side (the west), which features Duvall Street and all of the bars, culture, restaurants, and parties that it is known for. Having stayed on both sides, both have their place. This hotel is on the quiet side and it is pretty quiet. It is a big resort with ample facilities. Our room (401) was spacious, clean, comfortable, and offered a view of the water, which was wonderful. It has a very nice and relaxing pool and poolside bar and restaurant which is very convenient and relaxing (you can also get a massage right by the pool in some private tents). To get to most of the Key West attractions, you need to go to the other side of the island. Walking is not ideal as it is a few miles to the festivities. The Doubletree has a shuttle service that leaves every hour for both downtown (two stops, one at the north end of Old Town and one at the south end) and the beach (Smathers Beach, which is the biggest public beach on Key West and home to the normal aquatic adventures of snorkeling, parasailing, etc, - however be advised that Key West is not a beach island; this is a fairly small and fairly crowded beach!). The shuttle is very reliable and the drivers are very friendly and knowledgeable. The only downside is that the Old Town shuttle service has its last pickup to the hotel at 11.20pm so you cannot have too much really late nights. We were there on New Years Eve and they extended this two extra hours so we were able to relax and enjoy the craziness downtown without worrying about getting back. The shuttle service is very good and well organized and run. Kudos! There is really nothing bad about this hotel. It gives you the advantage of staying away from all the craziness of Duvall & Company, which providing a very convenient and comfortable way to get to and from it. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Get a Way”
Reviews.Author: salesjob
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the globe and I usually do not stay ay Hiltons because well I like independebts but the Grand Key Resort is the exception. Charming, and Quaint, with a great staff and a shuttle bus that takes you right to the beach, and back without any wait time well I will never go anyplace else . I am a deep sea light tackel fisherman and i go to the keys often to fish with the Odyssea and Captain Rush so I now have the perfect packagefor my Key West Get A Way

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: foodnyc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key from December 20 to the 27th. We choose the hotel because we are Hilton Honors members. I have stayed at many Doubletree hotels throughout the country and I was very pleasantly surprised how this one operated. First and foremost, the staff could not have been nicer. They went out of their way to make you feel like you are on vacation. I was a little worried about the whole "shuttle thing" but it was always there on time. The hotel was also available to bring you back and forth to the airport which we took advantage of. Since I was there during Xmas week, Key West was very busy so a car would have been a pain. We were always able to get extra towels when needed and they also were great about letting us take pool towels out of the hotel on our excursions. When we returned we simply gave them back at the front desk. We booked a junior suite, since I was traveling with 2 kids. It was in good condition and had a wonderful terrace overlooking the pool. This hotel is located in what is considered "New Town", because of that, the rates are reasonable and with the shuttle running so well, I feel it was very good value..

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Doubletree!!!”
Reviews.Author: hhvdragon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for five nights. I honestly have no idea what the reviews with complaints are talking about. I did not find my room, or the property in general to be dates. The pool area was lovely and the pool appeared very clean. The exercise area was larger than expected as was my room. The bed was extremely comfortable and housekeeping did a terrific job. I experienced no problems with bugs- in the room or otherwise. The evenings were quiet. The staff was consistently helpful and professional. The food in the retaurant was a bit hit or miss. The conch chowder was wonderful and the shrimp cocktail was excellent. I wasn't as excited about the cobb salad, the hamburger or the breakfasts. That being said, I was in Key West for business and didn't have time to go downtown to eat every night. For people in KW for vacation, I would recommend eating at some of the old town hot spots and probably skip dinner in the hotel restaurant just to make sure you experience as much authentic Key West flavor as possible. The complimentary shuttle service ran on time and the driver was very friendly. There was plenty of room on the shuttle for each trip that I took. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with this property and would stay again and/ or recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: Shannon W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this relaxing resort. The service is great and the staff is welcoming and accommodating to our needs. The rooms are nicely decorated. The pool at the resort is great and lounge chairs and a full bar makes the area a great place to relax and get a tan. Would definitely recommend for vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “a little dated but fine for a couple of days. exellent shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: svw1000
Reviews.Content: the double tree grand looks impressive when you pull up but when you get inside there is a lot of dated decoration. the staff are very helpful and you get welcomed with a warm cookie for some reason - not sure it's important but it's an individual touch. our room was a nice size with 2 double beds in and an armchair. plenty of space to spread out. our bathroom did have peeling wallpaper but it was a sweet hotel so i felt i could forgive them that. the pool area looked good but we didn't use it as we were only there for 2 nights and wanted to spend our time in the main part of key west. we used the shuttle service provided by the hotel for free to the town. it was a very good way to get down there and the drivers were humourous and good natured and very informative. it was a prompt serivce getting there and picking it up again to go back to the hotel. the room at night was a little hot and there didn't seem to be anyway to turn the aircon down - maybe ours was broken but we weren't too worried. we had a fantastic time in key west and the hotel was a convenient base for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Cookie Monster...YUM...”
Reviews.Author: Diverkitty
Reviews.Content: We'd booked through travelagent in London saying we wanted someplace in Florida with a mysterious golden orb known as the Sun and we fancied staying in the Keys for a week. They recommended this hotel on Key West and confirmed we could have 3 separate beds in room for no extra charge. After the first hiccup (below) they were right. We had a 9 hour drive from Orlanda via Tampa to the keys and arrived late at night. We'd booked a room with 3 beds through our travel agents but apparently this had not commuted itself into the hotel's booking system and we found ourselves in a 2 queen bed room overlooking the carpark. We asked the receptionist (who came up with our bags) where the 3rd bed was and was told that due to Fire regulations we weren't allowed a pull-out and that no hotel in KeyWest did 3 beds in a room. We could either pay for another room at $140 a night or pay to upgrade to a suite, or two of us share a bed. Now we're friends but not that friendly! We politely but firmly asked to speak to manager who without quibble said he'd sort it and we should go to the bar (sadly no complimentary drinks). When we went to our room later, a substantial put-up bed had been left standing on one end (and no we weren't charged for the put-up - they wouldn't have dared by that time I think). We had to move and lower bed into position ourselves then phone up again to ask housekeeping for extra pillows, overblanket and towels. Not exactly the kind of welcome we were expecting (although cookies were exceptional). The following day chased the tired blues away - perfect pool, perfect pool service (boy did we make friends with the pool waitress fast!) and seranaded by one man steel band this was exactly what we'd come for. The poolside massage was well worth the $120 and we were so impressed - we never moved from the pool for 2 days. The minibus was great and suited us perfectly - although we went partying - because we work so hard normally - we were actually happy to take the 11.25 shuttle back to hotel at night as we were so tired from fresh air by then. It is under KeyWest airport flight path but the flights weren't intrusive to be annoying during the day (either that or we're just too used to London aircraft noise) and didn't happen at night. Yes hotel food is expensive (although lunch itself was reasonable) and nothing to shout at but there are some lovely restaurants especially around Mallory square which are reasonably priced and great grub. Recommend to do: Champagne sunset cruise on clipper ship, day's snorkelling/kayacking via catamaran, Mallory Square for cabaret when sun sets, drag shows - biggest laugh we had. Tip you wouldn't think of: If going to Ernest Hemingway's house - literally cover your legs in jungle fever or anti-bite cream - I've never been more bitten by cat fleas than when I toured round the house (and as I have 3 cats myself - that's saying something!). Not so hot: Hard Rock Cafe - what atmosphere? Bit lack lustre and so chainstore. Car park charges for the hotel Â£10 a day and we weren't warned about this by travel agent. In fact, we only used our hired car once to go to Everglades - rest of time didn't need it but I thought it was a bit of a cheek to charge for carpark considering it's not in town and the rooms cost enough. What would I do next time? I would stay at this hotel again but next time leave the car and fly from miami airport to key west airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ufalum90
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel! Great service! friendly staff! 5 Stars from check-in to check-out! This is a very cool hotel that offers a great Key west feel and a very freindly staff. I feel the that service is above and beyond

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lovestraveling23
Reviews.Content: Perfect week at the Doubletree! Our poolside view was the way to go! Room decor had a beach feel, staff was awesome and so was the food. The pool is big with plenty of lounge chairs with outdoor bar with music. Don't forget to check out the hot tub. We chose to stay here because of the beautiful grounds and easy access to town. The shuttle service is easy to get to and from and you do not have to pay for a cab! If you rent scooters they deliver to the hotel and will pick them up when you are done. The hotel rooms are plenty big, clean and relaxing. Beautiful lobby with a large fish tank full of tropical fish and lobster (very cool)!The breakfast buffet has a wide range of choices to accomadate everyone!!! Dinner menu has a large selection that is very yummy! We will go back to this hotel every time we are in Key West!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere - there are much better resorts on Key West”
Reviews.Author: DebbieK2003
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible stay and management and staff were obtuse. We had a two-room suite, rooms 246 and 248 for four nights. First, the bathtub, desk and sink area are infested with bugs. You will see small bugs whizzing around. We reported it multiple times and the bugs were there. The king-bed has bed bugs. My legs are covered with bites. The pull out couch in the suite room was broken - could not be fixed apparently because parts are needed and would be ordered. No other pull out was available according to Kevin HIll, manager. We had to sleep three in a king bed since there was no pullout. We received no discount on our room though we paid for a two-room suite to have the extra sleeping room. What a huge disappointment. We are big travelers and would hope the the Doubletree brand would take care of this and make us whole. We did not receive what we paid for and that is not right. The adjoining suite was not usable because of the broken sofa sleeper. Further, we were very uncomfortable as a result because we had to cram into a king bed, we had to kill bugs, etc. I am sure if you inspected the room today you would find all of the foregoing still present in that room. The staff was not friendly. They forgot to send out our clothes we needed pressed for a wedding though we turned them in on time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aragornsgirl
Reviews.Content: We were originally put in a jr. suite just above the pool bar which was very noisy at night. We requested a room change, but as it turned out, the room they put us in, although quiet, needed some remodeling. They had the inside lounge closed for a private party on Saturday night which was not being used after 9:00PM. It was very chilly on Saturday night so it would have been nice to have had the choice of going inside. I filled out a comment card which was put in the lobby box, but it is almost two weeks later and I have had no response from the general manager who supposedly reads the comment cards. As a Hilton Honors Club member with Silver status, I expect more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Baskaat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, nothing wrong with it, but nothing great either. It's quite far from downtown and although there is a free shuttle, it's not all that convenient. One of the bus drivers was literally one of the most annoying people I have ever encountered. There are so many other, closer, more charming places to stay in Key West, I cannot imagine visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: JBENZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days for the first half of Fantasy Fest. Pro: Very nice facility, everything was clean and well maintained. Beautiful pool and nice pool bar (Hi Bill!). Everyone we dealt with was friendly, efficient and helpful. Bumped to mini-suite at check-in for no additional fee. Room was very clean and beds were comfortable. Microwave provided on request. Free shuttles to downtown, beach and airport. Breakfast buffet pricey (typical of Key West) but very good and still cheaper than the downtown restaurants. Ate twice at the pool bar, very good food and service. Two public computers available. Six (SIX! a new record!) electrical outlets at the desk. Con: Parking fee ($10.75 per day). Last shuttle run from downtown is 11:20 PM (about the time Duval Street gets rolling). Annoying piped in music in public areas (24 hours a day!) Poor wireless internet service (very weak signal but there is an Ethernet plug on the phone jack for a wired connection if you know how to configure it.) We have previously stayed at the Radisson and Comfort Inn. This hotel is much nicer, has better facilities and a better location for very little more money. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Grand Key”
Reviews.Author: ditto9
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I decided to do a weekend getaway to the Keys. We chose the Doubletree because of its location and accommodations. We made the right choice. The hotel was very nice, clean and the staff was very friendly. They have fresh baked cookies at the front desk at all times. We kept going back to ask for more! Our room had 2 queen bed with a balcony. It turned out to be 2 queen beds with a deck! We were on the pool deck and our â€œbalconyâ€� was right by the pool which was fantastic because we just opened the door and there we were! The pool area was very nice. The hotel offers a shuttle to Duval Street which was also great and we did take advantage of. The only problem is that its last pick up is at 11:25pm. If you are planning on staying out late in Duval St. youâ€™ll need to take your car, which is what we had to do one night. Overall it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for a Last Minute Reservation”
Reviews.Author: pt_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel -- a great family place. The hotel is away from the business of the Key West area. It is about a 10 minute drive to the city. Rooms are comfortable and clean. As a tea drinker, it was great to have some choices of tea flavors. Hotel has parking fees, but you can make up these fees by taking the free van into town. The drawback however is that they run on the hour and the last pick up was at midnight. Hence, if you are looking for a hotel that allows you to to go out drinking and get home with out driving or a taxi. -- this IS NOT the place to be. The consierge services were good, but often took a while to have some help. Front desk staff were helpful. I'd recommend. When we booked, the cheapest place was Hotels.com. We booked through Hilton hotels website b/c they offered a price match plus a $50 gift card. We thought we found some extra spending cash for the trip. Unforunately, it has been nothing but a hassel. 3 months later, I am still calling Hilton about getting my gift card. I would recommend you avoid trying to claim their best rate gaurantee. It seems they try to stretch it out so that you give up trying to get the gift card you were promised. It isn't worth the aggrevation. Just book the cheaper site and forget about their reimbursement program. This was the cheapest hotel available for a last minute holiday reservation, well other than a few shady hotels. I'd stay here again, but would rather go to a bed and breakfast next time I get to the island.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice - we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed here in July 2008 for four nights. We chose this Hotel because it was one of the cheaper choices and it had pretty good feedback. And it also looked nice on pics. All in all we were very happy. Let's start with the room. It had a good size...not that big though. But ok... The bed was alright, not too great. But the room and the whole Hotel was very clean. There was a quite big and very cold fridge in the room and a comfy TV-Chair. The TV itself was small and very oldschool. But you're not coming to Key West to watch TV anyway... The bathroom was quite small, funny painted but clean. The room had very big windows, so a very bright room (We stayed on the fourth floor). The pool area looked nice. It was pretty much empty all the time. Maybe because they don't have any umrellas! There were a few Cabanas you can stay in, if you need some shade. The pool was nice, but on the first day the water was filled very low, not too great that day. We didn't really stay in the Pool Area anyway. Firstly because we didn't come for that anyway and secondly the pool Area didn't make us feel like laying around. If you wanna enjoy the Beach, Smathers Beach is very close. But the time we went it was very smelly there....and quite brown water. The beach itself was clean with nice white sand. Just for getting some sun it was nice....but not to go swim in the Ocean. The staff in the Hotel was very friendly. Check-In was fast. They have also nice people working at the Pool area and friendly drivers (from the Shuttle). If you come by car like us, you can park your car very close to the Entrance, good if you have lots of luggage. If you're lucky, you might not get charged the usual 10$ parking fee (a day). The hotel provides a free shuttle to Smathers Beach and to Downtown. The last one to go back to the Hotel leaves at 11.20pm. So be there on time, if not you'll have to take a cab. This service was a very big plus!! Altogether we were very happy with our choice. Just the Pool area wasn't really great, and swimming in the Ocean not really an option too. But we enjoyed Key West very much. If we come back here, we would probably stay here again. Wanna know more about my trips? route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: markrrexp
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a TOTAL renovation.. Small rooms.. OK lobby.. Actually pretty good food.. But other then that.... NO THANKS! Don't waste your money on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: 80sgurl
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a shuttle that runs every hour on the hour to two stops on Key West. It was wonderful not to have to worry about driving and parking. The rooms could use some updating and were a bit smaller that I am use to, but I would not let that deter me from staying there again. Overall it was a lovely experience and I would recommend my friends and family stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: hannahlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on my Honeymoon. The hotel property was above average. I loved the pool and bar area. One issue we had was that the hotel was a few miles from downtown/ Duval Street, so we had to take hotel transportation- the shuttle. The shuttle did not run late into the evening, so we weren't able to stay out late and enjoy the night scene much. (Could've taken a taxi- but the one taxi we did take ripped us off a bit!) Our room was nice/average. Unfortunately there was construction going on right outside our window during the day. We did not ask to be moved because it wasn't a big deal, and I'm not one to fuss about such things. Overall we liked this hotel. We really enjoyed Key West. The next time we go, we'll stay right in the downtown area, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Artsy3003
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from 3 nights at the Doubletree, Key West and we loved it. It was clean, new, and everything you could want in a hotel. ALL staff from bartenders to the shuttle drivers were helpful and friendly. The shuttle to Duval St. comes every hour to drop you off and pick you up. This was a great extra the hotel provided. We selected the King size room with balcony and the room was a bit smaller then we would have liked. Otherwise it was a great stay and I recommend it to anyone vacationing in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but......”
Reviews.Author: Megg04
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West with our two daughters, college age. We booked in January using our Hilton Honors points. When we checked in we were given a tiny room with 2 queen (?) size beds. We could not move around without bumping into each other. We are not complainers but my husband did go to the front desk to ask about our room. He was assured by the woman at the front desk we had been given an upgrade and that they were booked for the upcoming weekend. She then gave us a few passes for free drinks at the pool bar. It did get busier, but there were very many rooms with balconies, that never had a curtin open or anyone on them. I guess the fact that we had booked a room months in advance did not matter! The hotel is nice and we did enjoy the pool. I can say that the hotel employees were also very nice. One of the gentleman at the pool kept bringing us water and was very kind! The breakfast was OK. I do want to return to Key West, we had a wonderful time. I don't know if I would return to the Doubletree, the rooms are so tiny. I would not waste our Hilton Honors points to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: BadHampton
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 Days here in early July-08. Am a Hilton Diamond Member. Did not get upgraded. Hotel was jammed to the max...many weddings. Outside and Lobby looks ok and is well kept. Customer Service is good and people helpful. Room quality was very poor. Very tired and beat up overall. Smoke smell at night thru the AC. Prices are cheap for the area..so I guess that is the way it is. Breakfast food was marginal. Pool area nice and constantly crowded. Would not stay here again...chose the place only because it is the only "Hilton Family" property in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: AmyBryant
Reviews.Content: What a great place to be while in Key West! We arrived very early but they quickly checked us in and let us get to our room. There were others that did not have their rooms ready but they have a nice courtesy area where you can change and they will store your luggage. The pool area is amazing! The only thing that would have been better was a swim up bar. :) You don't ever have to worry about carrying anything other than your room key while you are there. Everything is charged to your room. It is a little bit more expensive than you would get elsewhere but definietely worth the mark up in my opinion. Our room was wonderful and our bell boy was so knowledgable about the resort and Key West! We didn't eat a lot at the resort but when we did it was good! They have a shuttle service down to Duval street which was great but get there early because it fills up quick. Some nights it was worth the extra money to take a Maxi Taxi. Key West is one of my favorite vacation destinations! There is something for everyone there!

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort away from the husle and bussel!”
Reviews.Author: Nifferchic
Reviews.Content: We were going to spend one night here, but once we got comfortable we decided to stay an extra night! The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and warm! The shuttles were a little cramped and hot, so we decided to take our own car into town the second day. If I were to go back to Key West...I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!”
Reviews.Author: KGJB
Reviews.Content: Had a really great 4 nights in this hotel. Got a large room with 2 king beds, great air-con and nice bathroom with everything we needed. No balcony, but didn't spend long in the rooms. Plenty of chairs by the pool, and the pool itself was fine. Maybe a little warm but the weather was boiling hot everyday! Good shuttle bus, friendly staff, clean rooms. Breakfast was nice, but only had it once as hotel breakfast's are always a little pricey. Yes, it's a lttle far away from Duval st, (10 mins by car) but we had our own car so it didn't affect us. We took the free bus some nights and that was reliable and friendly. Would stay here again, but I did look round the Casa Marina hotel which was beautiful, although more expensive. Didn't get charged the $10 a day for car parking which was a bonus. maybe they like the British?! Would definately recommend this hotel for a relaxing holiday. Key West is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “a reasonable alternative”
Reviews.Author: gwgMimsFlorida
Reviews.Content: We were not going to stay here as it was too far out of the Key West downtown area but then we saw prices of hotels downtown, heard about parking problems in Key West, and everybody we spoke with warned about the homosexuals in downtown SO we chose this Hilton affiliated hotel which runs a shuttle bus every hr, and boy did we use it. It is best feature of hotel. Breakfast buffet service was very poor, sullen, slow and inefficient. big and warm but jacuzzi not really hot just warm like pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: CyberTag
Reviews.Content: After reading the on-line reviews, we were nervous about our stay at the Doubletree Grandy Key Resort. We are Hilton gold members and do not see anything wrong with this hotel. The hotel does not have a beach, but really there aren't many sandy beaches in Key West. There is a beach that guests have access to if staying at the Doulbetree, but when we were there in June the beach had seaweed all over it and smelled horrible. We did take the shuttle to Duval Street and did not have any problems with it. The shuttle driver recommended some nice restaurants as well. The room was nice, and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a refrigerator which was nice. The workout facility was also very nice and the kids enjoyed the pool area. We did not eat at the hotel as it was very expensive, but all of Key West is expensive! I would recommend staying here. Oh, and if you want extra cookies during your stay, just ask the front desk as they had no problem giving them out. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ToTheSea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with this hotel. The service was outstanding, the rooms were very well kept, and the pool was beautiful! I was very concerned about choosing the right place to stay since I was going to be there all week, and I definitely would stay here again. The hotel shuttle made our stay extremely convenient, and there was a deli right behind the hotel if you didn't wish to eat at the hotel. Anything you asked for, the hotel would provide.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilandgyrl
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just got back from a girls getaway in beautiful Key West!! We were there from 6-5 to 6-8, and stayed at the DGK. It was wonderful! We booked thru Expedia and everything went smooth--from flights to hotel. Our plane arrived around 2:30 p.m., and we called the hotel on the courtesy phone at the airport so they would send the shuttle that was offered. It got there in about 10 minutes. Check-in was smooth; staff was pleasant and friendly--no problems. Our room was clean and nicely decorated; although a little small--it was more than enough for the two of us. We had a balcony overlooking the beautiful pool area and island music played all day (and night)!!! They have a shuttle that runs on the hour that goes to Duval Street and to the beach. The drivers were always on time and very pleasant; often suggesting things to do while in KW. We did go to the pool to relax (from the happenings of Duval Street). There were always plenty of chairs; and food and drinks could be ordered by the pool. The tiki bar was nice and "Billie" was great! The food at the hotel was okay, but a little on the expensive side. The service was excellent though and the staff (again) were so friendly--especially Lisa and Ginny. We asked around for local spots and tried Badass Coffee for breakfast--it was good and they give complimentary fruit; B.O.'s Fishwagon--the conch fritters were good, but the hamburger was the best! Everyone that we came in contact in Key West was so friendly and warm. We are already planning our getaway there next year. I highly recommend the Doubletree Grand Key, if you want a relaxing vacation filled with lots of friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rover16NY
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 3 days in May 2008. We were very pleased with this hotel. We are both very seasoned travelers and we both agreed that we would definitely stay here again. The resort is very clean and well maintained, there is free parking for guests of the hotel (despite the earlier reviews we read about charging $10 per day), the rooms were clean, pool was lovely and food was good. The staff was very friendly as well. The biggest plus is that they have a free shuttle service that drops you off at the beach and downtown. They run all day every hour. Its a great plus, as you don't have to worry about parking and you may drink as much as you like since there is no driving. Over all, we would recommend this resort very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: wt88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the very beginning of Key West when you drive there. Itâ€™s 15 minutes away from downtown. But the hotel is near the beach. The hotel shuttle is very convenient and we didnâ€™t drive once we checked in. We use the hotel shuttle to go to the beach and downtown. The room was standard with 2 beds. We had some very small ants crawling in the bed. They didnâ€™t look harmful but we didnâ€™t like them; someone must left some sweet in the room. We told the front desk and we asked for a different room. We changed the room without any problem and we didnâ€™t have ants in the new room. Ants are a problem in Florida so check for ants in the room. The room was a bit older but still in good condition. We had a balcony in our room. We open it at night for the sea breeze. Buffet breakfast was average, not great. The made your own waffle was good, but the eggs taste odd. Concierge was very helpful with booking a ferry trip to Dry Tortugas National Park. She checked the weather to see if itâ€™d good for the trip before booking it. She gave us towels for the trip, too. We had to be at the dock by 7:30 AM to take the ferry. The hotel front desk called for a special shuttle to take us to the dock at 7:15 AM so that we didnâ€™t have to drive and park at the dock. The shuttle to the beach was also very convenient. We were dropped off at a beach stand. The hotel has a guy there to give out towels, chairs, and umbrellas. It was excellent service. The pool was very nice with many chairs. There was even a small sandy area for beach volleyball. Love the hotel and glad we stay there instead of at the small B&B in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Would recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jmpserve
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the DoubleTree in Key West (May 21-24) Although there was a slight problem with the room when we checked in (they just sealed the tub and could not get rid of the Acetone smell), we were moved to another room after a short wait, given some drink coupons and everything worked out just fine. Pool is very nice and the shuttle bus is very efficient too. My wife got a massage and said it was very good, except she was expecting a nicer "spa". If you get your massage inside, they basically give the massage in a large closet. It was too hot outside for the massage. If they are going to call it a spa then they should put a few bucks into it and truely make it a spa experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort.....”
Reviews.Author: RandiMOH
Reviews.Content: We had just come off of a 7-day Caribbean cruise and could not get a room at our usual B&B, so we took a chance on the Doubletree. Although we usually like to stay in Old Town, this was the only resort available with rates that were reasonable (at least for Key West!). Upon arrival, the front porch that runs the length of the lobby was a very nice welcoming, lined with rocking chairs and lush foilage. Check in was a breeze, and up we went to our room, which was a King. The room was very nice, done up in a "Key West" color scheme (yellows, blues, and white), and the bathroom was a very nice size. There was also a small couch and table for relaxing, and our room overlooked some of the new condos on the Atlantic side. The pool was located outside of the lobby, down a wide flight of stairs. It was very large, very nice, and there were plenty of lounge chairs available for the guests. There were also some cabanas at the far end of the pool for those who like a little break from the sun. At the top of the stairs is a very nice and well-stocked pool bar, and there are waiters and waitresses walking around should you need a drink while you are at the pool. The Doubletree also offers shuttle service to town, as parking there is at a premium, and if you do happen to find a lot with an empty spot, they charge you out of the ying yang to park there. One bad thing about the shuttles is that everyone is waiting around for it, and despite who was there first, people push and shove their way on board. The good thing is that they have a back-up shuttle if there are far too many people. They will drop you at Smather's Beach or at the Conch Republic (near Mallory Square), but the other down-side is that the last shuttle runs around 11:00 p.m., so if you want to stay in town longer, you will need to take a cab back. The shuttle is free, except for the driver's tip. We did not eat lunch or dinner there, but we did eat breakfast out on the veranda that overlooks the pool, and the food was quite good, with excellent service and moderate prices. All in all, the Doubletree is a very nice, modestly priced resort. We would definitely stay there again if we were not able to get a room at our favorite B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pdxgalkel
Reviews.Content: This resort is the perfect place to stay in Key West! The staff is wonderful, especially Mike the Pool Guy! Everyone is so friendly and always willing to help, that it made my stay so enjoyable. My friend and I ate in the restaurant alot and the food was very good. Our room had 2 queen beds and was adequate in size for 2 women with large suitcases! hahaha!! I have no idea why this resort is not ranked higher, because I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West. They offer a shuttle service into town and to their private beach, every hour on the hour till 11pm, which is awesome! It is away from the hustle and bustle of Duvall street, and so quiet! Plus, they even pick you up at the airport.....what more could you want? Oh yeah, the pool bar and bartender (Billy) is very very nice!! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelerPA99
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful visit to Key West and the stay at the Doubletree was excellent. The staff was friendly -- especially the man at the pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable however a bit small unless you are able to get them to move you to a room with a balcony. Also, be sure to ask for breakfast coupons at the front desk. We found the pool to be relaxing and clean. We used the shuttle service to head downtown in the evening. This is a popular service, so be sure to go to the lobby a few minutes early. The beach that the shuttle services visits is not worth your time. Enjoy the pool or other public beach instead. Overall, a nice and relaxing time. Plus, tasty cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree!!”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Key West and stayed at the Doubletree. The hotel was comfortable, the staff excellent (except for one very unfriendly server) and the atmosphere was everything I could have wanted. My friend and I ate in the dining room several times and the food was excellent, but you need to pay attention to the dinner bill, they automatically add on a gratuity. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there the next time I'm in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: IndyAna
Reviews.Content: We picked the Doubletree after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor and could not have been happier. The staff was extremely accommodating and went above and beyond. We arrived on Friday at 1:00pm and even though check in wasn't until 3:00pm we were able to check in early. This meant extra pool time. There was a man playing the steel drums and wait staff to bring us food and drinks poolside. There is a shuttle service that runs from the hotel downtown every hour and to the beach at 40 minutes after every hour. I would recommend just staying at the pool, the beach was extremely dirty, but Key West has never been known for the beaches. There is a $10 parking fee per day, but it is worth it to not have to drive and pay to park everywhere you go. I would recommend this hotel for singles, couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: kwtravelerAL
Reviews.Content: We booked several months ago and stayed April24th-28th. The staff was amazing. Very quick check in, great room, great service. The shuttles were awesome. Always on time at each location. I was amazed at their efficiency. The shuttles have 3 stops, the beach, one end of duval and the other end of duval. If you study the maps at the concierge desk its really easy to navigate. The concierge will point out lots of good places to eat and shop. There were a couple of times that we needed to go places that the shuttle didnt stop. The hotel was quick to use one of the vans to take us. Service was amazing! Rooms were clean and we always had PLENTY of towels. there is a restaurant on site as well as a bar beside the pool that is great. There were several weddings while we were there. Very pretty reception areas. Staff made sure the actual reception had privacy. Perfect place to stay in Key west Tip: Be on time for the shuttle. They dont wait. But the payoff is they are always on time to pick you up!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: huskyhoops
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Double Tree Grand Key resort for 4 days earlier this month. I found my stay there to be very enjoyable. Check-in was a bit slow, but that's because the printer at the front desk had jammed. Having been the perpetrator of many legendary paper jams at work, I can understand how technology can sometime conspire against us. The room was mostly clean, but there were small details that, while not necessarily annoying, were noticeable. For example, the minifridge door didn't quite close properly. It was also placed in a strange location - against the wall near the bed. The rooms are on the small side, and if you had the TV armoire doors open, you had to crawl over teh bed to get from one side to another. Again, not a huge deal, because I spent so little time in my room. The pool area is gorgeous. I found the pool deck area to be carefully maintained by attentive staff. There were always pool towels available, and the overall setting was nice. The staff at the pool bar were very friendly and attentive. I had the breakfast buffet one morning. The selection was pretty narrow, but what was available was very good. The waffles were fantastic. The hotel is removed from the action on Duval Street. The shuttle program is fantastic, it runs hourly up until 11 pm, and when a shuttle is full, there is always another one behind it. The drivers are friendly, and yes, there is always some drunken knucklehead on the late night ride back. Not that I was one of them one night. *cough*. They say they charge $10 per night for parking, but I was not charged. When I return to Key West, I would probably stay somewhere closer to the downtown area, but I can't say I have anything bad to say about the Doubletree Grand Key.

Reviews.Title: “OK resort, decent choice if the price is right, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this resort recently on vacation. Used points, so, I don't know the rate. It had some good bits and bad bits, as follows... GOOD: --Had a King bed suite, which was spacious and a pretty nice room overall. Has a living room/dining room and kitchenette, fridge, 2 TVs, bath with jetted tub, and a small deck overlooking the pool area. --Pool area is very nice - one of the better ones I've been to. Not very big, but well kept and excellent in every other way --Front desk personnel and concierge staff were friendly and very helpful --Front desk has reasonable deals with local day trip folks for snorkelling, biking, other activities that are a lot of fun. --Wait staff at the restaurant (and around the pool) were all good. BAD: --They actually charge $10 a day for parking!!! This is not Manhattan or some other congested urban area, they have a ton of real estate - this is insultingly bad policy. --Location is not great - its on the opposite end of the island from Duval, downtown and most of the sights. There is an hourly shuttle though. --Housekeeping staff were pretty bad. Took them a long time to get the room done, they twice left cleaning supplies behind and didn't actually finish cleaning the room, and they were seen regularly just hanging out in the hallways gabbing. --The restaurant is mediocre at best, but priced high (as is everything on Key West it seems). Breakfast is a bit weak, and the upgrade from continental to full gives you just two things - powdered eggs and bacon. --The resort does not have its own beach, it shares one with other resorts - but the concierge said that because of its location, its constantly overrun with seaweed and not a great beach. If you go to the state park public beach, be aware you'll pay $30 plus a deposit just to use an umbrella and two chairs. Overall, I can't really recommend it, unless they are running a cheap deal. And looking at their website right now as a sample, it looks like its normally pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CTWanderer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. The room was clean, front desk service was good. Because of our Hilton Honors points we were upgraded to a room with a giant balcony overlooking the pool area. We loved sitting out on the balcony people watching and enjoying the music. Our room had a fridge which was stocked full of drinks. We removed them (we didn't want to pay for them, but there was no pricelist telling how much they were) and put our own food and drinks in it. The pool was terrific and the poolside service was pretty good. One day they even had live music by the pool. The fitness room was also big and up-to-date. Wireless service from our room was trouble-free. Although the hotel had a shuttle into downtown Key West, we drove our rental car instead. On the downside we had to pay $10/day to park at the hotel. The hotel is not close to downtown and a couple of miles from Smathers Beach, so it's not terribly convenient if you don't have a car. The breakfast buffet was good and ours was complimentary because of our Hilton Honors points. To upgrade to the buffet breakfast buffet it was $4 for adults and kids were free which I thought was reasonable. Service in the restaurant was hit or miss. And it took forever for our room to be cleaned. The maids did not speak English. Overall, I liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree - nice stay”
Reviews.Author: acegirl6
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Key West with 2 young children. The location with kids is great. We wanted a quieter spot / more family oriented. The pool was excellent for our kids. One side slopes down all the way so that kids can tell how far they can go. The outside bar was nice. The room was average. We did book using points... so I'm sure we weren't given their "best" room. My only complaint was the carpeting needed to be cleaned. We walked around with flip flops on all week. The continental breakfast wasn't much... some pastries, cereal and fruit. You could upgrade to their "hot" breakfast for an additional fee. It was sufficient for a quick bite to eat. The hotel did make sure that enough transportation was available with the shuttles for anyone who wanted to go into town. Often times they sent 3 to 4 vehicles to the pick up sites to get everyone back. The drivers were friendly and helpful when asked questions.

Reviews.Title: “keys are great!”
Reviews.Author: jelly__Bean00
Reviews.Content: stayed at the doubetree grand key resort March 28-April 1. the hotel is located 5 minutes from the airport, there is a free shuttle, with prompt service. the hotel also provides shuttle downtown and to the beach. the taxi downtown costs about 15-20 dollars- thus having the shuttle was a real money saver! just make sure you are at the appointed stops at the given time. the hotel is real quaint with an island feel. we had 3 people in a double room, and it was still very spacious. the hotel provides free coffee in the morning. the pool is very nice. and the restaurants were also nice and reasonable. service in the hotel wasn't always the greatest. seem to be on 'island' time, and we were given attitude a few times by some of the staff. if you can get over this, then you'll enjoy the hotel the island of key west is amazing. very small, you can rent a bike, and take a tour of the island. the shuttle buses the hotel provides offers a great way to check the island out!! great mix of food, drinks and shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: corsdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early March. Arrived early (10:30 am) but room was ready. Philip the Bell captain was VERY helpful with bags and provided thorough information about the hotel - shuttle service, amenities, etc. Room was not large, but very clean and nicely decorated. Pool area was beautiful - I would request a pool view room if possible (we did not have one). Pool was clean, plenty of loungers. Drink and food service available, as well as a tiki bar you could sit at. Did not care for the "entertainment" - a guy playing steel drum and singing "island music" with taped music - actually kind of annoying. Weather did not cooperate - cool, cloudy and windy, so only enjoyed the pool one day. Shuttle service was very helpful - we did not move our car the entire stay. Only issue is that the shuttle's last return from downtown is around 11:15 - after that it is a $20 cab ride. Being away from downtown was a mixed blessing - much quieter but had to rely on shuttle or drive - would not recommend driving into due to heavy traffic (except for Sunday morning) all thru Key West. All shuttle drivers were very friendly and could answer any questions about Key West. Did not use the restaurants - prices seemed reasonable and what we saw looked good. Would definitely stay again. Book thru website for best prices.

Reviews.Title: “so dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Tink1234
Reviews.Content: The pictures made it look so beautiful, but I have never seen such a dirty pool area. Despite the fact that it was hot (we were there in June) I did not even let my kids swim. The water was CLOUDY it was so dirty. The pool chairs were filthy and the rooms weren't much better. This was not a housekeeping issue, it was that nothing had been kept up. Staff was pleasant enough. There are so many charming little inns or guesthouses that will take children, I cannot imagine why anyone would stay here - we certainly won't ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced and problems”
Reviews.Author: clkr5320
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Double Tree Grand Key for 4 nights. I would recommend you stay somewhere else if value for your dollar is important. If you get a room overlooking the pool area, be aware of the constant and very loud music from the pool-side bar; all night long!! Also, forget about getting room service. I ordered breakfast for 7:15am and it hadn't shown up by 7:50 (when I had to leave). The staff were very indifferent and not at all helpful when I told them of this. Finally, considering what this hotel charges per night it is amazing how they nickle and dime you on everything (local phone calls, late check out charges, 10$ for parking, etc). The only positive was the shuttle that runs on the hour to downtown Key West. And the hotel security responded pretty quickly when I complained of a major party next door at 2am (spring break!). I am sure there are many other places in Key West that would give you much better value than the Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, far away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: phillydaisy
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay. But if we had it to do over again, I would stay downtown. I read the reviews saying this place was not near Duvall street, but I didn't realize it was a 20 minute drive away. We used the shuttle, which was pretty convenient, except for the presence of at least one very drunk and obnoxious person on each return shuttle trip. Our room was nice and spacious. There were tiny little ants on our bedside table that didn't bother us much but could definitely bother someone else. I got a room with a balcony because it was the only kind left, and I'm glad we had it. The pool was okay, not great. We went kayaking at Lazy Dog, which is where the hotel recommended, although there was almost always at least a little wait for the concierge so we just made the reservations ourselves. It said on the website that parking cost $10 a night, but they didn't charge us. The breakfast buffet was good - not a big selection but what was there was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stop in Key West”
Reviews.Author: K_Getchell
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Grand Key Resort was my base in Key West when I had a short visit in January. The choice of booking at the Doubletree was made as I found a great rate on their website - I figured being away from downtown was worth the saving on the room rate I made. Having never stayed in a Doubletree hotel I was not sure what to expect. When I arrived at the property I wasn't disappointed. The exterior looked to be in good condition and there was ample car parking available close to the entrance. The checkin desk was well staffed, and the personnel very helpful in providing me with my welcome cookies, room key and some complimentary water. I was given an upgraded room for my stay. This had a small balcony and a view of the pool deck. The room itself was a reasonable size, clean and had the usual selection of hotel literature and gadgets. One thing I did notice was that the decor in the room was a little tired in places - with a few scuff marks on the door and walls. The beds and furniture, however, were well presented. Owing to the late arrival time, I opted to have dinner in the hotel restaurant which was pretty much empty at the time I visited (around 10pm). I don't recall what I had to eat, but it was reasonably well presented and seemed to offer good value for the price paid. The food wasn't outstanding, but it wasn't disappointing either. The hotel shuttle service was excellent, and really made getting to the heart of Key West easy. The timing of the shuttles was also quite good, with hourly departures for much of the day. A word of warning - be careful to board the right shuttle - 1 goes downtown whilst the other goes to the beach club! I didn't realise this and ended up at the beach club on the first morning! Overall I was pleased with my choice of accommodation for my trip to Key West. The Doubletree offered a good base to explore, but those who are looking to stay out past 11pm will need to find there own way back to the hotel. When I return, the Doubletree will certainly be on my list of places to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: majoo7
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing bad to say about the double tree in Key West. The price was better than average, the rooms were all clean and the staff was great. This hotel is off the main strip, but the hotel offers a shuttle to and from the strip which is real user friendly. It does shut down around 10 or 11 and the cab ride is around $20. Also, one thing to keep in mind is when you get off your plan the double tree has a shuttle that will pick you up, I did not know this and paid for a cab. All in all I will be back. The only other place that I would consider staying is the ocean key resort, but it is much much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for two nights in mid-January. I booked using Hilton Honors Points so I'm not sure what the room rates were during that period. We had a room overlooking the pool with a small balcony. Although the room was not large, per se, it was comfortable enough for us. The beds were great with plenty of nicer quality pillows. The pool was a decent size. Drink service was a little slow and it took a while to get the server's attention (there was only one server for the entire pool area). However, once we got her attention, she checked in with us regularly and we had no problem getting drinks in a acceptably timely fashion. The shuttle to downtown ran on time and was a nice convenience. We did wish it ran a later than 11pm though. Breakfast was fine. Did not experience customer service issues like those mentioned in other reviews. I found the staff to be polite and hard working. When certain food items ran out, they were replaced soon afterward. Overall, I would definitely return--just wish the hotel was closer to Duvall!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: nyyaya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night visit...Could not have been happier! At check in, we were greeted by Alex who most certainly made us feel welcomed. He even arranged to have the mini bar emptied so that we could use the refridgerator. Great room with a pool view. Very relaxing surroundings which is exactly what we needed. Waitress service around the pool was a nice touch. Shuttle service into Key West was fast and a lot of fun. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: ojycart
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice, the rooms spacious and clean. Pool area beautiful. We took the shuttle into town every time and it was quick and easy. The property has a beach recommendation about a mile away. The service was terrible. For $400 a night, one would expect excellent service. We would sit and wait on waitresses, the pool bar, ON new years eve was unattended for a while and several people waiting on drinks. Everyone was nice, just not attentive. I would stay in this hotel again but not for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a 10min drive from the centre of key west. A shuttle bus that travels between the hotel and the centre once an hour will get you there. The hotel has nice rooms, however they are a bit small. Our room wasn't very clean (did find some unidentified hair in the bathroom). If you want to stay in the middle of the action: this is not your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not the best in Key West.....”
Reviews.Author: earlycheckin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for two nights over thanksgiving. Hotel was clean, functional and straightforward. Rooms were comfortable, nicely decorated with good coffee! The staff were mixed. The pool guy was excellent, really friendly and helpful. Some of his colleagues who served breakfast were clearly off work when the customer care course took place. You don't really want hostility with your eggs.... Good free shuttle service works well. Perfectly acceptable but you can probably do better....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rara8698
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to Key West and I have to say he did a great job of selecting a hotel. The outside of it is beautiful and it's off the street, so there's no street noise. We drove and there were plenty of parking spaces for our car. We were there for only one night, so we didn't get to enjoy a lot of the ammenities, like the pool and hot tub, but our room overlooked them and they looked nice- and big. Our room was really comfortable and clean. The only thing wrong was that there were little bugs, like fleas or something, all over the room. They really didn't bother us, we didn't get any bites or anything, but it still grossed us out a little. We went out in Key West for dinner, but opted to come back to the room to watch a movie instead! It was nice to be able to buy a movie on our tv to watch in bed. In the morning, we enjoyed our continental breakfast, with coffee, fruit, pastries and cereal. You had to pay extra for the hot breakfast, but the cold breakfast was enough for us. We checked out with no problem and over all had a peaceful and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: kerwin0959
Reviews.Content: It's all about what week you go. My husband and I were there from Sept. 23rd thru Sept. 28th, and had just missed the bike week. Thanks goodness because the place was virtually deserted. At most there were 15 people at the pool. So it's prudent to ask what events are going on; I just got lucky! The hotel is nice, not great but it was fine. We did not want to be downtown so this was fine. Remember that this island is only 2 miles by 4 miles, and the hotel runs hourly shuttles downtown and to the nearby beach. Overall our experience was great, but again, our timing was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great nearby deli”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: We didnâ€™t know that our reservations coincided with the 35th Annual Cycle Poker Run where thousands of motorcycle riders converged on Key West. The hotel was jammed and noisy. At the reservation desk we asked for a quiet roomâ€¦it was directly over the pool. The next room was directly across from the elevator. The third room was over the pool but higher up. The only other option was a room over the parking lot where the cycles were roaring in and out. We ended up with that third room. The breakfast buffet scrambled eggs were kind of runny. There is a great little deli â€œSeaside Grocery and Deliâ€� within 75 feet of the hotel. They made great sandwiches and had a small bakery. What we learnedâ€¦..next time when I will confirm reservations I will ask about any special events and avoid the Poker Run.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: MATOA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. We liked our room, it was big and very clean. The bed was very confortable. THe bathroom was nice and clean, with lots of samples from Neutrogena. The swimming pool was very nice and clean. The hotel is not in the center or key West or near the beach, but they have a nice shuttle service taking you to the beach and to the center every hour. I would certainly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great trip, very relaxing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki12345
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my trip to Key West and staying at the Double Tree. It was extremely relaxing and enjoyable. For all people who have visited Key West this hotel located closer to "old town" near Ft. Zachary park, local beaches, and away from the craziness Duvall Street entails. The hotel conviently offers on the hour shuttle service to two seperate downtown locations which is extremely convient. If you ever need to know local history or questions about "Robert the Doll" the shuttle chauffer is more than happy to answer questions and provide local history. It was awesome esp since I wanted to get away from all the crazy drunks on Duvalle and this resort def offered a relaxing atmosphere.
