Our room was very comfy and clean as well as plenty of Neurogena products stocked in the room. The pool was warm, relaxing and very inviting. The cocktail waitresses were so sweet and nice bringing drinks pool side as well as yummy appetizers. The only complaint I have is the breakfast service. ATROCIOUS! The staff serving breakfast seemed rude and could'nt be bothered coming back to refill coffee or water. He served my meal and never came back, I waited a half hour for the check to finally arrive. I got so frustrated I told the hostess to bill my room. I think the staff needs to work on being more friendly towards the guests. Bar was super cheap and it made it inexpensive to have a good time down there. I would more than likely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Double Tree Key West”
Reviews.Author: TXInKY
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at the Doubletree Grand Key West. My first disappointment was upon check in, when I discovered that there was no beach on the property, when the web site clearly described a â€œBeach Clubâ€� with the following â€œOur "Beach Club" offers complimentary lounge chairs, umbrellas and beach towels. Sailing, snorkeling, parasailing and many other beachside activities available for nominal fee.â€� This was a business trip for me, and my wife and children accompanied me on the trip. I booked this hotel strictly on the fact that the web site implied there was a beach on property. I consider this to be deceptive trade practices. Secondly, there is a shuttle from the hotel to Duval Street and my family was told they would be dropped off between Duvall and Front Street. However, the shuttle actually drops everyone off 12 blocks from there! The final disappointment came at check out. There was an invalid charge from July 12 for $11.68 on my bill. I told the front desk that the bill was fine, except for the $11.68 charge and asked them to remove it. They told me that they felt the charge was valid and gave me a manila envelope which contained all restaurants and bar receipts from July 12 and told me to find the charge in question. I found the receipt in question and it was supposed to be charged to room 364. I was in room 344. When I complained to the manager that my check out was delayed by 30 minutes to dispute an $11.68 charge, his response was that â€œIt is our policy and there is nothing I can do.â€� Double tree is the only hotel I have ever visited that does not empower its front desk personnel to handle a small discrepancy on a bill. It will now be my policy to never make the mistake again of staying a Doubletree and I will forever be reluctant to stay at a Hilton property again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cru4527
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked two suites way back in Jan. 07 (when the hotel was closed) only to find that the management offered a better 'special rate' upon re-opening. It took 10 phone calls to get the new rate! We arrived, had two good days... then returned from our wedding ceremony to find the power was out. The staff suggested we spend the night (our wedding night!) in another room with other members of our wedding party! We stayed in the dark.... until morning when we were unceremoniously sent to another hotel. The staff tried to make us feel better with some 'complimentary' breakfast tickets... only to find out that they were valid for the continental breakfast (free at most hotels) and not the buffet! Gee, Thanks! Three days after arriving home I checked the unbilled activity on my credit card and found that we had been charged for staying at the Grand Key even though THEY had moved us to another hotel two days prior to the date billed! As of this writing they haven't removed the charge.... never again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star, but definitely worth it.”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent four nights at the Doubletree Grand Key in early September. This was a Hilton Honors reward, so we did not pay for the room.. however, would definitely consider staying again on our own dime. The hotel itself is in very good condition, and we were given a standard two queen with a pool view at checkin. I did call ahead, asking for an upgrade, and letting the hotel know we were considering Key West for our wedding destination. No upgrade, and no contact by the hotel regarding wedding info.. so we will not be considering the Doubletree for that affair. Key West has very few large hotels (ie, not bed and breakfasts) and the Doubletree was everything that we were looking for. Nice room, good housekeeping, nice pool, big bar by the pool, etc. We did not use the shuttle to town or the beach, as we had a car and preferred to be on our own schedule. The beach where the Doubletree beach club is located is ok... but there is a much better beach (Fort Zachary State Park) down in Old Town which we visited two days. All in all.. we were very satisfied. I was a bit worried after reading some other reviews.. however as a very frequent traveler I knew we were not checking into the Ritz, and did not expect that kind of service. We would definitely stay at the Doubletree in Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Shanester81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Labor Day Weekend and it was an okay place to stay. We had no problems with check in at all and received a cookie that was pretty good. The room was an average room and well stocked with nutragena products. The pillows were very soft and comfortable but not the mattress it was really hard but my back was not sore the next morning so I was thankful for that. The ac worked very well which it was mid 90's outside so that was a definate plus for me. The second day there a transformer blew and a 1/4 of the hotel had no power and there was a big mass in the lobby all afternoon cause they had to be changed to a different hotel and there were alot of mad people over that. Internet was out all day too as a result but luckily it was free. We had to get them to bring a dsl cable as there was none in the room as the person before hand took it home with them. The breakfast buffet was good it had a good selection. We did not use the pool but it looked nice but a little overrun with alot of children. This hotel is not down where the action is but there is a free shuttle bus all day that drops you off in two locations in the old town which saved alot of money on cab fare but it stops at 1130 just a heads up for the party animals. The gym was small but never crowded so it was nice to workout without having to wait. It was a good hotel probably stay someplace closer to downtown but would stay again if it was a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, food was actually good!”
Reviews.Author: FITCollegeBabe
Reviews.Content: Introduction: We stayed at the Hilton Double Tree Grand Key Resort from August 2nd-5th on the 4th floor (highest floor). I am a Silver HHonors member. _____ Overview: This is my second stay at the Grand Key but my review will only focus on our most recent stay. I was very impressed with the package we selected (Honeymoon Package @ $309 a night) and the staff could not have been any more friendlier. Overall, I recommend this resort for your stay in Key West. If you want a place away from the action and actually want a good night's rest, this is the perfect hotel on the island that never sleeps. _____ Pros: As I had a choice this time around to stay at the Grand Tree or the Westin Resort, I decided to stick with the Grand Tree. Price was not a factor as we are still in our honeymoon stage, and I'm very glad we stayed with this hotel. Note that the Westin can range in price from $250-$1,100, while the Grand Tree ranged from $164-$380. - Hotel was beautiful inside and out and very clean - The wait staff was excellent and the front desk were all very attentive to our needs (water pressure too low and there was no hot water...each was taken care of promptly) - The cookies...yes the cookies are excellent! Warm and chewy...I want another one! - Bellmen (when they were there) were all very nice and courteous...offered to help with bags and opened doors. They even hold your baggage when you check out so you can go around the island for a bit before you leave - Concierge was very helpful and friendly and helped us with our package deal (we got a Sunset Champagne Cruise and 2-hour guided Kayak) and even helped us book for a Dolphin Sightseeing/Snorkel adventure (highly worth it!!! we had a blast!) - The food at their Palm Haven Restaurant was actually exceptionally good!!! Our package had a free buffet breakfast for each of us and also a 3-course dinner for two every night. Now, it is very pricey to eat there, but that's what made the hotel package worth it. The seafood was superb and the two-person cheese fondue appetizer was to die for. I had chicken marsala one night and NY strip the other. They were very tasty and excellent. The desserts were fabulously presented and tasted good. The breakfast buffet was lacking, but I was very surprised at dinner. - The free transportation to Duval Street courtesy of their shuttle was a welcoming break from the long drive (we drove about 7 hours). The island is relatively small - 4x2 miles, but walking in the hot sun can get exhausting. - The bed was very comfortable and the comforter was welcoming since my husband likes to have the thermostat down to 60 every night. The room was spacious and the bathroom was a decent size. - There is no ocean view, but we did have a lovely pool view from our balcony. A very scenic garden surrounded the pool area. - There was nightly music playing at the bar and most of the time people were dancing away _____ Cons: We really enjoyed our stay and there wasn't that many cons during our stay, but I don't understand why they call this hotel a "resort" because it is not one at all. The name can be slightly misleading, so be sure to understand that this is not a resort at all. There are no shops and only 2 restaurants. - $10/day for parking...but we weren't charged for it, either way I hate paying for parking so this goes in the con section. :) - There really wasn't bell service. It was a hit or miss, so plan on carrying your luggage up to the front desk and to your room. This wasn't a problem for us as we only had three bags, but I can see this as being a nuisance for people who 'expect' to have bell service. - Our room didn't have any water pressure nor hot water, but this was quickly taken care of by the front desk. I only listed it here so you could see that there was a slight inconvenience during our stay - While the restaurant had excellent service and wait staff during the dinner hours, the breakfast buffet was nothing over the top. It was very basic with scrambled eggs and sausages, with bacon and ham as well as grits and oatmeal. They also had watermelon, a few pastries, cereal and french toast. The breakfast food was ok. The prices were absurd ($11 for breakfast buffet), as our dinner prices each night with tax and gratuity came out to $124, $116 and $132. Luckily, we didn't pay for it because of our honeymoon package. I think we got a steal on this one. - Not really a con for us, but I can see it being a con for people who like to be "in the middle of the action." The hotel is located opposite of where all the action on Duval street takes place. You do need to take a shuttle if you don't want to walk (I don't recommend driving, you'll spend hours searching for a parking spot) and the beach is located about 1 mile down the road. We didn't mind it at all because 1.) Key West is not the best place for swimming 2.) Who wants to hear rowdy and drunk people yelling and screaming with bands playing at 4 AM? Not me, I'd like my sleep. But if you want to be right near Duval Street, then this isn't the hotel for you. _____ Recommend? I recommend staying here if you actually want to get some sleep away from the action of Duval St. It gets really loud and rowdy especially once the sun sets, so if you need shuteye I highly recommend staying here. Even when we were visiting Westin Resort (which is about one block away from Duval) the noise was so loud we were glad we weren't staying at the Westin. The sevice was exceptionally friendly and they were very courteous and nice. Not once did we run into an impolite staff...and even the maids said hello and asked if we were enjoying ourselves. The cheaper rooms are a good deal if you don't plan on eating at the hotel and you plan on spending most of your time in town drinking and visiting the shops. We opted for the honeymoon package because it took care of a few things we wanted to do. We got a passport package (lets you visit several of the attractions for free) as well as the sunset cruise and kayaking. It also took care of breakfast and dinner for us and let us take care of lunch. Overall the value we spent would have been the same amount or more if we decided to book them all separate. Once again I don't know why they call it a resort, but if you want a place to sleep that's away from all the noise then I recommend this hotel for you. The courtesy shuttle is a nice way to go especially if you are going to town to hit bars. You don't need to find a designated driver! I hope my review helped. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me, I love staying at hotels and making it a pact to review each one I stay at. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Leonora
Reviews.Content: If you look back over my posts in early to mid July, you will see that I agonize over choosing hotels especially in a place like Key West where location is so key, and there is such a wide range of types of hotels. For a family, The Doubletree was a delight and a bargain. Many Key West devotees insist that you MUST stay in the heart of town, but Doubletree's FREE shuttle was actually fun to ride, so that whole argument seemed a non-issue to me. Coming back to the calm hotel felt good to me after being squeezed up with hundreds of Hemingway impersonators at Sloppy Joes. BTW there is no hidden resort fee that makes up for the free shuttle. The shuttle ran every 20 minutes like clockwork, and the driver was a wellspring of information about Key West. The hotel is meticulously clean with a nice airy island feel; the pool area and bar offer plenty of fun, and the concierges were most helpful. Many posters insisted that for my price range ($150 per night) I needed to stay at The Southernmost Hotel since it is in the heart, but honestly I thought it looked a bit run down and certainly lacked the amenities of The Doubletree. I was also freaked out about all this talk of cats all over the place (I saw more roosters), so I absolutely did not want to run the risk of being in any place that had a cat on the premises (sorry both dh and I are allergic). There truly is a dizzying array of types of accomodations in Key West, so I hope this helps someone in the same boat that I was in while choosing a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, so relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: ArieTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: As i use Tripadvisor a lot myself i rather write a review too. I booked this hotel directly. We travelled with the 4 of us. The room was spacious and clean, our view was over some rooftops and partly we could see the sea, from the 3rd floor. Though we had a room opposite of the elevator and ice-machine we where not bothered by the noise of fallen icecubs into buckets. Not at all, i just mention this. The staff is friendly and very helpfull. In the lobby there is complymentry use of 2 computers and you can print out stuff you requer. Like i did for routes to the next hotel. The swimmingpool is a bliss, it not to big and suit the hotel very well. And though a landing place is nearby, helicopters comeover some of the time, they make noise ofcourse. It's not the stay hanging in the air above the hotel. The shuttle is very good and when a shuttle is full they, the drivers, radio another shuttle to pick you up. The drivers are very capable in there jobs. PS the second stop from the shuttle is nearby a supermarked for some goodies. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely a wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: MarleneK
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Doubletree July 23-28, and not a single complaint. The check in was speedy, and the staff absolutely fab ... Mel the concierge was wonderful in arranging trips for me and making recommendations ... the wait staff at the pool and the restaurant - attentive. Never an issue with bellmen ...I had bought some things at the Hemingway museum, and gave the bag to the shuttle driver, who brought it back to the hotel (and it was brought to my room.) Pool lovely. Margaritas plentiful. As my flight was not leaving to 4:30 pm, I was able to get a late check out at 1. The suitcases were put in the bellmen's room - and I stayed at the pool. The hotel has a changing room with a shower which I used before putting on shorts and a shirt to head to the airport. When the Smathers Beach shuttle left before the scheduled time, the Watersports staff called the hotel - and the hotel sent another shuttle just for me. When I was was going to the southern most point, the driver droppped me off two lights after the Duval square shuttle stop, so I would not have to walk as far. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Absolutely top-notch. And you can get Chocolate chip cookies every day if you ask at the desk ... I got two for the road when I left.

Reviews.Title: “A 50/50 STAY”
Reviews.Author: canes13
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice laid back hotel to stay at for my honeymoon, I came across the Double Tree. Every hotel has its good and bad so here are mine... Negatives... I read a lot of reviews on how the service is.. believe what you read..Horrible, no valet, no bellman, and the front desk was just simply rude, one guy was sleeping. I made simple requested to have something in the room for my arrival it wasnt even there when I walked in. I had to call and complain. Breakfst Buffet was cold and the eggs were like soup. The "Beach" is a joke 5 beach chairs that face seaweed. "Do Not Go To The Beach".. Positives... I stayed in the Jr. Suite and it was amazing the best beds in any hotel I stayed in hands down. The Pool area has a great bar, inside the lobby they have a bar that has 2 for 1 at 5pm and the service their is amazing, along with the service at pool side. Room Service food is good and they have a deli close by with some good sandwiches. Recommend... A massage ..They are incredible I suggest you treat yourself to one and tip them well they do an awesome job .. with a sigh of relief when they are done..

Reviews.Title: “Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Itsjustme47
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree was okay. The downtown/beach shuttle was excellent ! Always on time and doing whatever was needed to accomodate the guests. However, the front desk was awful ! Several times, I stood at the front desk for several minutes before being helped. They didn't even acknowledged my presence ! The complimentary airport shuttle is a joke. I was scheduled to fly out at 7:40am. They advised their shuttle didn't start until 7am and for me to take a cab. It cost me $15 to go one mile in the cab ! I'm not quite sure why you would offer a shuttle service to the airport but not operate when there are outgoing flights ???

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms here June 11-12. There was no bellman, no doorman so we lugged our luggage up the stairs into the lobby. The front desk crew was totally inept, screwing up just about eveything on my reservation. The two rooms I received were shabby and the lock on my room did not work. I pointed that out to the bellman when I moved into the room and he said "I'll report it." When I checked out three mornings later, the lock was still broken. The hotel's "beach club" is a joke (it's on a public, dirty beach) and the acclaimed shuttle was never around. The concierge recmmended a local dive service (Subtropical) that was one of the worse dive boats I've ever been on. We left earlier than planned. Just a disaster of a hotel. I am a Hilton Silver Hhonors member and I think Hilton should send an inspector to this place. It's not even up to Hampton Inn standards.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sierram
Reviews.Content: We spent this past Sat.-Sun. (6/16-6/17) at this hotel and were really happy we chose it. Check in was a breeze,room was wonderful and the beds were comfortable! Room service was great,outside bar and restaurant was good,and the beautiful pool was right outside our balcony. All staff were very helpful and were quick to get back to us with any information we needed. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for the last two nights of our KW vacation. We knew it was not in the main tourist area, but had planned to spend some time on Smathers, so it was a good location for that. We stayed in a two bedroom + parlor unit. It was very large. There was a sink and mini-fridge plus a microwave, one king bed and 2 queen beds along with 2 bathrooms. It was visually clean but kind of smelled damp. The pool here is very nice. Servers come by and take drink orders plus there is a bar you can sit at on the upper part of the patio. The restaurant was nice. My daughter and I had the grouper picatta and it was very good. The guys had steaks. If I wanted to stay on that half of the island again, I would not hesitate to stay here, but I enjoyed it in "old town" more.

Reviews.Title: “It was a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: schillm1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff was nothing but nice. I had read so many reviews of them being rude and that is far from the truth. The shuttle picked us right up from the airport and it was a breeze checking in. The rooms were nice and clean. No problems there. The shuttle downtown and to the beach was easy and convenient. Not having to drive anywhere was great. When we stayed out late we called Maxi Taxi and they would drive you back to the hotel for 4 dollars a personâ€¦canâ€™t beat that. The pool was so nice. The food was great. The beach does not smell AT ALL and was beautiful. The people ho complain are obviously people who just like complaining. If you donâ€™t want to stay far from Duval then donâ€™t, if you were smart you would do a little research before booking. I loved the hotel, had a wonderful trip and would recommend it to anyone and definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: maribel
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5days/4nights here. We LOVED it, everything was GREAT. Yes, a few miles from downtown but they run a bus every hour (free). No need to drive my car for 4 days using their bus. Everyone very friendly & professional. Room very nice & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodation, far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in May during a short trip to the Keys. The stay was paid for using Hilton points, we would probably not have paid money to stay here as the hotel is pretty average and quite far out from the centre of Key West. The hotel is clean and adequate. However the decor is quite boring and dated despite the newness of the 'resort'. The free breakfast is very basic it did not even include yogurt or toast, although these were provided on request. Service not great. I rang down to request a bottle opener and was told to come to the desk myself and get it. The balcony is absolutely tiny, hardly enough room for two and the view from it was nothing special. There is a free shuttle into Key West which leaves on time and is quite quick. However it only runs every hour and stops at 11:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced Traveler - Don't waste your time or money here!”
Reviews.Author: Travel154
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll start from the beginningâ€¦ I travel frequently for my career and as a matter of fact, this stay was free for my wife and I as well as our airfare. I stay in hotels just about every week of the year and most often, Hilton properties. First off, this is not a â€˜resortâ€™ as I found most places in Key West like to call themselves. It is a hotel with a pool! Nothing more, nothing less. Upon check in, the staff was very unfriendly and not helpful at all. As I mentioned before, my stay was free because I was using Hilton points. They claimed I had to show a certificate to get my stay. No big deal, but they were in no way helpful to help me find that certificate #. They told me to call the Hilton line and have them fax it over. Still not a huge deal, just a bit of an inconvenience. The Hilton line says it happens all the time but the hotel will usually call them to get things squared away. Not at the Grand Key Resort though. It delayed my check in about 45 minutes and if it werenâ€™t for me getting it done for them, I would have been waiting for 2 hours to check in. It wasnâ€™t a case of them checking me in so my wife could relax in the room while we sorted things out, it was both of us waiting until it was complete. Not exactly what Iâ€™d call accommodating a guest. Next, the hotel lounge was closed four of the five nights we were there. The outside tiki bar was open, but if you wanted to sit inside and enjoy a few cocktails, you were out of luck. Again, not a huge deal unless it is rainy or cool out which it was, so who wants to sit outside. In other words, if you were not downtown, you could enjoy a cold beverage, but in the comfort of your room. The foodâ€¦.the food was marginal at best. Slow service and with servers standing around talking rather than waiting on customers. This is certainly not how you run a restaurant. With only 2 other tables dining, it took us 20 minutes before our server said a word to us. An hour later, we had our food. As far as good things, the hotel concierge was very good as were the bartenders they had outside. Very nice and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean and the hotel was in good shape. The shuttle service was also very good. They ran on time and they did a great job. It seems the management and staff are the issue here. Quick and polite service should be a given when paying what they ask at the DoubleTree Grand Key Resort. In conclusion, I do travel a lot and I do consider myself a good judge of food and service. I didnâ€™t find my experience to be very good anywhere in Key West. Basically, they donâ€™t expect repeat business out of their customers, and therefore they donâ€™t put much effort into food or service. If I were a manager at this resort or any restaurants in Key West, Iâ€™d sent the crew down to Mexico to a resort and have them shadow their people for a day or two to figure out what the service industry is supposed to be like. It may come off as a bit harsh but I call it like I see it. If youâ€™re not a very experienced traveler, it may be just fine for you. But if you feel that you should get what youâ€™re paying for, Iâ€™d recommend staying closer to Duval Street at one of the local Bed & Breakfast spots. We talked to several couples that had done that and paid less than $200 per night. The only thing youâ€™ll be missing out on would be the pool. If thatâ€™s not important to you, stay somewhere else. Key West would be a great time if youâ€™re on a Cruise ship and stopping in for the day, but for an extended stay, go somewhere where they will appreciate your business.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Portcharlottefl
Reviews.Content: Check in was a horrible experience. Never received key to mini-bar. Our room was paid in full when we arrived, however, when I checked my credit card statement. I found that $100.00 was charge to my account by the Doubletree as a security deposit. I have stayed at many, many hotels and have never been charged a security deposit. I was unaware of the security deposit until I checked my credit card statement. The charge was never explain at the front desk upon check in. When I called the hotel for an explaination the front desk manager was rude and hung up on me. The only positive feedback I can give is the shuttle drivers are very nice. However, the hotel does not run enough shuttles. The overall service was very bad. They offer a connoisseur service, however, when you ask the connoisseur questions you get the impression that your are bothering her. Don't try a get a drink at the pool bar this is nearly impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't hesitate to stay here”
Reviews.Author: news222
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of 4 ladies just returned from our annual leave-the-hubby-and-kids behind girls trip here in Key West at the Doubletree. We had booked the rooms several months in advance and requested they be near each other (some rooms adjoin) and this request was happily accomodated. I am afraid perhaps that some people on here may expect too much of the casual, laid back environment they are visiting in Key West. The DT is as equal in quality to other DT's I've stayed at in the US (the BEST beds), it is easily a 4 star property and is going to be in the top 8 hotel chains you could choose to stay at in Key West. It is expensive, but so is every other hotel in KW, most of them almost twice the price of the DT. I was a little worried after some of the negative comments as well, but I can say that we did not experience anything negative. The service at check-in was fast and every person we encountered, from front desk to concierge to bellmen and drivers and bartenders were extremely helpful and pleasant. Some of the wait staff was a wee bit indifferent, but service was good and efficient regardless. I think I was most amazed at how cheap the minibar, sundry shop, food and drink prices were for any hotel, let alone Key West. We ate at the restaurant daily for breakfast, and had lunch poolside a few times, and always enjoyed the food. The pool area was beautiful and the whole facility was clean and in newly refurbished condition. I've heard some say the only drawback to this hotel is the location, however we found it to be a plus, as it was probably much quieter at night than any downtown locations would be. It was about 10 minute at most drive to either of the 2 stops the shuttle makes downtown, and the shuttle service was very prompt plus they would send an extra shuttle when the first one was full. If you need to go to the airport, they are there and ready to take you, and the drivers were full of good advice anytime we asked. Our late evening cab rides back (later than the shuttles ran) were under $20. The pool was great - plenty of towels and chairs and even several cabanas. In one cabana, there are full massage services offered. On the weekend, a steel drum musician played poolside. If you have any questions about the hotel or a visit to Key West, I'd be happy to answer anything I can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Edward62
Reviews.Content: Had reservations for one night but could not catch ferry boat the next day. We stayed another night. Th next day the hotel helped us obtain a rental car and continual called for pickup. They printed out a road map to Ft Meyers without us even having to ask. The hotel is beautiful. They have an houly shuttle that goes downtown all day and until midnight or so. Also a shuttle to the beach, which we did not use . They have avery helpful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: grandma50
Reviews.Content: I want to report that we had a wonderful experience. I hope this puts many of you at ease. We planned this trip 4 months ago and I have read many of the reveiws on this site. I was a little worried with some of the negative comments. I can say that we did not experience anything negative. The service at check-in was fast and we received our cookies. We ate at the restaurant several times and enjoyed the food. The pool area was beautiful and the whole facility was clean and in good repair. The only drawback to this hotel is the location. It is quite far from Duval street, but the shuttle service was very prompt and they even extended the hours over the Easter weekend and sent an extra shuttle when the first one was full. If you need to go to the airport, they are there and ready to take you. After staying here I question some of the negative comments and would assure anyone that they will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Risked My Life By Staying There”
Reviews.Author: IAMJOANNEH
Reviews.Content: While staying there a 26 year old man was killed due to carbon monoxide poising caused by a poorly maintained water heater. Several guests were sick and the resort was shut down by the state. The front desk was poorly trained on how to react in a crisis situation. We were never asked how we were feeling or told the signs to be aware of for carbon monoxide poisoning. They were rude to all of the guests and annoied with us asking questions. We were never told the truth about what was going on and had to read it in the newspaper the next day. I also learned via the newspaper that the hotel was warned about the leak several days earlier and chose to ignore the warning and therefore kill a man and risk the rest of our lives. Then my credit card was charged as if nothing happened. We hopped around to 4 different hotels before finally going home and were never compensated by Grand Key. It's now April and I'm still disputing charges with my credit card company since Grand Key chooses not to return my calls. If this hotel is reopend or ever reopens please do not stay there. It is a matter of principal. Think about the family of the man who died.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service i ever received”
Reviews.Author: lala8277
Reviews.Content: I was treated rudely the second i arrived. There was no "Hello, Welcome to the Doubletree" i just got "License and Credit Card". Got a bad vibe from the moment we arrived. They charged my credit card twice accidently and i was left with no money because it doesnt go back on my account for 5 to 10 business days. The only good part was the hourly shuttle to Duval Street. The rooms are very small and highly overpriced. Would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dfendsu2
Reviews.Content: This was a vacation with my partner, our 15 month old daughter and my mother. We had booked two rooms. We chose the Doubletree in Key West, rather than staying closer to the Square, because of the baby, and because, in my experience, staying on this end of the Key provides larger accommodations. The experience started off rocky, with some miscommunication about the reservation upon check-in. That, coupled with a screaming child and lost luggage (American Airlines) combined for a tense check-in process, to put it mildly. I'm sure I was not a pleasant consumer. However, to their credit, the staff at Doubletree rallied to provide excellent service and remedy for all of our real, and perceived, harms. Chris, an assistant supervisor on the night shift, provided a pitcher of milk for the baby (back-up formula in the lost luggage), soda for the mom and beer for me, gratis. Toiletries and anything they could think of was provided to us immediately. Comps for drinks and breakfast were provided for the first part of the stay. And throughout our week at the hotel, the staff continued to check-in on us to make sure that our vacation would end-up being what we had envisioned it to be. Rhonda and Vanessa were excellent as well. The hotel manager, who makes a mean conch chowder, even personally checked in on us and provided my mother with a comped sunset sail. The pool is very nice, with an "entry ramp" on the one entire end, which makes up for there being no baby pool. The hotel has a shuttle which will take you back and forth to downtown on the hour and makes a car unnecessary. We used the shuttle everyday and found it convenient and timely. Smathers beach is an easy mile and a half walk out the front entrance on new sidewalks (beginning of March they were still fixing the sidewalks, so a little dusty). For us, if we travel with the baby again to Key West, it would be a no-brainer to stay at the Doubletree. As a side note, I did hear from some of the staff that there were "new changes" recently to management. All for the better, in my opinion, this staff was truely professional and eager to provide us with a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place but!!!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiPointPleasant
Reviews.Content: I checked in on December 26th. Everything was o.k. they didn't have enough mini bar keys so I had to wait until the next morning. I had to go to the front desk and ask for the key. They also shorted me on breakfast vouchers. Now everything is fine so I think. At around 10 in the morning the alarms start going off. I don't smell any smoke so my daughter and I finish getting ready and leave and go down to Duval street now it's about 11. At about 1:30 we decide to go back to the room and go by the pool, but we aren't aloud on the property because they evacuated the entire hotel. We finally got on the property another way and found out that someone died on the fourth floor due to carbon monoxide poisioning. The hotel was dong everything the could to help everyone staying at the hotel. They were trying to find other hotels for all the guest to stay at. It took about 3 1/2 hours to finally be able to go up to your room and pack as fast as you can. They were handing out tickets and if your number was called or somebody that was near your room you were aloud to go. The fire department only had 2 carbon monoxide monitors. So thats what made it seem like forever. But everybody was really nice and calm, but it just was really a bummer. I left the hotel and went and stayed up in Big Pine Key at my in-laws house. I heard on the news that the Grand Key had a problem with carbon monoxide the week before but did nothing about it. This was not my first time staying here. I love this place. I just hope they get their act together and straighten everything out.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled Reservation Due To Negligence Will Not Help!!!”
Reviews.Author: dam43
Reviews.Content: Terrible Cust Service and Commitment to Confirmend and Paid Reservation Holders Had confirmed and paid for reservations via priceline, but due to negligence they got shut down by Fire Dept and will not help to re book at similar resort/hotel... Had to call to get this info, as they did not notify that they had cancelled

Reviews.Title: “Love the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Jaminoe
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Key West and again stayed at the Double Tree Resort. This is a nice hotel - the staff is always friendly and helpful, the concierge is a huge asset to help you navigate your way through island fun and "insider" tips. The shuttle is great to take you to hot spots and drop you off and pick you up - up until 11 p.m. The pool area is relaxing but the beach is even better with chairs, towels and umbrellas provided by the hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotIndiana
Reviews.Content: There were good things and bad things about the DT Grand Resort. $10 a day parking fee - I read that online so expected that. The pool area is nice and you can check out towels. I loved watching the planes flying by (F16s?) Bike rental - very nice way to see the sites. Parking close to Duvall Street and other sites is $1.00 an hour. There is a sand volleyball court, but they don't provide a ball. Check in cookies are very good. Coupons and maps provided at the front desk. STAFF: We got the feeling that the staff didn't care if you were happy with your stay there or not. I agree that there needs to be some extensive training of their staff. The waitress at the pool area was decidely unfriendly. Front desk people I thought were nice and the waiters and waitresses in the dining area mostly were friendly enough. SHUTTLE SERVICE: Wonderful to have. We used it every night. The shuttle driver usually didn't speak at all. For the first couple of days he had a big sign up on the front of the shuttle saying that tips were appreciated and then later in our stay (maybe a differrent shuttle) no sign asking for tips. I don't know that he did anything exceptional to deserve a tip, but the first couple of times we did tip him. ROOM - No hairdryer. It had been taken off of the wall (and for the first time I decided not to pack my own). I called the front desk and they assured me that they would get one in the room. Well, I went to breakfast with my hair wet and then went to the front desk. They called housekeeping and said they were

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: jollyfisherman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before in 1999 and they still have the best property in Key West. The service we received from the hotel staff was first class all the way. Ed $ Eileen

Reviews.Title: “It Was Fine”
Reviews.Author: RNKR
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay at the Doubletree. Check in was pleasant and swift, got our cookies without asking and didn't have to pay for parking. The shuttle was on time and very convenient with friendly drivers. The hotel is casual and priced right for the amenities it offers. The best thing about the hotel is the beds, they are the best I have slept in in any hotel or condo. I recommend the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrskoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had spent a week at this property in 2002, so when we had 3 days to take our teenage boys to Key West for the first time we booked Doubletree. The resort is as nice as we remembered. We had a poolside room with french doors that opened onto a patio with nice chairs. We all loved the pool area. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hardwood floors in the lobby were being replaced so it was a little noisey to sit in there but other than that our stay was great. Drinks and snacks at the pool bar are great as is the staff. As a Hilton Honors member we didn't have to pay for parking. We liked being on the quiter side of the island with teens. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Double Tree Stay”
Reviews.Author: sarasmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our two night stay at the Double Tree. We did not rent a car for our stay in Key West so when we arrived at the Key West aiprort (which is very small) we called the hotel for shuttle. They have a phone right there when you pick up you baggage where you call Double Tree for the shuttle. It came within minutes. The hotel is not far from the aiport. We were a little concerned as our flight arrived a little pass 2pm and check in time at the Double Tree is not until 4pm. We were lucky our room was ready and we were able to check in right away. Check in went nice and smooth. EXCEPT.. Don't forget to ask for your chocholate chip cookie. He didn't give us ours and I had to ask for them. They were yummy and nice and warm!! We were checked into room 411. There are only 4 floors in this hotel. Our room was very clean and had a king bed. We had a balcony room that overlooked the side parking lot, the million dollar condos, and across the way in the distance you could see some water. The room was average size. Roomy enough for my husband and I. Bed was very comy. The only complaint that I had about the room is the noisy a/c. Every time it kicked on it made a loud noise. The hotel was quite at night, excpet for we heard some drunk people come back into there rooms at 4am yelling all the way down the hall and laughing and giggling. That was to be expected as we were traveling during Key Wests Annual Fantasy Fest. We saw a lot of guests at the hotel dressed up in there costumes heading for town. If you have young children keep them in the rooms after dark. Some of these guests were barely wearing anything!!!! The next day our room was cleaned with no problems. I read on here that some guests had problems not getting there room cleaned. We went to town and when we came back that afternoon our room was cleaned. The hotel has a shuttle that also goes to the beach area (we didn't go to the beach). Heard it was small and not very clean there. The shuttle also goes to town with two stops one at the Conch Republic Resturant and the other at the end of Duval street. The shuttle can't stop there so it is actually a few blocks away from Duval but, within walking distance. We always got off at the first stop the Conch Republic. The shuttle leaves the hotel at the hour and does it picks up 20 after the hour. We never had a problem getting the shuttle to town or getting the shuttle back to the hotel from town. The hotel has a computer room (very small). There are two computers that guests may use at no charge to surf the internet and check emails from. There is a sign that says 15 minutes if guests are waiting. Some lady was in there basically all day and night. We just checked our mail and printed out directions to go somewhere. The pool area is very nice. It's big and there are a few cabanas that they have that you can use. My husband and I sat in one and read our books. The pool is nice, but very COLD!!! I only put my feet in and that was it. We ate lunch and had a few drinks at the pool bar. The service was good as was the food. It is expensive, but worth it. My husband and I shared a meal. The check out went smoothly. No problems. We asked for a shuttle back to the airport as we needed to pick up our rental car to head up to Key Largo. The shuttle took us to the airport right away. All in all we had a nice stay at Double Tree. We would stay here again, but wouldn't pay a couple of hundred dollars a night for the stay. They call this a resort, but it does need some improving to be called that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: I reserved rooms here for my family as they were coming down for my wedding. I stayed the night before my wedding with my mom and the night of my wedding in a suite with my new hubby. The resort is great: gym, big pool, restaurant, bar... Rooms are kind of small but nicely decorated and clean. Suites are much roomier. Restaurant is a bit expensive but that is expected in a resort. Doubletree offeres free shuttle service around town and a warm chocolate chip cookie at checkin. I would definately set my family up here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: jmp1of2
Reviews.Content: After doing weeks of research, we decided to book our "birthday weekend getaway" with DoubleTree Key West. Let's say, we won't be returning. Our room was average at best. Hotel cleaning staff never cleaned our room, we had to go in the hallway and get our own towels out of the bin containing them, and put the dirty ones in another bin. The friendliest person there was the pool person. Staff was very close to being rude on every occasion we approached the desk, including check in. Oh, i take that back.. we asked a nice young lady for some change once, and she was helpful. Bed was comfy.. guy in room next to us, yelling most of the 1st night & was ill in the bathroom from apparently too much partying that night, wasn't the most pleasant thing to listen to. housekeepers were in the hall speaking loudly much of the time.. and remember we were out and about a lot of our stay! nope.. don't recommend this place in any way, shape or form.. sorry. when we return to key west.. it won't be the double tree that we stay with..

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Needs Improving”
Reviews.Author: ccooperman
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose Doubletree over a number of other less expensive and similarly-priced hotels (Sheraton Suites, Radisson, Casa Marina, etc.) because of good reviews on Trip Advisor and Doubletree's reputation for quality. I'd have to say that, in this case, the customer service at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort was not up to par although the staff was always very pleasant. We arrived around 1:30 p.m. We checked-in but were told that our room would not be ready for an hour. I asked about paying extra for an upgraded room, but was told that none were available even though I saw upgraded rooms available on the internet. I told them our car was parked outside and they said that was fine. We took the shuttle into town and when we came back, we checked into our room (clean and functional but very small). Later, as I was passing by the front desk, I heard a different clerk instructing an incoming guest to put a pass on their dashboard. I walked over and mentioned that I was also parked outside but the previous desk clerk hadn't said anything about a pass. This clerk gave me a pass and said that it was very important to have it on the dashboard or the car could be towed. Wow, I'm glad I heard him giving the pass to someone else so that my car wasn't missing the next morning. I also noticed other clerks giving breakfast vouchers and the famous chocolate chip cookies everyone receives upon check-in. Apparently, along with the parking pass, our clerk had also forgotten to give us our breakfast passes and our cookies. The next day at breakfast, we were seated and waited about 5 minutes and finally just went and helped ourselves to the breakfast buffet. After another few minutes, I approached a waiter about getting coffee and juice and, before I could say anything, he asked if we wanted our check. I said no, that nobody had ever even come to our table. He said he would send our waitress and, even then, it took another 5 minutes for her to come over. Later, we took the shuttle to the beach (Doubletree apparently has control of a sliver of beach just off the main road -- the beach is nicer if you walk out of the Doubletree area). The shuttle is supposed to pick up at 10 before the hour so at 15 before the hour, we were heading to the shuttle area only to see the shuttle speeding away 5 minutes earlier than scheduled. We called the hotel and rather than radioing the shuttle driver to turn around (he had only been gone 2 minutes at this point, and it was still prior to his scheduled departure time), the hotel said they would send somebody else out to get us. It took about 30 minutes more in the hot sun before the second shuttle showed up. Then we got back to our room, from which we had been gone for 5 hours, only to discover that it hadn't been cleaned. I called Housekeeping and was told that we were supposed to leave a card indicating our preferred room cleaning time. Sorry, I hadn't seen the card when we entered the room and I've always found hotels just clean the room in the morning when the guest is away. All little things, nothing momentous, but problems I wouldn't expect from a 3.5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Key West visit!”
Reviews.Author: rainerm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night to visit Key West during our Florida vacation. The room ok and clean, maybe the bathroom could get some new paint, but this is more or less a problem of the tropical climate - we did not worry about that. The staff was friendly and helpful, and quickly arranged an early check-in as we arrived ahead of the planned time. The shuttle to downtown is very convenient, and you can set your watch on its schedule, so don't be late if you want to catch the last bus in downtown to get back to the hotel :-) There is no noise from the adjacent airport, so even guests with a sensitive hearing should have no problems at night.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kwill1
Reviews.Content: great hotel, clean, shuttle service was great and always on time. asked for a upgrade on the room small increase in room rate, no problem they moved our luggage for us while we were out. nice pool area, just didnt recommend the food at the hotel, little deli right down the street able to get sandwiches if you just want a small bite.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: PAWVtravelers
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to vacation "somewhere different" this year - instead of a beach only spot. We picked Key West and booked a package deal with lodging and airfare staying at Doubletree Grand Key Resort. There were eight in our party (3 from WV and 5 from Phila, PA). Stayed one week. We had total of three rooms. No complaints by anyone. Large bathrooms, nice amenities, comfortable, clean and I thought quiet. I had requested microwave prior to our stay but it wasn't in room when we arrived. A phone call to front desk had microwave in room within a few minutes. Frig in room is a definite plus. Breakfast buffet was good as was lunch selections if we ate at hotel. Didn't hit the beach but spent lots of time in pool. It was pretty warm in July but very refreshing in late evening after returning from town. Great plus that it is open late. There were a lot of kids during the day but our kids were little once too. Consierge and front desk staff were very helpful. Poolside bar was convenient, tasty beverages. We had a couple of heavy rain showers during our stay - it would have been nice if there was a covered area to "wait out the storm near the bar and pool". We were there during Hemingways days - - fun time meeting candidates. Doubletree hosted reception for them. Handy deli next door near new condos. Shuttle service was very convenient. Although sometimes we had to wait for another vehicle since one was full, it was still more convenient than driving, parking etc. Shuttle drivers Oscar and "Cuba" go out of their way to satisfy customers. Tip them well!!! They deserve it. Great stay in Key West and the Doubletree. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree was great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the first week-end in August. We are fussy, four-star or better hotel people. The Doubletree met our standards. The rooms are a little on the small side, but no one goes to Key West to stay in the room anyway. In the more important areas the rooms were exceptionally clean, especially for a property near the water. The linens were crisp and new, and the maid service was prompt and thorough. Everything worked in the room; although we did have to call to have the light fixture above the vanity repaired. The balcony is small, probably not much wider than a couple of feet, but again, why would you sit on a balcony in Key West? The convenience of the small refrigerator was particularly useful as we were traveling with baby and toddler. The hotel is well-constructed so the rooms are generally quiet. Although we rarely do laundry while traveling, an emergency with the children found us looking for laundry facilities. They were conveniently located on the second floor and were in pristine condition. The hotel staff was courteous and well-informed. The children in our party were particularly impressed wth the huge salt-water acquarium located in the lobby, and the cookies, delivered warm at check-in, were a hit with everyone. I noted complaints about beach conditions with other reviews. Those going to Key West for the first time should understand that it is not a "beach experience" location. If you want beaches go north of Miami, or even better do the Gulf of Mexico beaches near Ft. Meyers north to St. Petersburg. Even better beaches are near Panama City, Destin and Pensacola. In Key West the water activities involve deep sea fishing, snorkling, scuba diving, moonlight cruises and personal water craft. You can spend time wandering the historical sites around town, and even browse the local "tourist traps". Actually there are many art galleries where the displays are somewhat impressive. Just do not schedule a day at the beach because you will be disappointed. We did not use the shuttle service, but we never left the hotel without seeing it in the process of picking up guests so we assume it operates consistently. The $10 parking charge is quite ridiculous, and seems cheap and low-class given the room rates at the hotel. We just do not expect to pay to park unless we are in a urban area where space is at a minimum. We did not eat at the hotel, but we never eat in hotels. There are fantastic places to dine in Key West, and one shouldn't miss a single opportunity to enjoy Key West cuisine by eating a mediocre room-service meal. One word of advice...we had a power outage of about two and one-half hours on the second night. We always travel with small flashlights for just such occasions, but I would be very sure to include one when traveling to Key West because we understand that power outages are not uncommon when the power is delivered all the way down to the island from the mainland. I would surely stay at the Doubletree again; although the $200/night rate will limit our visits. We have. however, stayed in a couple of really old places in Key West that were generally dreadful and not appreciably less expensive. Overall it was a great experience, and one we hope to repeat soon.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, but not the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Jdwilkin
Reviews.Content: Note: Posting this much too lateâ€¦we arrived to the Keys the first of January 2006 This was our first time to the Keys and with no fault of theirs; the weather was much to cold to participate in water activities, or even to sunbathe. No beaches to speak of which was a huge disappointment to us. The Doubletree was a very nice hotel and I have not one complaint about it. Yes a standard room was on the small side but truly charming. Our friends from middle Florida were supposed to meet us for the weekend, but cancelled because of the bed bug posting. That was just a lame excuse. We had room service once and all we ordered was excellent. Overall, the food on the Keys we felt was not up to par. That is an understatementâ€¦we rarely liked any of the food. If you are from the south as we are, donâ€™t order any tea. We were not able to drink it and our first order of business when arriving home was to order sweet tea. The 24 x 7 pizza delivery to our room was wonderful. Pie in the Sky was our favorite. The best restaurant was Nicola at one of the Hyatt properties, courtesy of a 90 minute time share. Fogarty's and Willie T's came in second and third for lunches. We wonâ€™t ever go back to the Keyâ€™s for it did not offer the things that we like to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Seawall101
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Key West. We arrived on 6/24/06 and stayed for 5 days. After carefully researching my trip, I was somewhat iffy about the Doubletree after reading the negative reviews on Tripadvisor. I can honeslty say I was NOT dissappointed at all. We arrived around 3:30pm, check-in was a breeze, got to the room and the air conditioner had been turned on and it was nice and cool (in the room). The room was as described (on the website) and very comfortable. The balcony was a little small but overall not bad. The staff from the doormen, to the concierge were wonderful. Everybody was very, very friendly and the bar tenders at the Gumbo Limbo Bar (outside pool area) were absolutely great (Andrea rocked!). The hotel is off the "beaten path" but Key West is so small that it really didn't bother us. At the last minute we decided to rent a car and I'm glad we did. We took a ride up US 1 to Marathon and enjoyed the views! The hotel does offer a shuttle service but I did not use it so therefore I cannot comment on it. Duval was pretty cool but parking is sparse (meters = 15 minutes for 25 cents). If you can find a parking lot that's not full - it's $10.00 for the day. There are alot of things to do in Key West and one of the things that we did was the Seadoo tour around Key West - that was a blast and it was set up through the concierge at the Doubletree, once again very accomadating. I am planning my next trip to Key West next year and I will once again stay at the Doubletree in a heartbeat!! Overall, I enjoyed the hotel and I truly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, off of the main drag”
Reviews.Author: JoeRabbit
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Very spacious and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is spotless each day and you can choose which time the maid comes which is useful. The pool does get a bit busy and isn't great for swimming in because so may people seem to stand in it and chat. They run a free bus to the beach but we found that it wasn't the best of beaches. If you have a car drive out the beach at around mile marker 27 (it is a State Park and a lovely well maintained beach). They run a free shuttle bus into town which takes about 25 minutes and this a great a reliable service which runs throughout the day and evening. This hotel is ideal if you want the benefits of being close to Key West without all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Dbltree Grand Key is "pretty good" not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort hotel at the top of Key West right before tropical storm Alberto hit, so I admit the weather was dreary. However, the hotel was very clean and the pool is good, which is important when you have kids. The things I was under-whelmed about are just some details: Like the concierge was not that helpful, or the fact that they were out of "free cookies" when we got there (and when you have kids after a three hour car ride, that is a big deal although it sounds silly--when they advertise a dang free cookie it ought to be there that's all) and when they gave us a "raincheck" for the silly free cookies that weren't there, they still didn't have them a couple of days later--oh well. The housekeeping was a bit sloppy although the hotel was itself is very clean, probably because it is so new. Another drawback is that it is NOT close to any kid-friendly restaurants, but they did have a free shuttle to take us to the area with more restaurant choices. The restaurant in the hotel seemed nice (too nice for young kids in my opinion so we didn't feel comfortable eating on the premises). Instead, we opted to go into town to eat at Turtle Kraals, and were pleasantly satisfied (portions were on the small side but flavor was very good and prices were ok, and kids were not out-of-place there). So, overall, this hotel was nice and I would probably stay there again, but next time I go to Key West I will first call around and try for a different hotel because I think there are better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine, nothing out of this world”
Reviews.Author: LenaMari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree with our Hilton points and after having read some of the awful reviews I was really quite worried. As it turned out, our stay was quite pleasant and relaxing: our room clean, the bed comfortable and the little service we needed was provided and was fine. I was under the impression that our room would have a balcony but it did not and that was a bit of a let down - it was just a sliding glass door with a rail which over looked the parking lot. However, it was a very quiet room. The $10/a day parking did not bother us perhaps because we come from an area where parking always costs. There is the free shuttle but we always just drove into Duval Street which is a 5 or 7 minute drive away. You will need plenty of change for the meters and they do ticket, which again, we're used to so no big deal. We never had a problem finding parking but then we are usually on the opposite schedule of most people who do not have young children and we were also there during the low season. As we were vacationing with our 15 month old son, we used the pool area quite often and it was pleasant though not quite as beautiful as the photographs would indicate. We did drive over to Smather's Beach but having grown up going to the Keys I was not expecting much. Upon arrival we turned right around and went back to the pool. Honestly, the Keys are not known for their spectacular beaches and this beach though groomed just had a lot of seaweed in the swimming area - not the hotel's fault. The outdoor dining area and bar was lovely (especially when dining with a child), however, the food was absolutely unimaginative, did not seem fresh, was quite pricey for the low quality and was really simply terrible! I realize there are many choices on Duval street but upon a 4pm check-in and a dip in the pool, eating dinner at the hotel seemed the most convenient thing to do and we never thought it would be so awful. The mahi-mahi (which is sooo easily caught in S.Florida) seemed to have been frozen for a decade and had absolutely no taste - their lack of salt and pepper on the fish and at the table certainly did not help. The tropical chicken was so overspiced that it made one wonder if they were trying to hide a fowl taste. Needless to say, that was the first and last meal we had from the hotel. For parents with babies: it is hard to get a straight answer regarding their cribs. What they have is a regular metal crib (with rounded hollow metal bars) but it is about 3/4 the size of a regular home crib, it is okay if your child is 9 months or less. Also, the mattress is similar to those flimsy bassinet mattresses, it is not a thick crib style mattress. Our child wound up sleeping with us as the crib seemed a bit small for him (also knowing how much he moves at night, we realized he'd be waking up quite a bit otherwise). The room does have a refrigerater and has enough space to store a half gallon container of milk which was quite helpful but did not have the microwave we were promised. FYI: the T.V. is bolted down and though it swivles to the right and left you cannot get to the back of it making it impossible to attach a portable DVD player to it. If you were hoping to do so for your child you will need an alternative. In summary, our vacation turned out great. The hotel was fine, nothing out of this world but, aside from the food, not terrible. I would stay there again with Hilton points but I would certainly not pay $250 for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Double Tree in Naples we were looking forward to our two nights at Key West. Lovely foyer and check in not a problem, upon getting to our room the mini-bar cupboard lock was broken and when I looked inside food was open and strewn across the draws. Also this room was located close to the laundry or staff areas and even walking to the room we had to pass numerous cleaning trolleys and bags of linen (at after 3.00pm). We went back to reception and complained, they gave us another room. The hotel is great for families, the pool area was lovely and also the fact you could eat outside the restaurant on the terrace overlooking the pool was very enjoyable. The Buffett breakfast was reasonable. They provided free shuttle into Key West and complimentary drink vouchers for a bar on the water in Key West. Wonderful service from the driver. Really enjoyed the fact that they gave you access to their beach club. The shuttle bus took you down to the beach (More like a lake) and complimentary deck chairs, umbrellas and towels were provided. Really lovely touch and we enjoyed it. Concerciege service was exceptional as well, they recommended restaurants and also boat cruises, depending on budgets and time frames. Also enjoyed the complimentary cookies again on arrival. This would be a great hotel for families or people who dont mind staying in a hotel with a lot of kids, that run through the hotel and make a lot of noise around the pool. Housekeeping staff quite rude and would not move out of your way in hallways and constantly over the two days the housekeeping trolleys and laundry trolleys were in the hotel. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the weekends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for five days over Mother's Day weekend. The room was large, the beds and bedding very comfortable, the air conditioning worked well. The downside was that our room faced the pool and we were immediately above the sound system for the weddings on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. There were not any other rooms available so it was very noisy until after 11 each night. It also made it difficult to go to the pool because you have to walk through the terrace where the wedding reception is being held to access the pool. We found the shuttle service to Key West very handy, the staff at the desk and drivers were great. The hotel is OK, the exercise facility very worn, broken equipment and not well maintained. It was definitely not worth the $225/night we paid. We were never offered any information about their beach club at Smather's Beach and the shuttle didn't stop there on any of the runs we were on. Restaurant staff are very nice, pool bar staff bordered on rude. We would not stay there again unless the price was incredibly lower. There is nothing within walking distance from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IGrand Key Resort - Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: J5MOM
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Key West, Florida where we stayed at the DoubleTree Grand Key Resort. The hotel grounds, pool, lobby, restaurant were clean and well maintained. However, the nice surroundings couldn't make up for their staff's attitude of indifference, no service at all and in one case rudeness. Upon our arrival in the late afternoon, there was no one to help with baggage because a wedding party was about to depart on a bus. The front desk told us that all staff was busy with the wedding and we could either wait or bring it in ourselves. I was unable to carry the luggage up the flight of stairs to the lobby so I had to wait. I do want to mention that the young man who did eventually help us after 30 minutes did apologize and refused to accept a tip. He was definitely the exception at this hotel. A card is left on your bed asking what time you want your room cleaned and it will be picked up during the night. The room did not get cleaned until 5pm. So the next two days I left the card asking for 9am service. The housekeeper tells me on the 3rd day that she realizes that I am leaving the card for early service but that she doesn't see the card until she gets there at 5pm. That leaves us without clean towels to shower with after being at the pool or beach. The housekeeper was in the room around 4:30 - 5pm every day when we expected to be showering and getting ready to go out to dinner. The card is a joke. I've never stayed at hotel when my room was cleaned at 5pm. To make it worse, the housekeepers were in 1 room next to ours all day almost every day. It made us wonder why it took so long for that one room or if they waited there all day and then rushed doing the rooms at the end of the day. We were without towels twice, because they were behind in the laundry and we had to come back in the late evening to the desk to get some. Our room reservation was also incorrect. When I made the reservations, I was quoted a price for a King room with a balcony overlooking the pool. When I arrived, I received two doubles overlooking the parking lot and the rate was $5 higher. I only had a reservation number and nothing in writing from the hotel so I could not prove what had been told to me over the phone. So this was my fault and was willing to accept it, but when I asked to them to at least honor the rate the desk clerk called someone from the back out who said "you are on your own". She said this several times after each time I explained why I was quoted that rate. This was in reference to the group rate we had for a wedding we were there for. I knew that my personal rate was my responsibility and not the brides but when I booked the room for extra days they gave me the same rate since we were with the wedding party. Yes it was only $5/day difference and was not that big of a deal. But as a customer service measure, it would not have hurt this hotel to give me a $30 credit rather than argue with me rudely in the lobby. So I didn't get the room I booked and paid more money than I thought. You know I could have spent that $30 in the restaurant or bar but she wasn't going to bend an inch. Several wedding groups were there the same week as we were. A notice in the lobby was posted welcoming each group except ours. The only difference I knew of was that our reception was at a restaurant in town instead of the hotel. Again, this small gesture of welcoming our group wouldn't have cost them a thing and would have made everyone feel special. Also on two occasions in the restaurant we couldn't find anyone for more than 20 min. Once we waited 20 minutes after eating to pay our bill. The 2nd time after waiting 20 minutes for our bill we got up and left and went to our room to get a few things before going out. We stopped back by the restaurant to try to pay our bill and they hadn't even realized we left without paying. Our waitress did apologize after we explained that we had left without paying for 2 bagels and a coffee. Noise level in adjoining rooms was poor, we could hear what people were saying and they had young children who cried and ran through the room. The front desk staff acted as if they didn't care if we were there or not. When you go to a resort you are usually paying a premium for the hotel and expect good to great service. This hotel is in need of some serious Customer Service Training and then it would be worth staying there. I would not stay here again. I very rarely complain but felt compelled to tell others my of my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “This place could care less if you ever come back”
Reviews.Author: JLink
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked the "sweet romance" package for this hotel for the Memorial Day weekend. We looked forward to the "deluxe" room and all the other perks she paid for. Let me tell you, I was totally heartbroken for her when I saw what she had paid for. The "deluxe" room was a room with no balcony, just a sliding glass door with a rail two inches beond the door. The "sparkling wine" promised upon arrival was in the room, but it smelled and tasted like skunk urine! The package also offered room service breakfast, but when we checked in we received coupons for breakfast in the restaurant. On top af all of that, she has requested a "smoking" room. After arriving in the room there were no ashtrays. We called the front desk and they said they didn't have "smoking" rooms. Also...one of the perks was " come early, stay late" on the last day we requested the 5PM checkout which we were willing to pay $75 for but was told that there was no availability . You will also see that they offer an exlusive "beach club". After a 10 minute ride by shuttle to the "club" where we had been promised chairs, towels and an umbrella, we found ourselves at a public beach. We did get towels and chairs...but guess what NO UMBRELLAS! And if you miss the shuttle downtown...expect a $17 cab ride both ways. We were to fly out at 5:45 and wanted the room to freshen up in before the flight. When we arrived at the airport we found that our flight was canceled. The airline offered accomodations for the night, guess where! The Doubletree. We went back to the hotel and guess what type room we got.... a "SMOKING" room, you remember, one that they didn't have? And what about availibilty for late check out...we got back to an empty room after 7PM. This place is crap, the staff could care less and I wouldn't accept a FREE trip to this place. We saw these reviews and just thought that maybe a few unhappy people had bothered to write, but from now on WE BELIEVE...DO NOT PAY TO STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “i'd come back any time”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the doubletree key west during a visit tot key west in may 2006. i can say that i was very satisfied with this hotel. my room was large, spotless and in good condition. all facilities were ok, everything functioned properly. the bathroom was remodeled with modern taps etc. the room was furnished with white wooden furniture, carpets/wallpaper/curtains were styled in dark blue and soft yellow. i liked it immediately. the sheets were crisp and the mattress was also good. i had an excellent nights sleep. my room was facing the street side of the hotel so i wasnÂ´t bothered by any "pool noise". the breakfast buffet was real good, no complaints, really. for getting downtown key west i used the free hotel shuttle and had no problem getting picked up by it in the late evening when i wanted to return to the hotel. the hotel is pretty far out of key west, remember this when you think about staying there. iÂ´d come back to this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: evildoug13
Reviews.Content: stayed for 10 days. Staff was outstanding, especially Elizabeth and Pa Jaree. FREE Shuttles went to and from downtown every hour. That was an outstanding bonus. You really don't need a vehicle unless you plan on leaving the Key West area. I do understand the complaints against the hotel parking fee, but it didn't affect my stay. The pool was very nice. If you don't like noise ask for a room not facing the pool. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop! Go Back! Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: CCCharland
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for our 20th . We requested champagne & strawberries in the room upon arrival. When we got to Key West I called from the Airport to confirm our rooms & the champagne. We were told everything was all set & that the shuttle would be right there. After waiting for 40 min. the shuttle finally showed up. We had paid for 2 rooms with King Size beds & a view - what we got was a room with 2 dbl beds & a view of a metal roof next door. Flowers in our room & not champagne. I called down to the front desk & was told there was nothing they could do for us but they would come up & get the flowers! They finally came back with the champagne & strawberries after an hour but never once offered any type of credit or comp for the mix up. I called Expedia & they tried to talk to the GM but was told that we got what we got & that was it. The Fan & AC in our room was not working. We complained to the front desk 3 times & by the last day they finally sent someone up to fix the fan & look at the air conditioning. The Shuttle schedule said it dropped off in 2 locations but on the first night the shuttle driver said there was only 1 p/u up & d/o. Front Desk, Management & Concierge need serious help, maybe they should go back to school for Hospitality training. We will never stay at this Hotel or chain again. I am telling everyone I know about this horrible experience in hopes that they never stay there. Donâ€™t stay at this hotel if you want a pleasant experience in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. My major complaint is that it is very loud, our room faced the pool & there were people at the pool at all hours of the night partying & screaming, two of the three nights of our stay there were weddings with the music so loud we could not get any sleep, we had a two year old with us & the last night we had to get up at 4:00 in the morning & we did not get any sleep. The room was too small & the parking fee was a little ridiculous. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very, lovely hotel!”
