Reviews.Author: morninglory177
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, our son and his fiancee visited Key West for a wedding the end of March and first part of April. I had read previous reviews of this hotel AFTER I made the hotel reservatons. I was nervous about any 'sitings' of bed bugs. I am happy to say that no one in our party or friends who traveled with us experienced any problem. The hotel was good. Clean, modern rooms; however the rugs could have been shampooed. The pool area was attractive and the sun never stopped shining. It was great! The food was just okay. The breakfast buffet was really good with alot of choices. Good price, too! Some of the lunch entrees were good; others not so good. We visited for 6 days and didn't eat most of our meals there but enough to say that if you're tired and lazy and don't want to venture forth into Key West for food then the hotel's food is adequate. I would stay here again but it is far from downtown Key West. We were lucky to have rented a car. Beware! of car park gouging! It was easy $20-30 to park each time we went to Key West. But the shuttle wasn't a good way for us either.

Reviews.Title: “Not A 3.5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Grand Key Resort isn't a bad hotel, but it doesn't deserve a 3.5 star rating based on our experience. The rooms were mostly clean and fairly comfortable but: * The thermostat in our room didn't work meaning the AC either ran continously or not at all. * The room was half-painted. It looked like someone started repainting the room a slightly different color and stopped partway through the job. * The vanity sink faucet was missing it's internal screen and so water sprayed out sideways wetting your clothes every time you used it. * Significant rust around the bathroom doorframe. * Lightbulb burned out in entryway. * Drips of dried blood smeared on wall below toilet paper holder. * Ceiling fan apparently not working. * View out of room was a tin roof that reflected sunlight into our room. * The Expedia virtual tour map/diagram is very misleading regarding the beach. It's 300 yards from the property and across a busy four-lane highway, not right outside the hotel. * The hotel charges $10 per day for parking, which is the normal rate for areas near the historic downtown area of Key West. Most parking in the area of the hotel is free.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again, definitely!”
Reviews.Author: Petzenburg
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Doubletree for one night in March and would have really liked to have stayed there longer. The staff was very friendly, the standard rooms are large, nicely furnished and very clean. We used the shuttle to return from town and we were very satisfied with the service. We also had breakfast at the Doubletree which was extremely good (various fruit, bagels, assorted bakery). As another reviewer said, cold breakfast is absolutely sufficient. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Grand Key is a Double Grand Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had my daughter's wedding here. We had a great time with family and friends, and the hotel is beautiful, but the business end with the Doubletree was a nightmare. Their expert recommendations for the amount of food at the cocktail hour were way off. After being told it was plenty of shrimp, and plenty of cheese for fifty people, the food was gone in ten minutes, before the wedding party even got there. Half the people had no shrimp or cheese at all, and they would not refill anything. Also, one of the entrees, the chicken, was supposed to be stuffed with prosciutto and mozzarella, but was filled with spinach, a much cheaper recipe. Coffee time?? The cups were there, but never filled. This is the first wedding I've ever been to, where they never served coffee to anyone. We got a few hundred dollars back for the coffee and chicken, but they adamantly refused to compensate us for the embarrassment of the cocktail hour. After admitting the mistakes, they then changed their story, saying the ham and cheese were minced into the chicken, and WE should have asked for the coffee. Waitressing was lousy, the ceremony was very poorly planned, and their shuttle was twenty minutes late to the ceremony, (they actually tried to blame us for returning late). I've been treated much better at lesser quality hotels, whenever there was a problem. Their hardball tactics, rudeness, and refusal to compensate us for the cocktail hour were cheap and very low class, and very unusual for a supposed fine resort. The Doubletree Grand Key Resort, is a Double Grand disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: tijmetofly83
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over spring break and were very pleased with the rooms and staff. They were very helpful and eager to please. The hotel has a free shuttle to/from Duval Street and tourist areas, as well as the beach. It is near the airport but very quiet, no noise from airport. Would definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: CDBee
Reviews.Content: If you go to a hotel during the off-season, it has the chance to offer you more service. This wasn't the case at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort just outside of Key West. The room was fine, but overall our stay there was generic and uninspired. Service was spotty with too few staff on hand. Plus the 20-minute shuttle ride you need to take back and forth into town was a drag. Perhaps the only reason to stay at the Doubletree Grand Key is if you have kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripalways
Reviews.Content: We return to the Grand Key resort in February for the second time in 6 months. It was clean, the room was in perfect condition, (no bed bugs), it was beautiful and up to my expectation. At the check in, we were offer an upgrade in a suite. Great room with everything we need (whirlpool, 2 televisions, internet connection, small fridge, etc...). And even a good view of the beautiful pool. I have just one critic, the 10.00$ fee for parking is exaggerated and not necessary. It should be include in the price of the room or even removed. The shuttle is convenient but can get stocked for returning at night to the hotel. I will not hesitate to return again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even stay the night”
Reviews.Author: StevoL
Reviews.Content: If you want to be assured of a quiet night's sleep, then certainly don't stay here. I always request a non-connecting room to assure that I won't hear my neighbors through the connecting door. When I finally got to the room and saw that it was a connecting room, I called the front desk and was advised that ALL the rooms at this hotel, other than suites, have connecting doors. At 9pm, in addition to a child screaming, I heard a normal conversation taking place next door.....every word. I spoke to the manager on duty to be sure that there were no other rooms without connecting doors and was told "no". I found another hotel, booked a room, checked out, and to its credit, the hotel agreed to refund me the night.

Reviews.Title: “Pirates, ghosts, and other wonders of the Key West”
Reviews.Author: HelioSol
Reviews.Content: Key West is by far the most exciting of all Florida Keys. Where else can you find exquisite beaches, restaurants, museums, and sights immersed in a culture that ranges from the upscale and classy to shipwrecking and piracy? This Key has a rather wide variety of attractions for different crowds so I will point out only those that appealed the most on my first trip there. First and foremost is simply taking the time to walk around and take in the abundant culture around you. This means exploring the streets both by day and night! From the active beaches of the day to the bustling bars and restaurants of the night, this place will keep you on your toes. Of a particular recommendation is the Ghost Tour of Key West, which departs from the main street of the town at around 9:00PM. It's a lengthy affair, lasting 'till about midnight, but the stories you'll hear will be more than worth it. Of the many street shows, the Cat Man of Key West takes the award for being the most creative and, quite possibly, the most impressive. Anyone who has tried to get their cat to do anything other than their own bidding can easily testify to that! Make sure to try the local foods, such as the famous Key Lime pie (available in many forms - including coated in chocolate and served frozen on a stick). Above all, get out of your hotel (even if it's a Hilton!) and explore the area. You will be well rewarded for your adventuresomeness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend getaway package with this hotel. We enjoyed our free breakfast and complimentary cookies in our room. The staff was friendly and we enjoyed long hours at the poolside. We even consulted the Concier and booked a couples massage by the pool cabanas which was delightful. The hotel is abit far from the key west downtown area, but the shuttler is very convinient and it takes you and picks you up from a pier. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel as well as their facilities. We would stay here again! We booked online through Hilton, they have specials packages that you can take advantage of, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ChernMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for only one night, so we didn't get a chance to really experience the place, but were very pleased with what we did see. We were upgraded to a superior room that had a seperate jacuzzi tub and shower, good sized balcony overlooking the pool and incredibly comfortable king sized bed. The place looks like new and seemed very clean. The only downsides are the location (quite far from the Old Town and in the middle of a new condo development, but the shuttle service was efficient) and the parking fee (seems unnecessary in a location like this with plenty of parking available). The pool didn't seem to be heated when we were there, but we didn't have enough time to do much swimming anyway. And as far as Key West prices go, it seemed like a decent value. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but small room”
Reviews.Author: beachthyme
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 daughters and I, stayed at the Doubletree from Dec. 21-24. The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly. I made the reservations using my Hilton points, in which a standard room is usually given. Upon arrival we were given a free upgrade to a superior room. I thought the room was on the small side, especially for the 4 of us. There wasn't much in the way of closet or drawer space. There was an armoire that held the tv and had 4 small drawers below, and two closet cabinets on each side. On one side there was an iron & ironing board taking up some of the space. Opposite the sink area was a counter and below it was the mini-bar. The refrigerator had a variety of beverages available for purchase and there was plenty of room to keep your own food/drinks, which we did. Next to the fridge was a cupboard with some snacks. I think there was a lot of wasted space, since they spread out the snacks in a row and there was nothing behind them. There was a small balcony overlooking the pool area. I don't think I have ever seen a balcony so small. It was only about 3-4 feet wide, just barely the width of the Adirondack chairs and little table provided. It was a tight squeeze and I worried about dropping something over the edge everytime I moved. Speaking of the pool, the first night the water was perfect, nice and warm. The next 2 nights the water was cold, maybe the heater was having problems, as others have mentioned. I had a laugh over their idea of a waterfall. On their website they describe the pool as having a waterfall. It was only about 12 inches high. There also was a whirlpool to relax in, and a volleyball court. Unfortunately, sand from the volleyball court, got tracked into the pool area and made it look dirty. A bar was not too far from the pool, and a waitress came around to take orders. The only meal we had at the hotel was breakfast. They had a buffet setup or you could order from the menu. We opted for the "cold" side of the buffet, since this was included with our room. The muffins, breads and other pastries were a little on the dry side. There was fruit salad, cereals, toast, bagels. I peeked at the hot side of the buffet, but didn't think it was worth the extra $4 they charged, especially since I don't eat meat. They had eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage and biscuits and gravy. The waitstaff was very attentive. On our last day there, we needed to leave early and asked to have our meals to go. The waitresses bent over backwards to put our food together and have us on our way. The shuttle was a good way to get around, as long as you're a little flexible and not in a rush. In the morning, there was plenty of seats, though later when we went out to dinner, the bus was packed and I think a couple of people didn't get on. On your return trip, be sure to get to the pick up points early. Once we missed the shuttle by a minute or two, though our watches said otherwise. One night the shuttle arrived full at Duval Square, but a few minutes later a second shuttle arrived. The only problem we had was our 2nd day there. We had been out all day, came back around 3, and the room had not been made up. Around 4:15 the maid came by, but I had to ask her to come back later because we had just been down to the pool and needed to change. The next day, I used the door hanger with "Please make up room", and the room was cleaned before we returned for the day. We had a great time in Key West and I'm ready to go back. I would probably try the Hilton instead, only because it is closer to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Doubltree Grand Key”
Reviews.Author: lprasz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree from Dec. 24 through Dec. 31st. We were a party of 11, booking 4 rooms and 1 suite. We enjoyed our stay very much and felt that, overall, the hotel provided us with everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The good things: The pool area was wonderful. The poolside massage was excellent. The general dÃ©cor and atmosphere of the hotel was great. They have 2 computers with internet access which is free (a must when traveling with teenagers!) They have a fitness room. The beds were very comfortable. The cold breakfast buffet for $6 was a good deal. Free shuttle service to the airport and the downtown area. The beach club had complimentary chairs, umbrellas and towels for the guests. Shuttle service to get there is free. The beach is pretty and offers watersports. Donâ€™t go for a swim though. Itâ€™s shallow and full of seaweed. Itâ€™s great for sunbathing, but not much else. (Key West is not known for its beaches. If thatâ€™s why youâ€™re going, change your plans and head to Maui.) Our disappointments: The food in the restaurant is not very good. There arenâ€™t any other places to eat within walking distance. (There is a grocery Â½ block away that has some food, and Big Johnâ€™s pizza delivers to the hotel and is very good.) The fitness room should be bigger. There are only 5 pieces of equipment in addition to the weight machine. 1 of the treadmills was broken the entire time I was there. This is their busiest week of the year. I had to wait to use it on several occasions. Also, the water cooler in the fitness room was empty and it took 2 days for them to replace it. There is no excuse for that. The room wasnâ€™t kept very clean either. The free internet access was also located in the fitness room. Often it would be crowded in there with people who werenâ€™t even there to work out. They should put the computers in the lobby or something. The pool was not heated. The heater was broken during the recent hurricane. They have my sympathy for that, but I heard a lot of people complaining that the pool was too cold. My biggest gripeâ€¦.the shuttle service. Yes, itâ€™s free. They have 2 buses. Again, this is the busiest time of the year and the hotel was sold out. It was a battle to get a seat on the bus. Often we would have to wait for another. They only ran every hour. They should have been running the buses non-stop at this time of year. There was one driver who was very unhelpful. Though there were bars on the bus to accommodate standing passengers, one particular driver would not accept standing passengers. People were left to wait a long time for another bus, or to take an expensive taxi. They need to expand and improve their shuttle service and replace the one unpleasant driver. The shuttle service also did not run early in the morning, so on the several occasions where we had to be at the Marina at 7:00 am we had to take a very expensive taxi ride. My favorite part of Key West was Conch Harbor and the dining there. Worthwhile excursions: Dry Tortugas on the Yankee Freedom and Deep Sea fishing on a Â½ day charter (I caught a 40 lb Mahi Mahi). Both were expensive but totally worth it. Donâ€™t forget to visit the Hemingway House. Itâ€™s a must see. Best part of the trip? Spending a week with my entire family and no one had to cook.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Price for a Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jenny1stAv
Reviews.Content: I booked Doubletree Grand Key Resort months ago based on its price. Two days before we left I read the review posted here about bed bugs and I was terrified. My teenagers, husband and I came anyway and it was a terrific time and our stay at the Doubletree was very nice for the price. We celebrated Christmas in KW and the hotel did a great job of celebrating the holiday, with Christmas music piped in the hallways and shuttle and leaving Hershey kisses in a cute little tin on our bed on 12/25. The staff was courteous and the shuttle was very useful and dependable (we saved money by not renting a car). We requested a microwave and did not get that, so that was the only bad part. The hotel was clean, there was internet access and free computers to use, the exercise room was very adequate...we felt like we were staying at a nice resort but not paying high dollar. The hotel worked with us on our last day when our flight left late and we had to check out b/c they needed the room. They allowed us to stay and use their facilities for the last few hours and check our luggage and use the changing room with shower - NO CHARGE! The only thing I wouldn't do is listen to the conceirge regarding scooter/bike rentals. Rent on your own for half the price....and DEFINITELY rent bikes and scooters as this is the way to see the island - go through Moped Hospital as they are way more courteous than The Bike Center and not price gouging. We loved Key West but don't expect a lot of sand/beach. We would recommend the Doubletree to anyone and really appreciated the free shuttle to and from the airport and to all the places that matter in KW! Go to the Seaside grocery store (1/2 block away) for very reasonable provisions like beer, pop, chips, and made-to-order sandwiches from friendly owners!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs -- BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: Blondelaw
Reviews.Content: I read a review on this site about bed bugs at this hotel, and ignored the warning. To my misfortune, I booked this hotel on December 15 for four nights. During my first night at the hotel, I experienced extreme itching on my right foot and leg while sleeping. The next day, I had numerous bites up and down my legs and feet. I chalked it up to mosquito bites from the night before from wearing a skirt. However, by my last day at the hotel, my body was covered in bug bites, in areas of my body that were not exposed to the night air - and thereby leading to my conclusion that the bites covering my body from head to toe (literally) are in fact bed bugs. It is a shame because the hotel had a decent pool and a fair rate for Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was unpleasantly surprised to find my stay at this hotel to be horrible. Front desk checked us in to the wrong room, after finally getting to the "right" room, we found broken floor tiles, dirty walls, stained carpeting. After the 1st night, we awoke to 30 bed bug bites all over bodies! That next day, we were told to stop taking baths because apparently there was a leak in the pipes and water was leaking into the front office. The view from our "superior" room was of the hotel's parking lot, roof and awnings. It would be nice, also, if any of the restaurant staff could speak English. As annual visitors to Key West, it's safe to say we'll stay at this property "never again!"

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: sparklesque
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Double Tree and I would say its a nice place. The front desk upgraded us to a room with a view complimentary, but it was a little small. The bed was nice, but not as comfy as the Marriott bed we had just slept in the 3 nights prior. The water pressure was the absolutely the worst thing. The faucet pressure was so low it took me 5 minutes just to wash my face. The shower was a little better, but the toilet flush was very weak (this almost lead to an embarassing problem!). The water pressure problem would make me not stay there again or really recommend it. The restaurant was good for breakfast and lunch for us, and the concierge helped us rent bikes....but failed to mention that when we went down to pick them up in the lobby, we had to pay cash only. This was aggrevating since we didn't get a heads up over this, and the bikes were pretty darn junky & rusty- but they worked. The shuttle to downtown worked out OK, but I wish they had more pickup times other than just on the hour. The beach was really tiny & it was off-site, but Key West isn't known for beaches anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: santan
Reviews.Content: My wife, two daughters and I spent 3 nights at the Doubletree Grand Key and truly enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The zero depth (I think that is the term) pool was terrific and my two young daughters (ages 5 and 2) loved it! Nice sandy area for young kids to play in as well. The room was clean and attractive. The hotel operates a free shuttle that runs into town on the hour which we found very convenient. This was our first visit to Key West and we would definitely stay in the Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Grand Key resort and we just loved it. The staff is extremely friendly and the whole place has a relaxed laid back atmosphere. We regret we had to leave already after 2 nights. If you're looking for a decent hotel on the Keys, go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs repairs”
Reviews.Author: TomnDar
Reviews.Content: After 2 hurricaines everwhere on the island needs some fixing up, but when your business is to impress, you should try a little harder. We needed to get a new room key every day and when finally spoke with the maintanance manager, he said it was operator error! The pool area needed the lattice work to be replaced, which was left partially hanging from the walls. The carpets throughout the property were in need of a cleaning. We will return to the Key's, but will try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Half, half”
Reviews.Author: Zivana
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at the Doubltree from 08/24/05 to 08/27/05. I found the hotel over the travel agency here in Luxembourg. At the beginning when we arrived we first got a room that had a terrible smell. It was really not possible to stay even a few minutes inside. We decided to open the window and see what happens. After 2 hours the smell was still there or even worse. We called the housekeeper, she came and asked us if we would like to have some fresh air and that the problem was probably due to the Air conditionning that was not working. We had 2 guys comming to repair, while they were repairing they noticed the carpet was wet and the smell came from there. After an other 2 hours of waiting the answer was clear, the aircon was repaired but the smell will remain. Finally after a few round trips from the room to the lobby we got a new room. That one was okay and did not have that nasty smell. Unfortunatly on our second night, we had a power loss due to the hurricane Katerina that hit the hotel. As it was anyway already late we did not worry much about that. the problem is that Katerina was over the Keys the entire next day, so we had to spend our time inside the hotel and that is when you realise how the hotel really is. There was no power except in the lobby, there was not even any power inside the kitchen, the employees of the hotel have become nasty after a while, because people were complaining. You could not ask them anything, because they would make fun of you. And as there was no power you could not even listen to the radio or use the bathroom inside your room. That is how we had to spend the entire day. When we woke up in the morning, of course the shower was cold (still no power), but we made it a try and drove far away from that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay & Visit”
Reviews.Author: fawn1820
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of August l5 in Key West at the Doubletree. Hotel was great, staff was very friendly & helpful. This hotel is about 3-4 miles from Duval Street so unless you had a car, you relied on their shuttle service. Shuttle service to dowtown VERY DEPENDABLE and convenient. Doubletree is about a block from the ocean, very nice to walk along the sidewalk by the ocean. Could walk to SMather's Beach, about 2 miles, but hotel has shuttle service there too. There are 3 restaurants, 2 inside and one poolside. Pool is nice, not real big, they do have several cabanas and you can have a massage poolside. Rooms were nice, clean, "tropical decor, granite in bathroom". We did rent a car for 24 hours and went to Bahia Honda Beach which is a must. The best natural beach in Keys we found and not manmade, it is awesome! FYI: Due to the hurricane at the end of July or first of August, Smather's Beach was a little smelly due to the amount of seaweed washed up on shore. They were in the process of removing the huge piles of seaweed. Also, beach at Ft. Zachary Taylor was pretty much gone. Same hurricane took the sand back out to sea! Corps of Engineers was going to work on replacing the beach after hurricane season! The hotel does charge a daily rate to park a car in their lot. The Doubletree is on the quieter end of Key WEst, more relaxing than staying dowtown, but be sure to go downtown and see all the shops, bars and the "Sunset Celebration". Don't forget the Southernmost Point! Hope Key West survives the rest of this hurricane season.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel, room only, for three nights in August. This hotel is very nice. Our room was light, airy and pleasant. The pool area is rarely crowded, with ample cushioned sun loungers and complimentary towels. The pool itself, while not large, is perfect for a quick cooling dip at any time! There is a small gym, with running machines & weight station. In the gym are two computers with free internet access at any time. The bus shuttle was very dependable. Very accommodating, laying on extra transport if needed. We found it a very good base for relaxing around the pool in the morning and early evening, and visiting Duval Street in the afternoon and late evenings. About 15 mins on the bus gets you to Duval Street. We caught a taxi back one night that cost us $16 for four of us. If we return, we'd return here as you feel that you can relax in a quiet oasis of calm after the party atmosphere of Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Chris2234
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Doubletree a day late due to Hurricane Dennis, we were worried at what we might find in the aftermath but we need not as the hotel had done a terrific job in getting everything sorted, you would not believe a hurricane had gone through 24 hours earlier! The reception staff were jolly and efficient, very child friendly and the Cookies went down a treat! The Rooms were delightful and just as we imagined Key West decor would be. The Breakfast was to a high standard, a great Pool Bar and a great pool. It's location is too far to walk to the main areas, The Shuttle bus is great but does get full very quickly, the hotel does all it can to accomodate everybody but sometimes you may have to be patient and wait for another one. Far better we booked taxis in the evening which were not expensive and drove the car into Key West on a couple of occassions, providing you dont try and park right near Duvall there is plenty of very reasonably priced parking around within 5 minutes walk of the main area. This Hotel and all it's Staff were great, our 6th time in the US and this Hotel is one of the best, I have high standards and this Hotel met easily them, great value, Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Double Grand Key Resort was exactly what I expected based on previous reviews. Rooms were clean, pool was nice but a bit dirty at times the shuttle was reliable, and the food was good. The few complaints that I have is that although I know the beach would not be special, I was very disappointed by the lack of chairs,umbrellas, and space. When I inquired about additional umbrellas I was told to put a chair under the trees for shade. Also, I was told by the staff at the desk that the beach was a ten minute walk. It ended up being 2-1/2 miles away which took my wife and I forty minutes to walk to. Take the shuttle unless you are interested in getting some exercise. The other issue that I have is the parking fee. I was aware of the $10.75 per day fee but there were plenty of spaces available at all times and I felt the fee was a bit excessive. Also, there was no valet service like expected. There is a reason that this hotel is much less expensive than many others in the Key West. I would go back for the price. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Marylander99
Reviews.Content: This is by no means a luxury hotel. I did tons of research and chose Doubletree because their website bills it as luxury and spacious. I basically expected a Doubletree level of service and amenities. I didn't expect to be downtown, or on a beach, or anything that they didn't advertise. But the whole thing was no better quality than a Holiday Inn. The rooms are average, the carpet was worn, and the towels scratchy. Yes, they offer fancy soaps and shampoos, but that doesn't really make the place luxury. They gave me a room next to housekeeping, so I heard lots of yelling in Spanish early in the morning, and the housekeeping carts were stored right in front of my room. They also vacuumed the hallways at 11 PM each night. The bed was very comfy; however, with the all-white sheets, I noticed hairs and threads that were not mine, so it only highlighted the possible cleanliness issues. Service was terrible, from a rude operator on the phone when I made the reservation, to an unanswered e-mail that I sent them, to the front desk who wouldn't move me to a room away from housekeeping. Sure, they give you some cookies so you don't feel so bad, but they're basically pretty rude. There wasn't even a "thank you" when I checked out. The whole parking thing was a joke. I knew about the fee, so I'm not going to say it was a hidden charge or anything, but lots of local people crash the pool by sneaking in through the gate near the parking lot. And I'm 100% sure they don't pay the $10 parking fee. Not only that, there was tons of parking available, so I don't really know why they had to charge extra for it. The pool itself was nasty. Very dirty, and full of locals who are the type to crash a private pool. Meaning, they left their trash all over the place, hogged rows of chairs that they didn't use, and took up lots of space. I found a used Pampers underneath the lounge chair where I was sitting. In general, people that pay to stay at a Doubletree don't want to hang out with locals who crash the hotel by sneaking in through the back door. And sitting out at the "Beach Club" was really not an option due to the intense smell on the beach. Yes, I know that's not the hotel's fault, but if the beach isn't an option, then maybe they should clean up the pool area and stop the locals from crashing. Or, maybe they should just advertise it as a local pool so that Doubletree guests wouldn't be disappointed. In summary, I would only stay here again if I got a great rate and the Holiday Inn-type hotels were booked. Because you're paying for the Doubletree name and you're not getting the Doubletree quality that is supposed to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews are interesting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's funny reading the many reviews that complain about the location of the DoubleTree, it's one hour shuttle, etc. If these people are internet savvy enough to write a review here, didn't they read the PREVIOUS reviews before going, that make it very clear about the hotel location and the shuttle services available?! Funny too when they complain about the beaches in Key West ---- again, do your research, KW is not a beach destination! And why does one use a forum for reviewing the DoubleTree Hotel to voice complaints about Key West in general? Anyway on to the hotel. It's very nice. Nice pool with a zero-entrance section for small kids, a small "waterfall", not olympic sized but definitely not small. It has a varied shape and some character. To read some of the reviews you'd think it was a basic small rectangle like you'd find at a motel 6 - give me a break it's a nice pool! Good restaurant for breakfast or lunch, but if you know anything about KW you'll visit the MANY awesome local places for dinners. The staff has always been pleasant and efficient. The shuttle is great, we always rent a car for side trips up the keys, but use the shuttle for most trips downtown. The hotel shuttle also runs to Smathers beach which is nothing special by any means. When we want a nice beach as part of a trip we go to Sanibel Island, not KW. We've enjoyed the DoubleTree each of the last 5 winters and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible "beach club"!”
Reviews.Author: dcg86
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, rooms clean and newer, great lobby and pool side restaurant/bar, and the best concierge service. It is not near a beach, so we booked it because it promoted their "private beach club" - and it was awful!! The chairs were at least 20 years old and broken. There were only 5 available umbrellas, and the beach itself is the public beach in Key West - and it SMELLED horrible. It was so unbearably dirty and smelly that we could only stand 2 hours of it. It's unfortunate that this hotel takes their guests there because the hotel itself is wonderful. Their shuttle service to and from town is also convenient, although long. I'd stay somewhere closer in the town next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOT MARRIED THERE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to an entire staff there, and our sincere thanks for coordinating our beautiful wedding. We were there for 5 days, 2 adults and 4 youngsters, and had some guests come in for the wedding weekend. The staff was superb in how they handled things, from the front desk to the wedding coordinator to the cleaning people. We believe this is one of . . .if not THE . . best values in Key West, and would love to return. A very special thanks to Shawna Wynd, our wedding coordinator, who amazingly moved our planned outdoor service and dinner to the inside within an hour. The room was breathtaking, as was the service. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone planning on staying in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Grand Key! The staff was incredibly helpful and courteous. The shuttles were great and the concierge set everything up for us. The pub crawl was a lot of fun and we rented a scooter one day and had a blast. I have nothing bad to say about this place. It isn't the Ritz, but it was perfect for our needs. The pool was wonderful and sooo relaxing. The shuttle met all of our needs as we only stayed out late the night we rented the scooter. We love Key West and plan to return each year and stay at the DoubleTree. Shelley at the bar, and the pool was a sweetie and we hated to say goodbye to her! Thanks for a wonderful week!

Reviews.Title: “Treated as second rate guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in the hotel if you book with Expedia. I booked this vacation three months prior. I confirmed my reservations twice for a ground floor with a balcony one week before our arrival and was assured I would have it. Upon arrival I ended up getting what was left because I booked Expedia and was rudely told "there are no guarantees when you book Expedia". And if the truth was known I paid just as much for my room as the other guests. Our room was ok, except for the fact that we had four tiny drawers for three guests. Needless to say we practically lived out of our suitcase for six days. I found the front desk clerks to be very rude, especially the front desk manager. Our room was infested with ants and the pool is overcroweded due to the fact that they allow locals and offer scuba diving lessons to anyone on the island so at several times during the day it was was rather hard to swim around a bunch of air tanks. Oh, and be careful of the t.v. My daughter had on a channel that offered music. After 90 seconds, it automatically bills your room, and in no way are they going to take that $11.50 charge off your bill. The restaurant was very slow and very expensive. Plan on spending at least an hour there and expect to tip bigtime, even the towel guy at the pool. The shuttle was extremely crowded and more times than none you will end up standing. There are other hotels that have better service and more friendly staff for the money. There is nothing on that side of the island so you are more or less at their mercy by eating there. Stay on the other side where there is a McDonalds, Taco Bell, etc. so you don't end up having to pay a huge amount for meals each day.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenirish
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. It is far away from the old town area but the free hourly transport solves that. Nice, large rooms, good food, friendly staff, provided a good vacation. The pool could have been cleaner but overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprized”
Reviews.Author: grapesmash
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West on business, and stayed here for work. My wife and baby were with me, and I got to tell you-we absolutely had a blast here. Don't get me wrong-it isn't a Ritz-Carlton, but the room was bright and cheery, the pool was a lot of fun, the restaurant and pool bar were great, and the overall experience was very nice. It is away from Duval, so make sure you know that before you book. It's still a small island, and they offer shuttles back and forth so it isn't too big of a deal. Lots of fun, and a great alternative in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Noise but.....”
Reviews.Author: CTJeepDude
Reviews.Content: The rooms and pool are small and the hotel has no view. The shuttle runs only once an hour to the beach and Duvall. I would skip this place. Your much better off staying at an Inn in town.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This year for spring break my husband and I decided to drive the kids to Florida. We spent 10 days traipsing throughout the sunshine state, with stops in Orlando, Fort Lauderdale and a final stop in Key West. We were travelling with 4 rambuctious boys, and I was eager to get out of the car and into a relaxing hotel room. When we arrived at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort, I was pleasantly suprised with the sense of calm that came over me as I entered the lobby. However that feeling soon vanished, when I found out that my husband had only booked one room and we were a party of six! The hotel did not have any adjoining rooms available so we decided to upgrade to a suite. We were told that the suite would accomodate us just fine. I was shocked to find that their version of a suite was not what I had imagined. our suite was little more than 2 adjoing rooms. One room contained a king sized bed, while the other room had a sleeper sofa and a loveseat. The only bathroom was in the bedroom. Try to imagine 4 boys and 2 adults taking turns in the shower every morning. We barely made it to breakfast because it took so long for everyone to get ready. The sleeping arrangements were also very humorous. I woke up one morning to find 2 of the boys sleeping on the pull out bed while my other son slept on the loveseat, and the youngest boy was asleep underneath the pull out, on top of the sofa cushions. I'm probably the only one who cared. The kids had a great time in Key west, and other than the quaint accomodations, I thoroughly enjoyed the resort and the island. The pool area was fantastic. The pool was heated and it stayed open late. At night we would all go down to the pool and hang out untill we were ready to pass out. During the day the hotel offered massages in the cabanas that were located poolside. They also have a poolside bar which my husband and I enjoyed a little more than we should have. The snacks that were served were reasonably priced and the hotel also offered a free shuttle bus to Smather's Beach, where you can rent kayaks and do many other water related activities. Key West is a wonderful place to take your family on vacation. The weather was a balmy 80 degrees everyday and there were plenty of activites to keep our kids busy. We went down to Duval street and ate some very good food followed by even better dessert. You have to get one of those giant cookies and the world famous key lime pie. We all gained at least 5 pounds before leaving Key West, but it was all worth it. My husband and I were a little worried about taking our kids to Key West, we'd heard that it wasn't exactly the most kid friendly place to go, but it turned out to be a very good choice. The water activites were the main attractions. We booked a snorkel tour down at the end of Duval St. The tour was 3 hours long and cost approx $25 for adults and $12 for kids. We travelled out to Sand Key where we saw an amazing variety of tropical fish, beautiful coral, and we also had the pleasure of seeing a school of Atlantic Dophins. We kayaked at Smather's Beach and we jet skied around the island. Every night at sunset a party was held in the square downtown. The Grand Key Resort was located about 3 miles from the action of Duval St, so we had to drive everytime we wanted to go and get something to eat or just walk around and sight see. The resort was nice but the rest of Key West is what really stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Doubletree for six nights and had a good time there. For a hotel in it's catagory it is an excellent value. The quality is basically what you would find at the nicer Holiday Inn facilities but with brighter styling and a really nice pool with jacuzi. The thing that visitors have to keep in mind is that this is Key West and all things do run a little slower down here. On one hand I found myself sometimes struggling with the slow pace of service but on the other hand it has the effect of causing you to slow down a bit. The Doubletree staff was as good as any on the island during our trip. The hotel was clean but perhaps slightly dated. But it is an extremely safe choice. It takes about 15 minutes to get down to the strip just because of the slow speed limits in force but we did not find this objectionable at all. I like the fact that it is on the other side of the island so that you have a quiet place to wind down. One night some young bucks came home from the strip at 3:30 AM and wanted to raise some cane. The staff put a stop to it immediately. The free hourly shuttle is a huge benefit although it's last pickup on the strip is at 10:20 PM. So a few times we took a cab home which ran $18-20. Something we tried the last day was a scooter rental. The max speed is like 30 MPH so you don't have to worry about serious injury as long as you don't drive drunk. It gives you a great deal of flexibility and there is ample scooter parking all over the place. Financially Key West is more expensive than most resort towns. Most regular meals for two with a drink a piece will run $50-60. We did find that we could get breakfast with juice for two for about $25-30. The abience and fraternity of Key West is simply awesome. I was rather afraid that it would be as wild as South Beach but thankfully it is an over 35 crowd that is fun to be around. It was so much fun watching people in the middle of raising families cutting loose a little bit and enjoying each other's company. Sloppy Joe's is really cool-don't miss it. Feel free to ask questions.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days and found the staff there very rude. There were a few people that were helpful but just a few. We had gone to the hotel pool bar twice and stayed for 20 min each time and not one time did the bartender come over to see if we were ok. Matter of fact more times than not we ran into the rudest people on the island. We had gone into several stores where we were the only ones in there and the shop keeper never acknowledged us. The other thing that I find very disturbing is that everywhere you go people EXPECT a tip. Even the Circle K had a tip jar at their counter. I understand itâ€™s a very expensive place to live, but come one people, we should not have to tip you for doing your job, a bad job at that! I do not recommend this hotel or Island as a place to vacation as there are way to many other places that will be happy to take my money, and give me good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BeccyK
Reviews.Content: Service is the obvious priority for all of the staff. A free telephone call for the complimentary airport shuttle was our introduction to the courteous and prompt attention we would receive for our four-day stay. When my mother and I found ourselves sharing a king-sized bed, a new room was ready for us by 9:30 the next morning. Our check-in was late, and the complimentary warm chocolate cookies had run out. We were issued a rain-check to get our cookie anytime during our stay. We were very busy in Old Town Key West during the three full days we were there. That meant we unfortunately did not have time to enjoy the swimming pool, Jacuzzi, gym or the private beach serviced by a free hotel shuttle. We made extensive use of the other free resort shuttle that provided hourly transport to central downtown locations. It was always prompt when leaving the resort, and collecting us for return. The shuttle drivers were not only friendly, but very knowledgeable and helpful toward everyone. They provided directions to various sites or areas, and made good recommendations for varied activities and dining. I have been going to Key West for 21 years, so I have a good idea of where quality services or goods can be found, and know what are "reasonable" costs on the island. Taking a car into downtown Key West these days is nerve-wracking and expensive. By staying at the other end of the island, we had quiet during the wee hours, no traffic outside our windows. The prices of resorts in the airport area are incredibly lower than downtown. A resort with comparable amenities in downtown Key West is roughly twice the price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkHibiscus32
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (both in our mid 20's) just returned from a wonderful 3nts stay at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet, clean, inexpensive and relaxing stay in Key West. The hotel is situated away from the town but after we checked out some of the other hotels in town, we definitively preferred The Doubletree which is away from all the noise and crowds. We still enjoyed the town at night with all the great restaurants, bars and attractions it has to offer but we were looking forward into returning to our hotel and taking a late night swim in the pool. All the staff at the hotel was simply delightful, always friendly, smiling and accommodating, especially Diane - the bartender. We really enjoyed having breakfast at the restaurant overlooking the pool each morning and the warm cookies we got upon arrival. Stay at this hotel and you won't be disappointed !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for a quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: cindy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nites mid March 2005. I am in a wheelchair and found everything easily accessible within the hotel. Room was a little small but pleasant and quiet. The staff people were very friendly and helpful with the exception of 2 males with lousy attitudes ( especially toward women ). I like to have a place to retreat to for R+R and this hotel definitely offered that. There is a nice pool with 0 degree entry but the jacuzzi was pretty bad. The temperature was tepid, colder than bath water but compared to other places I saw I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for Baby boomers”
Reviews.Author: rhody16
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the staff who were quite helpful. Also they gave us a suite that was absolutely beautiful.. The food was delicious. We went to Duval a few times during our stay but we were quite content to enjoy our pina coladas pool side.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the northest part of the island. The interesting/fun part is on the southwest part of the island. They do have a shuttle that goes around the island, which is fine. You can also rent scooters or bicycles. Or take cabs. I had a king jacuzzi suite. The room was OK, nothing special but definitely not bad. All the rooms overlook the pool. The pool is somewhat small, but not bad. I would have liked an ocean or gulf view...when I come back I will probably stay somewhere else because of that. Also, I did get room service and was disappointed. If you do want to be able to escape the crowd, and have a comfortable room, convenient pool and gym, then this is a good place for you. It's definitely not bad when considering the room itself. But personally, next time I come here I will splurge to get something higher-end in a more happening part of the island. This room is OK, but it seems like there are much more exciting options in Key West...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: JustBeachy4Me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our three-year-old, stayed at this hotel in mid February, 2005. The hotel itself is adequate, and the room was nice. We had the complimentary breakfast buffet included with our room. It was nice to sit out on the patio and enjoy breakfast, which was again nothing special but adequate. This hotel is off the beaten path, and the hotel shuttle was "interesting". The first time we attempted to go to downtown Key West we were piled into a van with quite a few other people, wall-to-wall bodies, one of which needed a new deoderant. Apparently the hotel had not anticipated the demand for shuttles that day, even though they were booked full. We loved Key West itself, and found it to be not as dirty as we had been led to believe. Sure, there are a few homeless people hanging around, but no one bothered us in the least. Santa Monica, CA was far worse in that respect! The sunset thingy down at the wharf was almost impossible to do with a three-year-old. You have to choose a spot early on, and then just camp there and drink. Not possible with a three-year-old on the wharf, what with the open water and all! But, overall, we saw very few children in Key West. We enjoyed a great seafood meal on the wharf at A&B Seafood Company, the best of our entire trip. We also took a Danger Cruise, it was fantastic and the highlight of all our excursions. The beaches in Key West are a little rocky, but we still had fun lounging. We rented a couple of scooters, and had a ball. I would recommend the Doubletree hotel if you're not looking to stay down in the middle of all the action. We walked (complete with stroller) down to Smathers Beach one day, and it was quite a hike, but scenic. We caught the shuttle back. Again, I recommend the Doubletree as long as you're not looking for the "all-night-party, typical Key West" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: boiwen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort. This hotel was wonderful. It was so peaceful that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel to go to Duval street. The staff was friendly & helpful. We had a superior pool view with 2 queen beds. The room was bright, clean and quiet. The breakfast buffet was delicious. As for the location, we loved being away from the crowds. Duval street is a nice place to visit for a few hours, but unless you are used to having a beer can stuck to your hand, you will be happy to find some peace and quiet at the end of the day. We have 2 children and they loved the pool, gift shop and the shuttle rides. This is a great resort for families or couples. I really can't say enough about this place. If we ever get back to key west, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mainer
Reviews.Content: I was rather skeptical when we booked our stay at The Grand Key Resort. However was so pleased with the hotel that I would most definitely recommend this property. There was mention about the hotel being far from all the action but the shuttle is so convenient and never made us feel removed. The pool is to die for especially when you need a break from the crowds. The only draw back was that we were in a room on the back side near the receiving door and one moring there was a delivery truck backing up at our balcony at 3:30 A.M !!!! Get a room either pool side or in the lower # range. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early february and loved it. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The hotel property is clean, well maintained, and relatively new. The only drawback is the location, although they run a free shuttle to get you into town. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 5 day/4 night vacation in Key West during which we stayed at the Double Tree Grand Key. Overall our experience was pleasant. Compared to the per night rate at most of the other hotels on the island, the rate was reasonable and the service for the most part was friendly. Also, the shuttle service to and from Duvall Street and Smatthers Beach was a great perk. The downsides are that the room was small and Smatthers Beach leaves much to be desired. Other than that, we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “loved it,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late October. The hotel was clean and the staff was excellent. They went out of there way to make sure we had a good time. The shuttle was punctual and the drivers were great sources of info on local attractions. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have not been on a family vaction in quite sometime, so over the Christmas break we headed to Key Wset and the Grand Key Resort. We ae glad we did! Our flight was cancelled, and we lost a day in KW however the visit was wonderful. The room was large enough for a family of 4 (two older teenagers) and very comfy. The view of he pool was nice I am glad we were not o the other side of the building, we would have missed he view. The shuttle service was good and no trouble at all.The only disappointment was because of our delay of flight we hoped to extend our visit one more night. It as ot possible (New Years Eve) We certainly will return to the Grand Key Resort.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Doubletree is located 1 mile from Stock Island and 4 miles from the south end of Key West. A 1 mile walk north puts you at Hurricane Joe's Marina and bar. 2.3 miles south puts you at Smather's Beach, (the south end ) where the voucher you obtain at the desk is good for a beach chair and towel. Smathers Beach is nice and the slight smell is from the Mangrove you can walk to on the beach 1 mile south of the Doubletree area. Check that out. Many signs informing about the trees, how a Mangrove is formed, ect. (This trail ends at Atlantic Ave. You can follow that south a mile to Higgs Beach.) Of all the beaches at Key West, Smathers has the most birds. By far, however, Zachery Taylor State Park is the best beach for views and for a good walk. Doubletree has easy access to a great, wide sidewalk that parallels the water and you can walk it for miles. If you go south on it after the sun sets, there is a stand of trees out in the water about 200 yards where 20-30 large white birds spend the night, very eerie looking. A very good restaurant, El Maison de Pepe, is north of Doubletree on that side of the road. It features Cuban food and is reasonable and a great place to go for plenty to eat. Pepe's Restaurant, in Key West, is also very good especially if you like Yeungling Lager on tap. The Gulfstream III head boat for 1/2 day fishing is excellent @ $40 and you get to see Key West from the water! The street that takes you to the fishing center is Palm Ave off of N. Roosevelt after the Walgrens. Hint: Follow Palm Ave until it becomes Eaton St. and it takes you right into Key West and you avoid all the traffic. Doubletree is very nice and sure has a fantastic pool.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our first time to Key West, we stayed here because of price. After seeing the area, we wish we would have stayed closer (the Hilton was only about $40 more and closer) and/or stayed at one of the great B&B's - they are so cute. The shuttle was not convenient when we stayed there because one of the drivers would not let us stand if the shuttle was full--he would pass us by. The shuttle only runs once every hour so we had to wait 2 different nights for another shuttle to arrive. The breakfast buffet was pretty poor also - powder scrambled eggs and other greasy, poor-tasting foods. The waitstaff service was the worst during breakfast - difficult to get drinks and get your bill. Also, the internet service was free which was nice, but it is literally in the middle of the gym--right next to the cardio machines--gross. Don't stay here if you are a business traveler or from a major city or if you are below the age of 60.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: keptreasuresOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently and when we booked on the phone they said we would be getting a mini suite. Very misrepresented. There version of a mini suite is a room with two double beds and a couch. On the phone the booking agent said there were two rooms and then we got arrived it turned out to be just one big room with a balcony. The shuttle is nice that takes you downtown. saves you from having to find a place to park, the cookies are good if you can be lucky enough to get them right out of the oven. I would not go there again. Very expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of the Doubletree reviews are just complaning about Key West”
Reviews.Author: abehunterandD
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is GREAT. Most of the bad reviews of this hotel just complane about Key West and not the hotel. And if you went to the Keys and didn't know the beaches were lousy and there were a lot of homeless people (not bums) then you didn't do your research and too bad for you. Back to the hotel, on arrival you have Bob Marley playing a stack of fresh baked unbelievably good cookies and a increadibly warm and welcoming staff. They were professional without being stuffy, recieptionist joked with me about the location( not the best but if you want the elite be willing to shell out $600 per night for the Hilton on the water.) but it is not that bad. Got my room for $179 on line rate and was very happy. The pool was very nice and to our surprise open 24 hours a day. Thats huge as you are going to spend most of the day and early evening(late for some) on the run, being able to go to the pool at 2 a.m. was nice. Plenty of sun chairs and also poolside massage is available. Lobby is beautiful with a round aquarium going from the ceiling to the floor. I will be back everytime I visit Key West. Love Key West for two or three days but after that it gets old fast unless you have unlimited funds. Smathers beach is not too shaby early, later in the day it gets very busy. On the plus side it gets raked every morning by a machine that looks like a snow groomer that takes all cig butts and trash off beach. And if you walk from property it takes about 5-7 min. Over all this is a 4 and a half to 5 star hotel and I have stayed all over Florida in some of the nicest hotels as I lived there for five years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Key Resort last June. The staff were very kind, helpful and friendly. You may need a car when staying there but there is an excellant free hotel bus which goes into Key West at regular intervals all day and evening. Read the review about bums, garbage and snorkelling. All I can say is bums and garbage can be found at all top resorts. I met some lovely people in Key West who were veterans of Vietnam and they may have problems but they were very kind and helpful and I think your country should do more to help them. But enough politics! With regard to snorkelling, take a trip with one of the many companies that specialise in diving and snorkelling and they will take you to some beautiful sites. All in all I had a great holday in Key West at the Doubletree Grand Key Resort Jenny James Chichester, England

Reviews.Title: “not bad not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price this was a decent hotel but like most of the reviews on here said its in a terrible part of town and there is no beach. The only way you should consider the grand key resort is if you have a car. If you drive here its a ok place to stay and a good value. I have to say though i was very dissapointed with key west in general so dirty and its full of bums and garbage. And i came here to snorkel because ive heard so many stories of how good the water is here but as i read in another review the water smells like sewage and it isnt clear at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Grand Key Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3990 S Roosevelt Blvd, Key West, FL 33040
